text:
Penn Station
Who has the best subs, cookie, and fries around? Yes--Penn Station. Everything about this place is so darn good! I love their bred and the subs are always so fresh and perfectly made. The adults always gravitate to the steak and cheese or the hot Italian. My kids love to get the chicken teriyaki. No matter what you get, it is always so good.   
Their fries are the absolute best and you cannot leave without trying these. They rival my homemade ones and that is something to say as mine are pretty darn good.  Also, the cookies--yes, they are shaped like a square--are so fresh and homemade tasting.
The service here is pretty good, I have been here on occasion when it seems to take a bit longer than I want, but I guess that is to be expected.
Overall, Penn Station is a win win for tasty subs and fries. Don't forget the cookies!

This theater used to be one of my favorites, but it has degraded into one of the lowest quality theaters in Ohio that I'm aware of. 

The theater itself is like most theaters; You should expect expensive food, drinks, and unhappy staff members. 

The part of the the theater that concerns me are the patrons that this theater facilitates to. Being a young person, I can understand why other young people want to come to this theater, but they are totally destroying the experience. Several isles up from me, there was a group of teenagers smoking marijuana. There are young men and women fighting inside of the theater and on the sidewalk in front of the theater and nobody seems to care.

This isn't a place I'd recommend you bring the family to. You're better off driving a few extra miles and going to the cinema by the canal.

Learned the hard way -- don't ask for anything special at the register on the day before Super Bowl.  Store was packed, cashiers were a mite uptight.  BUT... It was well worth a stop.  Great milk prices, decent and cheap produce.  Deli counter personnel a blast, and the soppresato and cappicola very tasty at low prices.  Some of the deli meats -- the ones for bottom feeders, apparently -- tend to be wet and slimy, so pay a little more and get good stuff (like Dietz & Watson).  I concentrated on meats and cheeses and was pleased with both.  But why -- WHY??? -- is it necessary to block an entire aisle on a busy day, at a busy time, to stock shelves and nobody from the store is even around?  Been there twice, will go back, but it will be as quick in-and-out as I can make it!
Never had a bad meal. The staff are well trained and even seem to be having fun while working. Great job!

now ive been to many stores in my years but this one....its different. It makes me feel....happy. I love being in here, even if I'm just wandering around aimlessly. its almost like an adventure if I do say so myself. ever need any excitement hop on into the fun train, only stop marc's

I'm just not a fan of Marc's. I realise the products here are often cheaper, but I just can't bring myself in here to get them. Whenever I go the queues are so long. The "new" conveyor belts they got are old. They need a self-check out lane and I might consider trying the place again. Also, while the store has been changing over the years to add different departments like meat and deli, the stocking of the store is interesting. The entire back of the store from the deli to the wall is now drinks or all different kinds. I think the focus needs to go off of discount in areas where discount means sacrificing on quality and store experience. And they really need to accept more credit cards than just Discover - although that in and of itself was a long time in coming!
Stopped in and grabbed a sub to go. I ordered the chicken and it was pretty tasty. It is real grilled chicken and took a few minutes to cook. They also had an artichoke that sounded terrific.

I always seem to get stuck in the "closeouts" section of Marc's buying something I didn't know I needed.  From clothing (yay for Target clothing for $2.99), to patio accessories (the Umbrella for my patio for $40!), to teaching supplies (educational games, regular games, dry-erase markers, etc.  all dirt cheap!) I'm bound to find something I can't live without.

Then let's move to the produce aisle.  Cheap produce everywhere.....and even organic.  Personally, I find Marc's has a better produce selection and of better quality produce than The Bird ever does, and generally for less $$ (The Bird = Giant Eagle).  

Across the board, Marc's food costs me less money than other groceries.  While they may not always have everything you need on your list, the trip to Marc's is worth it in the dollars you save and the unexpected closeout bargain that will make your life so much better.

I have frequently had bad luck lately whenever I make an appointment, no matter where I go (dentist, doctor, etc) where I show up early to the appointment and have to wait at least an hour after my appointment time because someone is running behind... So, rather than have that experience, I called and asked about walking in. The receptionist said it was a risk, but we could try. 

And because I can't just do the easy thing, I walk in with my sister and brother-in-law. The receptionists were a little odd -- not rude necessarily, but not welcoming -- and kept asking if we had insurance. And reminded us that because we didn't have an appointment, we would be seen when the doctor had time and that he takes his lunch at 1pm (90 minutes from when we came in). But no problem - we were trying to do 3 walk in appointments. Understandably an unreasonable request.

The three of us were all seen within 20 minutes. I thought the doctor was excellent - he was fast an efficient. He asked all the right questions - you know, the ones you don't want to answer (yes I sleep in my contacts, yes I know its gross and dangerous) - but never made you feel judged. And I also have a panicky problem when they're doing the vision test to find your prescription. When they ask what looks better, "One or two? Two or three?" I feel rushed and afraid of picking the wrong answer because it'll screw up the way I view things for the next year... So much pressure! But he never made me feel that way. Receptionists also improved once they had our insurance paperwork. Vision test A+

The ladies on the glasses side were super friendly and nice. They were helpful without hovering. Provided all the options for glasses and upgrades without making it feel like it was a hard upsell. 

So overall great experience - three people walked away with minimal wait time and glasses and contacts.

I would NEVER eat here again! They dont wear gloves when they prepare the food and I totally understand that you dont have too since the grill is right there but not everyone works on the grill and the same woman taking money I witness her cut my sub. Sandwhich was not worth $11. Jersey Mike's is much better!

I have to admit that after recently being converted to Dibella's, Penn Station really didn't stand much of a chance. I had heard so many rave reviews from friends about this place that I figured that I would finally lay it all to rest by trying it for myself. And unfortunately the result was not extremely favorable.

I would most closely compare Penn Station to Quiznos.... but not as good and much more expensive. I found the food somewhat  bland and underwhelming and when my final cost was calculated I felt gyped... or maybe raped is a better word. For a lower price I could have had a much better tasting sub at either Quiznos or Dibella's (and here it would have been twice the size).

Although the staff wasn't rude, it was very apparent that they weren't enjoying their jobs. The girl who helped us slouched and mumbled and didn't make eye contact. Although, I have considered that perhaps I'm asking too much in a society where customer service is no longer expected.

I would recommend that if you are in this area and are in dire need of a sub in your belly, head over to Quiznos which is directly across the street.

Not the place to take the boy/girl you wanna have some fun with at the end of the evening, but great for seeing a movie alone or with friends. 

The staff aren't the most attentive, but the prices are unbeatable!  You can get out there spending 10 bucks (soda and popcorn included) if you time it right and pick the perfect day during the week.  If you have a free MOvie Watchers card you get Free Popcorn on Wednesdays, plus you get free stuff at other points as well. 

I also like it simply for the fact that it's not Cinemark Valley View.. the people aren't as annoying, or maybe it's just because there are less of them.. but at Ridge Park Square I feel like I can enjoy my movie alittle better.
Guuuuuuh...Not the best one but is very close to my house so 3 stars is kinda pushing but the employees are nice so what the heck...

I had been warned by friends that the quality and service at this location had gone down. But I was sick and thought fresh cut fries and lemonade might make me feel better. I called in to place the order and was told they would not make them until I got there.I was ok with that, at least they would be fresh.  When I arrived 5 min later, I see the lemonade was not ready and  the woman who was supposed to be making it was more concerned with pulling her pants up and fixing her hair than cutting lemons.And she wasn't wear gloves so I was turned off after that.  I cancel the lemonade and just get fries. I live 5 min away. I sit down to eat my fries only to find they are ice cold, over cooked and hard as rocks! I will not be going back to this Penn Station again.

This theater is one of the "forgotten" AMC's. Somehow while building massive, beautiful new theaters throughout the USA, they have forgotten about the few that already existed. This is one of those. 

Unlike what other people are claiming, I don't recall the prices being any cheaper than anywhere else, but I admit that I wasn't that attentive since my son wanted to see the movie and I was going to have to pay no matter what the price was.

What I did notice, however, was the dirty, stained theater seats and the overall trashiness of the place. The theater also smelled like someone pissed their pants on the seat and then rubbed popcorn in it. I'm not sure that I am willing to catch VD to save a couple of bucks on a movie.

I prefer the clean, large, newer theaters that you find elsewhere. There may be one in the Cleveland area somewhere, but I haven't found it.

I would not recommend this theater.

Hands down my favorite sandwich shop!!
I get the grilled vegetarian loaded up with provolone and teriyaki sauce.
Pair it with the fresh fries and an iced tea and I'm a happy gal!
The service is always fast and friendly.
The lady manager is a delight!!

The day my doctor diagnosed me with type 2 diabetes, I called Visionworks for a diabetic check. They squeezed me in the next day. I saw Dr. Dennis Tustan who is amazing. He was extremely through, explained every test and what it would mean. He answered all my questions and even added more insight. Non-judgemental, patient, and overall a wonderful doctor.

People here are very friendly and accommodating. I had an order that was incorrect (it happens and they were very cool about fixing it). Food is always hot and fresh. Not one thing wrong with this location. Thankfully it is on a regular route for me and I will be back.

Cheers to the grocery managers!!! The store looked awesome today even though its Christmas Eve. The shelves looked AMAZING! The labels looked perfect. The only negative is that they only take Discover Card! Who knew that was even like " a thing." Lol. We wrote a check, which is also something no one veer does. The veggie and fruit selection was limited to say the least, but its a great local store. The staff was very friendly today! I know they really wanted to go home though being Christmas Eve and all. Anywho, this is a great local store. Get in there and purchase all the heavily well stocked Goya products you can get.

We visit Good Cents at least once a week. The prices are great and you can get a whole cart for about $50. They have a lunch meat and cheese counter and they always have a great selection of ice cream priced just right.

This AMC has been through a spectacular renovation that has made it our favorite movie theater! 

We've only really interacted with staff once and they were pleasant enough. The seats are really what got us hooked, they are wonderful. They are fluffy leather recliners with ample space between you and the seat in front of you. They're also paired up and the armrests in the middle of each pair lift.

Being able to sit comfortably makes watching 2.5-3 hour movies way more enjoyable.

One certain employee has went above and beyond in customer service, her name is Tammy. My Jack Russell Terrier was injured and I was facing having to put her down which was utterly heartbreaking to me. She was my little girl. (I was told I couldn't have anymore children so I got her and she filled that void along with the fact that she was my first dog and I had her for 12 yrs..) The idea of her being in pain and the thought of having to let her go was far more than I could emotionally handle. I came in with her wrapped in a blanket looking for a good soft food to switch her to.  Tammy seen that I was in a terrible state and she quickly came to my aid. Was very friendly and informative about different products. She also showed she had a genuine care for animals by asking to hold my baby girl. As she held my dog she spoke gently words of comfort, petting and soothing her. 
I was so touched that a stranger would show such care for my baby girl and be so comforting and empathetic to my situation. My little girl has went on to the rainbow bridge, but everytime I go to get food or supplies for my other dogs, Tammy is always upbeat and ready to help with anything that's needed. I just wanted to give her a big kudos for being an amazing caring person and to say thank you.

AMC Ridge Park Square is a fairly solid choice for a movie theater.  It's not fancy.  It's not super clean.  But it's is really cheap.  On weeknights tickets are only $4.25.  Yeah.  You read that correctly.

The theater isn't huge so they only show a few different movies each week.  The sound quality and picture quality are what you'd expect from a little AMC theater.  Not the best in the business, but not too terrible either.  The staff are mostly teenagers, so don't expect superb service with a smile.  

In my opinion, most theaters charge too much these days, anyway.  Unless you're going to see some huge blockbuster film with great visual effects, this theater will suit your needs just fine.
Great Sandwiches and the staff is always friendly. If you want a solid chain-restaurant sandwich, stop in.  You have to get the Italian sub-yum!

Great place for a sandwich this location they take care of you when your in a rush . I call my order in a lot and it's ready when I get there . Try the Dagwood with all the meats great sandwich my favorite. Their fries are fresh cut fried in Peanut oil great taste with some malt vinegar. Friendly staff and always offer condiments with order . Kudos Penn station!!!!
Good food. Fast and friendly service. The place was clean and the environment was nice. Definetly will be going back for more delicious subs.

Oh my God I cannot believe this. I came to town to Cleveland to visit and I'm trying to pick my girlfriend up from the airport and I stop at this grocery store. 
 I walk in and I see flowers. I go to the customer service counter and ask them if I can pay there and they said yes. I take out my credit card and they say they only take Discover, cash or check. Are you kidding me??!! let me say that again; discover cash or check what business on this planet doesn't take credit cards so I walked out. The end

I did not feel comfortable purchasing my glasses from this location.  The entire place reeked of body odor and nobody seemed to have answers to my questions.  I wasn't asking about anything off the wall, just what options I could add and what it would cost me with my insurance.  I had to tel them what my insurance covered.  I went elsewhere.  The Mentor location is a different story.  Very knowledgable and friendly staff!

The quality of Penn Station subs is very good. The taste was also good.  I ordered a Philly cheesesteak with onions and mushrooms. It was made to order and it was hot and delicious.  I didn't notice the metallic aftertaste that I remember.  My family really likes these subs, so I guess we'll be back to try other offerings.

Good service too!

If I could give this a no star rating I would!! I am completely dissatisfied with their service! I have two small dogs that I brought here to get groomed and have their teeth brushed.. for the price that I paid I thought that the overall performance would 've been worth it.. but it isn't... Ever since I picked up my dogs they have been terrified and shaking every single day!  I've never seen them so scared of humans in the 12 years they have been alive!  Then when I examined my dogs they were nicked on their backs and the hair wasn't evenly cut.  Their teeth were not brushed even though they claimed they brushed it.  They don't even smell good at all too!! When I brought my dogs somewhere else they always smelled so good and were always happy to come back home.  These people frightened my dogs to a point where after almost  2 weeks they are still shaking! I would never suggest anyone to bring their dogs here because you truly don't get what you pay for.. and unless you don't really care about your pets then might as well just bring them here..

I ran in here because it is the closest grocery store to my house and I just needed olive oil.  The olive oil was cheap, but so is the store.  Layout sucks, things thrown everywhere, looks like no one ever goes through to straighten anything up.

They obviously did not put any money into renovating this space from whatever it used to be.  You have to bag your own groceries and each bag is a nickel.  I actually support charging people for bags, but I would not want to bag all my own things.

The register I went to was having issues and wasn't weighing produce properly.  So even though I was only behind one person, it took forever.  Would rather pay more somewhere else and not deal with the inconveniences.

We came here because I have an AMC gift card leftover from Christmas in NY. We will never venture here again for a movie! It smelled like urine and mold. The only reason it gets 2 stars instead of 1 is because the staff was very helpful and sweet. 
They need to do some serious remodeling. And invest in febreze. Gross.

Came in looking for a few items i couldn't find at Giant Eagle, wasn't able to find them but was helped by very courteous workers..aisles were clean and lines were moving quickly. .i like the Marcs chains makes me feel like i am back home!

I just wanted to give an update on this location and my experience here... My one dog seemed to be ok after 2 weeks but my other dog continued to be petrified of his name and random strangers for a good month. The people that work for this company contacted me once to hear about my situation and get an email from me so we could stay in contact and figure out what truly happened behind closed doors.  And that was the last I've ever heard from them.

When they first contacted me, I thought oh good they are willing to help me figure out what happened to my dogs! Boy was I wrong! These people seem to put up an act that they care about their customers and their furry friends or family but they don't.  I'm not speaking for all Pet supplies locations but this one in particular only cares about making enough money to keep their location open. 

I would never recommend this place to anyone. If you truly care about your pets then do yourself a favor and save them the trouble and hurt.  I am just outraged by this place!

Food is always good here but the service was bad. When I was ordering the cashier was giving me a bad look. I ordered a sandwich with turkey lettuce tomato and mayo and the sandwich had no mayo. I noticed this after a few bites and they wouldn't give me another one because they said I ate to much to make me new one. It's getting three stars because the fries were good and it was quick.
Great fast food. People were very helpful and friendly. Food was hot and well prepared. Great value

I have been taking my dog Audrey here for about a year now.  They always take such care of her. She gets her nails trimmed and a wash every other month. They are always polite and it is easy to make appointments.

The theater reeked of urine horribly. We didn't purchase popcorn because of the smell when we walked in. Took our appetite away. Once inside the theater it was worse. There seemed to be some kind of issue with the speakers/sound. Sounded like a speaker was blown. The voices from the movie were muffled and when there was action the bass was over the top loud and hurt my ears. It was torture. I will never come here again. If I could give zero stars I would. The prices are a little cheaper but I would gladly pay more to have a clean place to sit and enjoy a movie I can hear.

The new store is bright and there is a huge selection of frames in all price ranges. The staff is knowledgable and helpful. They don't work on commission. I went for one pair of glasses and the price was so good I got reading glasses too. They have a buy one get one deal but also a coupon to discount your age. I'm 66 so it was a great discount from already reasonable prices. My boyfriend also got 2 pairs (one is a sunglasses). They had to redo mine because they were progressives and I wanted the reading area up higher. No problem. Fast service. No charge. Best glasses I've had in several years. Thanks, Ryan for all your efforts. The manager (I forget his name) is also very well informed and helpful. Glad I found this place.

I think Penn Station is great.... a little pricey but you do get great quality subs here.  I like their Philly Cheese steaks.   I would only give them -1 star because their subs always come with a lot of grease which i'm not a fan of.  I also like their Italian sub and their chicken subs isn't to bad either.  Their lemonade is very good and freshly squeezed.   Their fries are pretty good as well and you do get a lot when ordering med and greater sizes.  I would come back here a lot more often but It's just not healthy.  Finding coupons helps a little with the pricing but to be honest they beat out Charley's subs and way better then Subway and Quizno's and Mr Hero, They beat out Jimmy John's as well but JJ's just do cold subs so can't really compare them.

This location sometimes puts way to many banana peppers on the philly's...
Penn station has very good food and excellent service. Service is number one for me. You could have great food, but if you are a dick and your servers are snobs, I won't spend a dime there.

After rescuing two Pit bulls about to be euthanized the rescue group and some of it's donors bought me some wonderful gifts for the dogs. Although most of the gifts were perfect a few of the harnesses and clothing did not fit my big bullies chests. One of the coats I brought into the store and asked to do an even exchange for the correct size( I even showed the manager the picture of my dog in the coat) and from the beginning she was not accommodating and rude (her name was Angel). I had other items that I wanted to do an even exchange for but a larger size and she informed me that did not come from her store but the coat did. I asked her if she could help me find a larger size in the coat and she said you're just going to have to look for yourself all the clothes are down there and pointed (full well knowing there was nothing but small sizes of all the clothes). The store was not busy at all there was not one other customer in it and she full well could have accompanied me to the clothing aisle.  I came back to the register not knowing what to do and informed her there was not a larger size of the coat or any dog clothes for that matter. I asked her what can I do?  She said very snappy "well if you don't have a rewards card I'm not giving you a credit" just about as rudely as she could say. At this point I was at the verge of tears, very embarrassed and also not feeling well as I'm a diabetic and I could feel my sugar getting low. She said I had to go and find something similar in price to switch out. Being that I make my own dog food and I have a dog that's allergic to grain I just picked up some dog treats and bones things that I really did not need and brought them to the register. As I was at the register I became a bit disoriented as I think my blood sugar became too low I started to sweat and just became a little confused, she then snapped at me and said you still have $5 credit I said to her "well ma'am I'm not feeling well I feel like I'm having a diabetic problem and I really don't care about the $5" she said that's fine and ended up putting that in a card. I never saw such a lack of respect towards a customer by someone who calls themself a supervisor and all of my life. She made me feel absolutely stupid for wanting to do an even return and never offered to even call or send me to another store to see if we could find the coat that I really wanted for my dog and just made me settle for some products I absolutely didn't want. The treats that I was forced to buy actually had grain in them and caused my dogs an allergic out break!! I called the corporate office to complain about the incident however I have not received a call back and it's been about 48 hours. I find it sad that store managers somehow forget these days that people are still given gifts and I don't think asking to exchange it for the same product that fits is asking her to go above and beyond anything that she would be capable of doing!! Her name was Angel and I would suggest if you're looking for a pet store that offers customer service in compassion this would not be the place for you to go. Although she was no way responsible for my blood sugar dropping the lack of humanity for her to even ask me if I was okay or would I like to sit down for a moment never even occurred to her. She was more interested in embarrassing me about the exchange without a receipt I was doing.
Ate here a few times, never have a problem with my food. However, Customer service isn't the best. Cashier was not welcoming and looked like she hated her life.

I always bring my dog here to be groomed.  She has been groomed by Marissa, who is excellent - I've even asked for her.  She called me to let me know she found fleas during the grooming and then helped me deal with them. She even remembers my dog's name and what length clipper to use. She's always smiling and warm with me and also the animals.  And I will say this, too - Lola was groomed by a different groomer (not at the store) and the cut was not good and she had tons of clipper lines - showed me more that Marissa really knows what she's doing!

Amazing cheesesteak, fries and lemonade. The establishment is very clean, unlike most quick casual restaurants these days. The staff seemed very friendly as well. They welcome me as I entered the place, checked on me as I was eating, picked up my basket after I was done, and thanked me by my first name as I exited. Really impressed.

This review applies only to this store. I go out of my way to go to this one, and NOT to the one near my house. They are at opposite ends of the customer service spectrum.

My review for the other store will be very brief - just assume it's the complete opposite.

The manager I have gotten to know in this store is wonderful - she leads by example, and the employees have a great role model.

The store in Brooklyn has well-trained staff who seem to enjoy what they are doing. I am always greeted when I walk in, offered help during my visit, it's extremely rare for them to be out of stock of many items, and they always load heavy things into my car.

They thank me for shopping there and invite me to return. And I happily shop there frequently.
Good sushi (especially for an all you can eat place!) and good hot pot as well. It's a fun place to go to with a group of friends.
Poor customer service.  Placed to go order and received the wrong shells.  Placed a call to manager who was rude, acted like it wasn't their fault and didn't want to correct the situation.

Great place.  Friendly staff, friendly owner.  They are very kid friendly and take the time to talk to you.  The eggs and french toast are awesome!  Reasonable prices.  Love looking at farmland while I eat!

Good place! The Rangoon, soup and dumplings were all good appetizers. Sushi I would say is above average considering It's all you could eat, would actually say just as good as Mizu (dare I?) Shrimp Fried rice was tasty and the ice cream was great! I didn't get Hibachi because I feared an all you can eat it wouldn't be good but now I feel like I should have! Would recommend.

Being from SoCal, I was excited that there was a new Mexican restaurant here on Cleveland's west side. Unfortunately, my dining experience there was the worst I've ever experienced. Someone came by the table and snatched away the menus before we ordered. The waitress was unfamiliar with the menu and was unable to comprehend what we wanted. Apparently the only way to order is by number. Somehow I ended up with something I didn't want and couldn't eat. All the food at our table was lukewarm and looked like it had been prepared some time ago. None of the staff noticed that there was a full plate of food at the edge of the table and we did not see our waitress again until we stopped someone running by our table and asked them to find her for us. Finally, she laid our check right next to the plate of uneaten food and said she would take the payment when we were ready. When I commented I didn't like the food, she just said "sorry". If it weren't for the chips and salsa, I would have left hungry. In general, the staff seemed disorganized and harried. Food and service were both awful. I will not be going back.

All you can eat Sushi....
Need not say more....the food is great and the presentation is outstanding.
Bubble Tea (strawberry) us the best!!
Everything is fresh!!

This is gonna be our new favorite place for hot pot. It is so cheap. The food quality is great and quantity is a lot. Lots of variety in the sauce option , that you can mix and made, customized  our own style!! Sushi quality is good as well. Taste is awesome too. Service is awesome, they kept refiling soup. 
All of us are happy . Love it! Highly recommend!!

This is the real deal, high class all the way around. The sushi is very fresh and tasty and most importantly plentiful. There is a wide array of different types of sushi from nigiri, handrolls, and regular rolls. Some of the specialty rolls are actually named after automobiles which is unique in its own regard. I would highly recommend Kintaro to anyone who loves sushi. I also heard the hot pot isn't bad either maybe next time I'll try that but after having the sushi it'll be difficult to divert from that.

Mmmmm hot pot. I love hot pot and have been waiting for CLE to get a hotpot restaurant for some time (and am too lazy to buy the hot pot and all the ingredients myself, so having a restaurant is quite nice).

It's a large restaurant- one side is for the sushi/hibatchi and the other side is solely dedicated to hot pot. The tables have the electric burner in the middle as well as accommodating individual hot pots with individualized controls, etcera.

The waitress was Chinese and proceeded on speaking Mandarin to me the moment we sat down. haha. Luckily I can understand enough, but am pretty horrible on responding, so I just answered back in English- and the waitress switched to English for me. haha.

We did not follow the other yelp reviews and went for dinner instead. It's just hard to make it out to this area during lunch time (and seriously, who has TIME to leave work for lunch???!). Anyways, the dinner price is $24.95 (or $32.95 if you get the premium seafood stuffs) for all you can eat hot pot. So, come hungry. You'll have a time limit of 2 hours and if you waste food, they'll charge you by the pound (I mean, it makes sense, right? Just don't be wasteful!).

There are various soup bases to pick from- I always like having a mixed soup hot pot, so we got the sha cha flavor as well as the Sichuan spicy (which...was pretty spicy!). 

You then proceed to look at the menu and write down on a piece of paper (kind of like dim sum style), what you want. There's a large assortment of meats (ranging from fatty lamb/beef, liver, stomach, chicken gizzard, etc), large assortment of seafood (crab, clam, mussels, fish fillets, etc), typical balls you cook in hot pot (various fish balls like cuttlefish or homemade fish balls, beef balls, etc), and other items like many different veggies, lotus root, fish tofu, wood ear, etc etc, the list is quite huge. To me, you don't even need to get the "premium" hot pot special, because just the general is fine.

Off to the side, there's also a station where you can get various sauces and toppings to go with your food.

We got:
- Fatty lamb
- Fatty beef
- Fuchow fish ball
- Cuttlefish fish ball
- Homemade fish ball
- Fish Tofu
- Wood Ear
- Watercress

All were very good- I was impressed with the cuts of the fatty lamb and beef and our favorite was definitely the homemade fish ball and the fish tofu. We got second plates of those.

Overall, I thought the hot pot was very good. I thought the soups could be a tad more flavorful (maybe I've been spoiled from hot pot restaurants in different cities), but for the quality and amount of food you get (I mean, it's all you can eat- it's practically a buffet), I thought it was good. I think it's probably a BETTER price and choice to come during lunch, but if you're busy working ppls like us, we don't have time for that! 

If it's cold and you're craving some good warm healthy food, check out this hot pot place- and probably come for lunch to get the most bang for your buck (but I do think it's worth the dinner price- just come with a big appetite!).

The sushi and hibachi here is DELICIOUS. You cannot beat this price either! You get actual service-to and from your table-not the buffet style where anyone can sneeze all over your dinner & etc. the sushi is in normal portions and truly unlimited for 2 hours, the lobster is actual lobster and the ginger dressing tastes housemade and is so good. There is only one catch to the all you can eat 2 hours-if you have excessive food waste they will charge you $10.99/lbs for EXCESSIVE food waste. Example: you order one of everything and you eat 1/4 of your order, you will be charged $10.99 per pound for everything you didn't eat. If you leave a few bites/a reasonable amount behind you won't be charged. You can't take anything home if it is from the all you can eat buffet either. And depending on what you are ordering you may be better off just ordering off the regular menu (i.e. If all you want is hibachi and want to take your left-overs home). I will be going back here again in the near future!

I had heard about the renovation and frankly had a chance to go and experience it for myself. It's fantastic. Fully stretched out and comfortable reclining seats. The bigger the movie opening you have assigned seating. Prices are as reasonable as any theatre so I can't complain the rising cost of entertainment.  It's just a different experience what we have been used to when it comes to watching a movie. Try it for yourself and you'll see what I mean.

Mick (the mustache guy) was really helpful in explaining how my brake discs are worn out and need replacement. The oil change was also on promotion too so they took care of all the check-up in one quick service. It really helped for driving to New York for the next 6 hours. Inflated my tire pressures back to normal and helped fixed other mechanical issues. Thanks!

This is my favorite movie theater in the area. Sure the food prices are high compared to other place, but trust me it's all worth it. If you want to save a buck go during the week when tickets are less than 5 bucks! 

I've been here countless numbers of times and the one time I did have an issue the manager gave me a pass to come back for free! 

The theaters are always clean, there's no mildew smells, the seats are plush and comfy,making you feel like your at home and you get to choose where you want to sit! I mean it doesn't get much better than this place

The picture below does not give this place justice. Soooo good! This is our second time here. We came in for taco Tuesday all tacos are $1.25. (excludes shrimp and fish). Small lime margarita is $3. We had 9 tacos a pop and one margarita total bill was $17.82!!! You cannot beat the price! I will definitely be back to try the entrees.

I feel like I've said this multiple times before, but this was easily the best dining experience I've ever had. It was unlike any restaurant I've been too, which made it fun. It was also incredibly delicious. The fact that you get to customize every detail is wonderful. The atmosphere is great, employees were extremely friendly, and everything felt extremely clean. If you find yourself in the area, you must stop by! You cannot beat it!

We experienced a slight panic when we first sat down, trying to figure out the best way to order. To help you effortlessly glide through the whole hot-pot experience, here's how:

1. Come during week days lunch time
    On weekends it is reported having to wait for 1 hour to get a seat.

2. Get the $11 per person hot pot option.
     You can get sushi anywhere else. You'll only get to experience fun hot pot experience here. in Cleveland area.

3. Pick individual hot pot, or communal big pot
     Individual pot: you cook your own, eat your own ingredients. Not sharing with dining partners. Communal big pot: aka family style. Your dining partners and yourself will collectively cook all your ingredients in the hot iron plate in the middle of the table, and share food.

4. Eat person gets to pick 7 ingredients from the photo gallery menu
     All ingredients come with pictures. No guess work here. I recommend seafood over meat, because you almost force them to present you with fresh seafood. The pre sliced meat however are all frozen...feels like frozen, packaged bulk meat you get from Costco.

5. Pick your soup base
     For non-spicy eaters, go with chicken broth option. Everything else is spicy.

6. While waiting, visit the condiment stand, and concoct your own dipping sauce(s)

7. Server brings the soup pot to the table, and turn on the heat for you
     Make sure to learn how to control the temperature, so you can crank it up or turn it off later. (Shouldn't be difficult anyway)

8. Cook away!

I ordered lunch special hot pot with lamb, fish, cuttlefish balls, tofu, enoki mushrooms, napa cabbage and rice noodles. Was $10.99, and waitress was great about getting more water as I got the Sichuan broth and I was thirsty. This is essentially my favorite ingredients between when I visit my family and when I have visited Las Vegas and had hot pot there. Good portions, and definitely enough to be full.

I wanted to check if it was to my liking before I brought my fiancé along as he has not had hot pot before, and I think next time I will get the all you can eat option if I am hungrier or do 2 lunch specials if I am bringing my fiancé.

They also have sushi which I plan to try out at a later visit.

Amazing!!!
I was impressed by the wide range of selections on the dinner hot pot menu. Great options for vegetarians too.

Before the overhaul, you'd be hard pressed to find me going to Ridge Park Square. The theater used to smell like urine, a screaming toddler would be at a PG-13 action film at 10 PM, and there would always be some sort of scuffle past sundown. 

However, that's all changed now. The crowds that migrated to Valley View Cinemark are making their way back to Ridge Park Square, and with good reason. 

While there are fewer screens and seats, the makeover has done wonders for the profitability and customer experience. 

Assigned seats prevent the rowdy gangs of 15 year olds who used to sneak in mid-show. The outdated and grimy arcade games are gone. There's a fully stocked bar and a Coke freestyle machine to accompany the expanded concession stand that serves pizza and wings alone with the classic popcorn and candy. 

And those assigned seats? They're recliners, which makes me wonder how I ever sat in non-reclining seats and makes a front row seat a billion times more bearable. Even if you don't like the flick, you'll enjoy the theater.

Great updated theater!  This theater is much nicer and cleaner that it was in the early 2000's.  It now has reserved leather recliner seats.  A full bar! Your standard snack bar with a Coke Freestyle machine.  Best of all the theater is clean!
Tuesday's are discount days with your AMC perks card! It's free so make sure to sign up.

Had breakfast today and it was tasty.  However, plan a few more minutes into your scheduled visit here.  There was one waitress on duty and she was having difficulty attending to the 9 a.m. rush. (about 6 tables). Our second cup of coffee was barely warm. 
Food / flavor made up for it.  We'll be back.

I love this theater.  Like, seriously.  I live out past Twinsburg, and this is still my preferred movie theater.  
So comfy.  You can pick your seat.  You can see a Sunday matinee IN A RECLINER for about $5.  Heck yes.

We bought tickets for the 7:20pm showing of Dr. Strange. We arrived at @ 7 pm, plenty of time to get tickets, snacks and get our seats. Not so at AMC Ridge Park Square in Parma,Oh. We printed tickets and entered to find a huge line at concessions and only 2 people working but we waited. While waiting we were told that we could pay $15 to cut in line. Some people did this, we considered it, but we waited, by the time we got to the counter they were out of hot dogs which husband wanted and it was after 7:20 but we figured we just missed a few previews. We proceeded to our seats to find that our recliners did not work. I considered alerting the staff, but the movie was starting. I understand the theory of make every $ you possibly can for a business, but considering the tickets and the snacks, I spent nearly $50 for 2 people to see a movie, I think it asinine to sell cut passes b/c you are too cheap to hire more staff. This is not the first bad experience at this location. Seats were broken before and during Deadpool the first 5 mintues the screen froze then had no sound. We wont return.

Very pleased with the restaurant. The main future is certainly the expansive menu that surpasses the other sushi houses I have experienced. They have their special rolls that are in the names of Vehicle makes. I tried the BMW and Mercedes; outstanding flavor and was served quickly. The presentation was on spot. I wanted to try the lot of everything; as good as it is; I cannot afford $26 pp all you can eat that frequently. That being said it is worth the price. I ordered chicken tampora; teriyaki chicken; sweet potato roll, chicken roll, California Roll, Noodles, Edamame; and Chicken steak Hibachi. The hibachi was cooked to a great taste, serving size was incredibly fair; not too large as so you cannot enjoy anything else as Toko in Streetsboro/Kent really loads up on the fried rice (not that I am upset about a large serving). The hibachi does not cost extra either and is included in the buffet and is unlimited.  The sushi was very good; considerable to finer sushi houses I have been to around the country. There were 6 pieces to each roll and they were a little larger than I am used to which is also a plus to me. So many options that trying it all in a few trips would be a challenge.  The setting at Ridge Park Square at the old Hong Kong buffet is an interesting choice; however they have renovated the entire interior and it is stunning. I do want to try the hot pot in the near future. I went on a Wednesday and it was not that busy. However I am attributing that to it being a Wednesday and I was told during the weekend there could be a wait up to an hour which is really good to hear since this needs to stick around. The service was from an obvious trainee so it was okay but I got served by the manager more than the actual server; its not a big deal and they were not afraid to ask if you wanted more which was welcoming since you did not feel rushed. I will add some pictures I took to accompany this review. I cannot recommend this location more and here's to great success from the restaurant.

This was one of the worst restaurant experiences I have ever have. We waited over a half hour during lunch for chicken nuggets and fries for my toddler, an additional 30 minutes for our sushi, which was missing items, and my sister waited 20 minutes for a drink I had to remind our server she ordered. When we asked for a manager and our check, we were told it was an additional $15 for our food waste. As someone in restaurant management, I am appalled by the service and will never return.

Seats are really comfortable but we went to the movies on a Thursday evening and the bar was closed. What's the point of having a bar if it's going to be closed??!! That was the whole reason we picked this theater.

I have been going to movies here since I bagged groceries and fetched carts for Marc's when it was in the space now occupied by Bed, Bath & Beyond...damn that was a long time ago.  Anyways, the Theater has been dramatically upgraded: Plush, over-sized, ultra-comfy chairs...that recline- check.  The ability to reserve your seat- check.  A bar to grab a libation-check.  Watching a movie has never felt so comfortable.

I have been here a handful of times in a six month period for breakfast and our family has enjoyed it every time. French toast, sausage and egg combinations like no other, simply amazing. The added plus is that while I'm supporting a small local business, I'm also supporting local farms. Excellent quality and prices.

Came here for the $10.99 lunch special. This is a great deal for the amount of food you are given. Our group of five had a choice to either share two large pots of broth or to each have our own smaller, individual pot. We chose the latter. 

I decided on the sha cha broth with rice noodles, chicken meat, frozen crab, shrimp balls, fish tofu, dumplings and quail eggs. We received complimentary side dishes that were similar to Korean banchan. Our server was attentive and made sure our drinks were always full. They will also refill your broth if needed. 

Altogether, a pleasant experience. P.S., remember to check in for a free beverage!

We moved to Cleveland about a year ago and hadn't really found a sushi place we enjoyed yet, until we at Kintaro. It's a bit pricey for dinner, but for all you can eat I think it's reasonable. Especially considering the quality of the fish and the assortment of sushi and other menu options they have. The ambiance is nice, and the service was good.

Hmmm..... Went back about two weeks later for Lunar New Year weekend. We wanted to try the hot pot. Just so you all know, there are NO LUNCH SPECIALS ON SUNDAY!! Their menu says that, but I missed that fact. Regardless! We still ate there. Food was still quality, and sooo many options. I didn't need to eat for the rest of the day! I still think the time limit should be 2.5/3 instead of 2 hours though.

The reason I went down in rating and feel the need to review again is because this was like an entirely different experience. My server, Cora, was really bad. Like the kind of shit attitude that lets you know she hates her job, but instead of quitting takes it out on customers. Every question was answered with exasperation. Every request with an eye roll. At times she was completely MIA. She really is making a bad environment for diners. Get lost, Cora. Like why are you ruining my day because you're cranky?? As far as I can tell, she works in the hotpot section. So I think you're safe from here if you sit anywhere else.

p.s. The szechuan hotpot broth was super oily. The shacha broth was good. Cora got upset when we didn't want oil for the hotpot broth and asked to switch.

We used to stop by all the time with previous owners, and the portions were large and food was good, service had a bit of a language barrier but could be dealt with. Now the food doesn't have the same taste, very bland. Portions have changed for the worse. Our drinks had what seemed to be no alcohol in them. We got charged for xtra chips. Even thought they might be having a off day, so tried again and was even worse. We talked to our waitress and she seemed to acknowledge what we were saying but seemed afraid to say anything and the guy at the register would do nothing so we just left. Dont know if we will even attempt to come back. Seems like every corner is being cut to make profits. At the cost of quality of food and service. I too bad this was a really good place

Hot pot is something I had never done before! It is like fondue with fresh meat and vegetables baked in a broth. The sushi is also surprisingly good too! My favorites are the hummer roll and the Mini Cooper roll. Fun experience to do with a group of people and kids love it too because they can cook their food at the table!
I love this theatre! Clean, modern, comfortable reclining chairs, good popcorn and icee slushy! Best movie theatre I've ever been to! Highly recommend to anyone who wants to enjoy a movie!

I had came in here many time. The food was good and fresh and the service was good. But this time my servant was so bad and that piss me off. Her name was Hanna. We need to refill water but her isn't come and never come to ask us what we need. We have to wait for the food so long. Then she forgot our order and mess up the order. I was order some pork meat and she bring out chicken meat but at the end she said that we left the chicken over next time she will charge us for that left over. That was a bad service i ever seen.

This dinner was my first experience with hot pot and it was great, mostly because of our server who spent the time explaining everything about it. She was patient and funny with her answers to our hundreds of questions.  Our group got the all-you-can-eat hot pot and sushi.  And we ate a lot.  I stuck to the hot pot getting various menu items to create an endless combination of bowls.  Our server even created us sauces from a mixture of flavors from the sauce bar.  I washed this all down with a fantastic bubble tea. I thought I ate all I could eat and then the server asked if I wanted ice cream and for some unknown reason I had to have it too. I have never felt so full - it was kinda awesome and gross.

I want to give Mr Hero 5 stars but it's just never consistent like it used to be the biggest problem is the famous Roman Burger they hardly put any of that sandwich dressing on sandwich. I had the buttered cheese steak today it was pretty good ! Come on the sandwich is supposed to be a little oily not dry! This location has a friendly staff and is a clean orderly restaurant!
Been here a few times now. Good, authentic Chinese hot pot. Definitely hits the spot for those cravings. The lunch special is definitely the way to go. More than enough food.

I love this sushi buffet - the staff is super nice, the rolls are varied and delicious and I always leave here stuffed. I really like how you can order pretty much anything off the menu and you're guaranteed to get something good.

FINALLY. OH GODS FINALLY HOT POT. My parents who live in NEOH can't stop talking about this place. Their friends can't stop talking about this place. They happily drive an hour to get here.

The portions are extremely (Extremely! 2 meals p/p for _not_ "all you can eat") generous, and everything is incredibly fresh. The meat is unfortunately disturbingly fatty, and the broth is salty but not very flavorful -- but I say this being hopelessly spoiled because I come from the San Francisco Bay Area where there's a really great hotpot joint on every corner.

I'll happily come back here (as if my parents would give me a choice!), but I do hope they trade impossibly large portions for higher quality food.

So I haven't tried the hot pot portion of the dining experience yet, and have instead partaken in the all you can eat (for 2hrs) sushi and hibachi. All you can eat sounds fantastic, but you don't realize how filing sushi and hibachi actually are until you've ordered and realize you can't possibly eat another round. I ordered two sushi rolls and the chicken and shrimp hibachi and was done. There are a ton of appetizer options (dumplings and such), sushi and sashimi, and different proteins to add to your hibachi. But you better come hungry - like haven't eaten in a full day hungry - in order to prepare yourself, otherwise I feel like you don't really get your $25/meal worth. 

My dining partner choose the hot pot, which I would eventually like to try, though it makes me a little nervous to not only choose from all the different options, but to make sure I've properly cooked everything in my selected broth. When I become brave enough, I'll give it a shot.

Either way, the service is attentive and polite. And you are offered oranges or ice cream at the end of your meal, which is nice if you have saved any room for them.

Don't you just love that brand new theater smell? I don't know how long this AMC has been around for or whether it's undergone any renovations recently, but it looks and feels as good as new!

What appeared to be a compact, traditional movie theater by the looks from the outside shopping center, turned out to be quite spacious and modernized once inside. Theater screens were large and the sound quality of the speaker system was clear. The wide reclining chairs were comfy and well below eye-level of the screen. At one point I reclined the chair so far back that It reminded me of field trips to the planetarium in elementary school. I also thought that the red and black color palette and decor in the screening rooms gave the individual theaters a VIP-style, red carpet vibe.

The BEST place to get hot pot (or shabu) in Cleveland. You can do family style or your own pot, and it's all-you-can-eat. The options for hot pot are more extensive at night, and I would recommend going for dinner. 

If you've never done hot pot before, I would go with someone who has, preferably someone Chinese. I can understand how it wouldn't necessarily impress you if you don't know how to mix the sauces, or pick out only "safe" meats and veggies, or if you overcook the hot pot. This place is legit - no further evidence is needed than all the hoards of Asians at the hot pot tables.

(PS) My husband did their all you can eat sushi. It was good, but to me, sushi isn't what makes this place special.

My favorite movie house on the west side.  We drive from Avon Lake to watch movies vs going to Regal at Crocker Park.

The reclining sofa style seats are great and the kids enjoy the extra space.

The reserved seat is a plus using the AMC mobile app.  

Needs an IMAX option!!

My husband and I went here for the first time today! We did a hot pot and AYCE sushi. They let us share. Everything was top notch and amazing! The hot pot was so much fun and it was some of the best sushi we've ever had! Our server was lovely and was so kind to help explain everything to us several times. :) She really helped to make our first time experience a great one! Will definitely be back!

I love this place and come here weekly. 
I will do the 'AYCE' sushi option and start with a few apps/salads before digging in to sushi and sashimi.

I love that this is made to order, not buffet, and the plates that come to the table are BEAUTIFUL. The team does such a great job and everything looks wonderful, is well balanced and constructed, and is high quality.  This sushi is good not just compared to other AYCE or buffets, but it is good to other sushi places in NEO period. Great quality.  

The only part I don't care for is that the 'specialty rolls' tend to be a bit odd and are very similar to each other. I wish there was a little more variety here and a little less shrimp tempura + spicy mayo and eel sauce.  But!! The spicy scallop roll, beautiful sashimi, and regular rolls more than make up for it.

(The music is a little loud...)

I only tried the hot pot once, which was spectacular, but hot pot can never win a competition against sushi. :)

The food has been Americanized. By that I mean, it's less authentic and more bland. And kids meal options that included chicken fingers and burgers (pet peeve of mine). Portion sizes are average, but certainly smaller than most other Mexican restaurants. 

Nothing really stood out as "wow have to come back!" The ubiquitous chips were unsalted, and the salsa was just ok. Steak ranchero was pretty much bland tomato sauce over thinly sliced piece of steak. Rice was just rice. As in white rice without seasoning, hence no flavor. Refried beans were good. Was disappointed to receive flour tortillas (3) as opposed to corn ones. Guacamole salad was ok. 

With the speed of everything coming out of the kitchen, I would have to suspect everything is premade and then run under a salamander (pro kitchen broiler). Not always a bad thing, just a note that probably explains the blandness of the food. Premade usually means unseasoned so they can be kept longer.

Prices are in the $7-13 range for most things. They do have a great selection for vegetarian options, so that's a plus. Service was good, though I did overhear another table ask for their check 4x.

Hmmm..... Went back about two weeks later for Lunar New Year weekend. We wanted to try the hot pot. Just so you all know, there are NO LUNCH SPECIALS ON SUNDAY!! Their menu says that, but I missed that fact. Regardless! We still ate there. Food was still quality, and sooo many options. I didn't need to eat for the rest of the day! I still think the time limit should be 2.5/3 instead of 2 hours though.

The reason I went down in rating and feel the need to review again is because this was like an entirely different experience. My server, Cora, was really bad. Like the kind of shit attitude that lets you know she hates her job, but instead of quitting takes it out on customers. Every question was answered with exasperation. Every request with an eye roll. At times she was completely MIA. She really is making a bad environment for diners. Get lost, Cora. Like why are you ruining my day because you're cranky?? As far as I can tell, she works in the hotpot section. So I think you're safe from her if you sit anywhere else.

p.s. The szechuan hotpot broth was super oily. The shacha broth was good. Cora got upset when we didn't want oil for the hotpot broth and asked to switch.
Wow, I was surprised how great this place was for being an "All You Can Eat" place. The sushi is very fresh and the rice was perfect. Loved the avocado salad. Service is also great.

terrible, would not recommend going here to anyone, they dont have hashbrowns for breakfast, they dont give you american fries after 11am, so you get to eat french fries with your eggs? who does this?  have done 2 carry-out orders and both times they have screwed it up. i will not be going there again, i will drive to mcfarland or oregon for my sunday breakfast.

Love love love the lunch special! I went for the first time with my family and the waitress was super patient in explaining to us how it worked. She also checked on us often to refill our hot pot soups and drinking water. The gist of how it works is people in your group can get either AYCE hot pot or sushi. For hotpot you can get a personal bowl or a big bowl so it depends on if your group can agree on the broth! In my opinion, the hot pot is tastier than the sushi but honestly it's such a good deal either way. My whole family was very impressed with the overall quality of the ingredients for the price.

Very authentic hot pot. Went there for 10.99 lunch special and it was definitely a good deal for what I got. You are allowed to choose only 7 items but it was enough food. Personally I feel like if I was able to get full from the lunch special, it would be a waste of money to go for their all you can eat hot
Pot at night for 25 bucks. The quality and quantity were satisfying. If you are a student at case you also get 10% discount. The service was excellent. I would totally recommend this place if you want some special Chinese hot pot experience.
Great service, excellent food. It's right off the highway and is definitely worth a visit. The chips and salsa is addicting!
Hands down best sushi spot!! Can be a little pricey around dinner but it's well worth it!! I haven't tried the hot pot but i am looking forward to trying it soon!!!

While not cheap, it does offer something that is relatively rare--all you can eat made-to-order sushi and japanese fare.  Unlike other such restaurants, they do not (in general) overload portion sizes on side dishes like the salad or soup.  It is easy to mark your selection on a large menu sheet and ask for another as you make for round 2 and maybe even 3.  I thought their sashimi had extremely small portion size--like 3x smaller and quality was OK.  Their sushi was well made--they don't overladen the rice but still not up to par with the best.  On one serving, their sushi roll was excessively large--I thought it was wrong to make one portion that large for one person.  Overall, very good for all you can eat but the quality still is not up to par with a la carte.

Came here for a late night showing of the new Transformers movie.  If youre looking for a clean and modern theatre this is not it!  Place was a little outdated however, did have recliner seats which were comfortable.  The snack bar had my red vines so I was happy.  This theatre also has a seperate area next to the snack bar where you can purchase alcoholic beverages ex. Beer and a few different mixer drinks.

Went to the movies this weekend to see "The Forest". We ordered tickets through fandango because often times shows are sold out, and we chose our seats. When we get there, the printer is out of paper and had to wait in line which was the purpose of purchasing tickets online (SO WE DIDN'T HAVE TO). Anyways, we finally get our tickets and have to wait forever in line for concession. There was only one person working as the rest of the staff was just waiting around talking to each other. We get our stuff and go into the movie theater just to find out that people already took our seats. We were forced to sit next to a couple that were talking the entire time, not even in English. I would not come back, as I am very disappointed.
- A theatre is a theatre..but good eats and great seats. Best for dates probably I'd say.

I'm actually super sad to write this review! I loved Kintaro and thought their lunch special for $10.99 was awesome! I recently went back this week to discover that they have increased their price to $14.99. Although it's unlimited, I personally can never even finish one serving, let alone get a second, so for me this price isn't really worth it anymore. They also severely cut back on their menu, from 60 items to 40, and there's no more udon! Not my udon! Why, kintaro?? Why!? They also used to give you banchan with your meal (appetizers like kimchi and cucumbers), but they seemed to have stopped doing that as well. If you can put food away like a professional eater, you might still find this deal worth it though. For me, unfortunately, I'll have to start looking for a new lunch spot. #breakingmyheartkintaro

The AMC in Ridge Park just had a renovation done, and it looks fabulous! The seats are cushy large recliners, that lay nearly flat. They are motorized so you can choose any incline. It was clean. I am SO excited to come back again.
Unlimited sushi was pretty good , service was great - especially for a party of 12 people.

When I heard there was an all you can eat hot pot place close to home, I was sold already. I was even more excited when I got up there and saw all the different kinds of meat and vegetables and sides that there are available and how fresh all the ingredients were. The person running the front is always really attentive, especially considering how busy it has been every time we have gone and when we have been waited on the service has always been great. My favorite things to order are the Szechuan broth, the beef and the pork and their homemade fish balls. I haven't ordered the sushi there ever because I have never had any more room after eating hot pot. The broth is always good, but it think there is a lot of salt in it. Only down sides are when ordering the fish for the hot pot it has always been mushy and not very edible so definitely pass on the fish! Besides that, the hot pot has always been good if you are looking to eat hot pot without having to go through the trouble of making it at home!

I've been there 3 times in the last 3 weeks ( raised my kids right, we are Star Wars nerds!!) this place has been filthy every time! The 2nd time we went i took Clorox wipes. If the bathroom is that dirty how about these recliners? They need to scrub the bathrooms! Gross!!! I'm to the point we can go to any other movie theater. Wish they'd take some pride and clean it up!! Makes me sad

Yes they have closed...BUT it is now re opened with a new owner.
The food is very good and so are the prices. If you're in the neighborhood,
please give the restaurant a try. Such friendly servers ... and this cook knows
his/her stuff. Muy Bueno!
New name is Plaza Nueva Mexican Grill.

Went here for lunch and got the $15 AYCE hotpot. Very much worth the money in my opinion. Automatically, you get your own hot pot (you have to ask for a big communal one). Everything was fresh. Service was quick and the server didn't bat an eye when I asked for a second round. Also grab some raw eggs from the bar and try poaching/boiling them - totally recommend. Boba was also very good, sweet and creamy (NOT LIKE THAT CHINA SEA NEAR CSU CRAP).

Reclining seats that fit you and your significant other.  No more to say then this is the only theater I'll go to now.  You can pick your seats, there is a bar in the theater and its convenient.  You need to get to this place for your next movie.

In reality, I'd give this three and a half stars. I went in for the lunch buffet with a friend. 

The sauce bar is good. There's lots of options so you can experiment. They also have eggs at the bar so be sure to grab some for your hot pot! 

Service was good, they came and poured water into our hot pots and did a good job keeping our drinks full.

Broth itself was tasty. However, the all you can eat wasn't quite what I expected. There's only two worthwhile meat options. I would have liked to see a few more options like lamb or marinated meats. The quality just wasn't there. 
Also, they forgot an item at times when bringing things out but we reordered what was missed so no harm there. 

Parking is plentiful here.

I have been twice for lunch hotpot and dinner sushi.

Lunch hotpot: I loved it so much we went back just a few days later. There is so much variety and everything was super fresh. The broth were well seasoned and flavored. The make your own sauce is really what packs the flavor in. Our service both times was attentive and friendly. I crave this now!

Dinner sushi: higher moderate quality but def quantity. Lots of variety between rolls, sashimi, nigiri, apps, soups, noodles and much more. Make sure you can eat what you order to avoid the up charge! Totally understandable and they are very upfront about it. Service was not as good as during hot pot...we struggled to get drink refills.

The food was good, but the service was slow. We were seated and waited over 15 minutes to get a waiter. It seemed like some of the waitresses had no idea what they were doing.  The manager needs to step up and give more direction to their employees.  They need to be more attentive to their customers once they seat them.
I will go back because the food was delicious.

Great theater! The seats are comfortable and you never have to feel like your sitting right on top of the person next to you. Since the new seats have been installed I never go anywhere else. 

The only complaint I have is that there are always so many people talking or on their phones and never any workers walking through to see this. I would love to see employees actually enforce the rules here or at least check inside the theaters once in a while to stop people from ruining the movie for others.

Previously El Tolteca. Loved this place before it switched owners and names. Service is not what it use to be and they messed up our orders numerous times in one visit, though it wasn't the first time it happened (but will be the last). The food quality is mediocre, but good. Very disappointed. Will not return.

Still agree with my previous review, but since then they removed the $11 lunch hour special and implemented a $15 all you can hot pot, which for me is not as good of a deal.  I got plenty full at $11 and am bummed that they took off those delicious little sausages.  Still love their fish though.  I'll still come but not as often- $15 is a pretty fair chunk of change and I don't like having to force myself to eat just to feel like I'm getting a reasonable deal.  Especially if they reserve the right to charge $12 a pound for uneaten food.

Folks, I urge you to go to Taco Bell before you go here as your food will be much better and much cheaper. I had a Gordito which was horrible, lots of beef that seemed over cooked...for DAYS... my waiter seated us...15 min later asked what we wanted..I asked if it was very spicy he said no and well....it was way too spicy.. My wife got the Taco Salad, a lot of bagged chips, a substance that looked, frozen, thawed, cooked, frozen, thawed, cooked..etc..and was void of taste.. there idea of a Taco Salad with lettuce, gray beef and beans..oh a sprinkling of a cheese like concoction ... I had to beg for napkins, so we could wipe off the white stuff and the waiter was no where around..then we flagged him down and asked how was it and I told him and lo and behold..no understand sir ...then said something in Mexican and walked away... I told the person I paid 25 buck for a meal unfit for liberals..ouch..sorry..lol..ugh...anyhow, save your tastebuds.. good day!
We tried the all you can eat sushi. It was good but I had better. Price was decent for it. I want to go back to try the hot pot.

Exceptional service and outstanding food.  We we're greeted in the traditional way by the extremely talented chefs.  None of the staff were in their phones and it was all service and genuine concern.  Food and drink were prompt and detail was attended to.  I will make this a frequent dining option.  A+.

Ok. I should've known better. I asked the girl at the counter what size popcorn gets refills. Because, like you, everything at a theater is an arm and a leg. She says " any size". To which I reply " oh really?". Then we scarfed our "regular" size popcorn. Then I go to the counter  to refill. And " sorry we don't refill regular sizes". What a joke. Shame on her for not being thorough enough in enure the guest was getting what they really wanted. Good job AMC. I wont be back.

I've only been here three times, but each time has been just as lovely as the last. Their food may be a little pricey, but you pay for what you get. The quality and portion sizes are fantastic. I've ordered the all you can eat twice and I left very full an satisfied. I've had their sushi, hibachi, soups, and appetizers and I would order them all again!
I love their reclining seats and their affordable ticket prices. They're the best around town.

I found this place on the Yelp app coming from Ohio and was looking for a place to eat dinner and was craving AYCE sushi and found this place with high ratings.

This is the real deal, high class all the way around. The sushi is fresh and tasty and most importantly plentiful. There is a wide array of different types of sushi from nigiri, handrolls, and regular rolls. Some of the specialty rolls are actually named after cars which is unique and a nice spin on things. They have red tuna sashimi when I went, which lots of AYCE sushi places don't have it and was happy when they did. I ordered tons of that.

I would highly recommend Kintaro to anyone who loves sushi. I also heard the hot pot isn't bad either maybe next time I'll try that but after having the sushi it'll be difficult to divert from that.

Other then that, I will be visitng eating at this place again when I am passing through most definitely.

Very good hot pot. I have not tried the sushi buffet yet, but I had a very good experience here and I will come back soon. The whole restaurant was very clean, which was a bit surprising but very enjoyable. I highly recommend this place for hot pot.

For my first hot pot experience, I think it was a pretty great one! I picked Kintaro because I have some picky family members with me and our group of 5 was able to settle on all-you-can-eat hot pot and all-you-can-eat sushi. We split a big pot of 2 different broths (szechuan and chicken broth) and a bunch of various meats and veggies. The soups were delicious and it's basically like soup fondue in that you cook your meat and veggies in the boiling broth and then eat them. It was a lot of fun, and very tasty!
The all-you-can-eat sushi was super high quality. These aren't just your standard hand rolls or basic rolls, you can get super creative rolls as well. We found something to please everyone, and next time I come back to Ohio, this place is definitely on my list!

If i could give 0 stars I would. 30min wait time and they weren't that busy. Watched two other parties walk out. After we were seated it took atleast 20min for someone to come and bring chips, salsa and get our drink orders. It seemed like everytime the waitress left it took 20min to see her again. I ordered the chicken fajitas but never got the fajitas. A friend ordered a burrito and it wasn't even cooked! 5 different people came to "serve" us and they still forgot to bring drinks, fajitas etc. We had a party of 6 and specifically told the waitress that we were on 3 separate checks. She ended up putting everything on one bill, which was fine, but nothing was written down so we could see who ordered what so we could all split the bill.
It seemed like one waitress was serving the whole restaurant. After we were done we stood outside to discuss what we would do later that evening. Another lady and her daughter walked up and as we told them good luck, she said don't worry, I'm bringing my food back. She ended up getting her money back. That says something about this place. Never again will i eat here.

5 stars just for the hot pot buffet. I did not try the sushi buffet. Even tag also seems fresh and attractive.

I'm here just for business trip. Cannot find any other place around to have hotpot. Especially hot pot buffet of this style.

Parking is in the plaza free.

Cannot beat little sheep Mongolian hot pot but this place service is good the soup base is good. The spicy base tastes good. The vegetables are pretty fresh. Lamb taste awesome. You can tell that by your meat lovers' eyes. The big clam is off my selection next time. Watercress is so fresh! Also all the other vegetables! 

One bad thing is they don't carry even couples of fruits..... just orange... hopefully they would have watermelon in the future! I did not taste the ice cream since after having such gravy food, it's quite unhealthy to eat anything so cold. Bad for your stomach and your digestion system!

Awesome food. Horrible service the worst. Even after asking for help from another waiter. Still horrible service. Such a shame. Nice clean place. It's empty on a Sunday at 1. Food amazing. Service beyond recovery‍‍

Holy Asian jackpot. This place on the outside may look like a typical Chinese buffet... But do not dare Judge the book by its cover. It is absolutely not that. This is not a buffet, all the food is ordered them made. This is my favorite all you can eat sushi place. And I am a sushi snob. Although it is not the highest quality it is the number one place you can go for all you can eat sushi. Then there is the all you can eat hot pot... Which is high-quality. So I love to go here when it is time to pig out. I REGRET NOTHING.

The 2 stars is for the great server I had.. I went for lunch this past Saturday after reading all of these great reviews.. I must be missing something here because my lunch was below average. Thank god I didn't spend any more than $14.99. Miso soup average. Tempura shrimp soggy, cold made with undercooked panko breadcrumbs. Seaweed salad basic.
Shrimp hibachi decent. Kintaro roll served room temperature was an automatic turnoff. It was just gross, but my server told me unless I ate some of it, I would be charged a food waste fee? I gagged a few pieces down but will never return!

This is not a buffet, but an all you can eat made to order sushi and hot pot restaurant. We both had the all you can eat sushi, along with grilled calamari, hibachi shrimp and two drinks. Very good food and very reasonably priced at 14.99 per person, not including drinks. So glad we had this for lunch so we had the rest of the day to wear off our food!  Waiters and staff are all very accommodating and happy to explain any questions you might have. Restaurant was clean, decor was nice, and restrooms were clean as well. We will definitely go back with friends!

Outstanding food, friendly staff and killer breakfast. This place is next level and deserves way more attention than it gets, but I am content to not have to wait in line to get in. Best breakfast I've ever had. You won't be disappointed, regardless of what you order.

If you are a black don't even try to get a job here. Unprofessional, rude and just plain mean.  I was hired here as a server.  I was told by multiple employees that if the owner was the one who interviewed me(a stand in manager did my hiring process) i wouldnt even have been given an application because they "dont hire black people". Once I completed training I was told I was going to be called with my schedule, weeks pass and I never get a call so call them they told me they "hired too many people but  would be called so I could be a busser each weekend" , again I was never called so I just gave up.  I went here to eat a couple times and there were no new servers only the bus boy who they moved up to be a server. Horrible service I was treated unfairly as an employee and a customer.

This is the best theater ever. They remodeled it and it is fabulous. My family and I love the fact that you can buy your tickets online and pick your own seats. You just go to the theater (you don't have to wait in the long Line), print own tickets and go in.  The seats are leather and they recline (hooray). It is a great experience!!!

Dang people, them's some pretty harsh reviews.  I think that the issue here is people are coming in and ordering the wrong thing.  Don't get the all-you-can-eat anything.  It's pretty expensive and no one can eat enough to get their moneys worth.  Do what all the Chinese grandma's do- come here Mon-Sat at lunch time, pay your $11 and go with the authentic hotpot option here.
