Steak 'n Shake is one of those places you go when you want a burger or shake and you're not worried about your diet. Their menu is built around beef, but they have a handful of chicken options. In fact, I always get the chicken melt. Their shakes are full fledged desserts. 

The only problem I've ever had at this particular location is long wait times and poor service. However, Brandon, our server today, was phenomenal. He was attentive and friendly, our order came quickly and was accurate. We could not have been more pleased. 

I'm not sure if there is a specific time of day when they are better staffed. Today, we were there during the afternoon (2:30ish) when they are typically pretty busy. Maybe this is the best time of day. Or maybe Brandon is just a great server. Regardless, today's visit was great and we'll be back soon. 

Why not 5 stars? I reserve 5 star ratings for local/regional (3 or fewer) establishments whose products or services are unique and memorable. Steak and shake is a national franchise, so it doesn't qualify. I gave it the highest score I would typically award for a national franchise. I will amend the score if future experiences are significantly different. 

PS - try the Nutella shake!

Came here at 3AM (6/10) and they told me the drivethru was closed. Another time I came here was a couple of weeks ago (5/19) and they told me he dining was closed.  I don't know what's up with this steak and shake.  How can you state that your store is 24/7 and not be open 24/7.

I just went thru the drive thru.  The food is good, and the service is fast.  It is
truly fast food.  Which for a fast food restaurant is ironically rare

I love TJ Maxx stores, in general.  The stores are an excellent option for those on a budget who still like to look stylish.  They also have a decent selection of housewares and other odds and ends.

That being said, this TJ Maxx isn't one of my favorites.  Like many other establishments in Ridge Park Square, this store is a bit run-down and has an abandoned feel to it.  That's not to say that you won't find good merchandise here, because you will.  Still, it's not as nice as other TJ Maxx stores.

Personally, I think wandering through the aisles here is a great way to waste some time before a movie at the AMC next door.

Just a really terrible experience. The lady who took my order was absolutely miserable and I felt like she resented me for being there. And my cup sprang a leak so I got soda all over my shirt and car.

Today's visit wasn't my first visit to this location I've been here a few times and it appears to be about the same if my recollection serves me right so the three stars is for consistency. I usually order the same meal every time every location; a triple cheese burger loaded and shoestring fries the only variable is usually the drink, today I chose unsweetened tea but the shakes and malts are hand crafted, I love the half banana half chocolate (you must order the premium shakes the normal shakes use syrups for flavoring the premium use fresh fruit).

I arrived after the lunch rush so the place was in somewhat of a disarray, the service was excellent and the food was served up fresh and hot. I would return here.

I bought a GROUPON voucher for 2 teeth cleanings.  The first time I went, I had a nice experience.  It's modern, clean, has TV/DVDS to watch, etc.  Seems like a really "cool" dentist.  Dr. Mapes was professional and normal.  I was quoted $1k+ for repairs to some damaged fillings.  I could not afford to do the procedures right off the bat, and don't have dental insurance, so I said I'd have to wait.

When my 2nd appt. came around, I was bombarded by texts, phone calls, and emails confirming my appt.  I responded to each and every one.  The night before my 10 AM appt, my throat starting hurting and I went to bed at 8 AM.  I woke up at midnight and could barely swallow, my glands were so sore.  I called, texted, and emailed (3x) between Midnight and 9 AM when the office opened and I got no response.  I woke up at 9:45 and saw that no one had called me back...so I made one more attempt to contact them to see if I could reschedule.  At 9:52 I spoke to a receptionist who 'had no idea' what I was talking about, and literally told me "We don't care if you are sick, we have gloves and masks.  If you can't be here in 8 minutes, you are losing your voucher."  It spiralled from there and she basically said "We don't give a S*** because you are not a regularly 'paying' patient."  Then I spoke to the Office Manager, who gave me more attitude and had no explanation as to why no one bothered to call me back or acknowledge my 3 messages.  She said "We have sold over 500 vouchers and if you can't make it or cancel in 24 hours then we cannot help you."

What would've been nice, is if someone called me back at 8:45/9 AM when they open the office and check the voicemails.  They could've told me they would not be able to reschedule and then I could decide if I wanted to venture out of my bed to come in.  

It's bogus and obvious when businesses get overwhelmed with their Groupon sales, that they don't give a crap about the people who use them, as they are not REAL customers/patients. 

The truth is, I had planned to schedule my appt.s for the $1k dental work and I won't be going back there now.  I didn't 'forget' about my appt. or just not show up and try to call after the fact...I contacted them multiple times and they were total A****holes about it.

LAME treatment....so good luck Williamsburg Dental Smile keeping any of the 500+ customers who bought Groupon vouchers...I'm sure only a small fraction of those people will become long-term customers with this attitude.
I don't care what anyone says, whoppers are hands down the best fast food burger. I don't really care for their fries though I always do the onion rings.

I went kinda crazy here.  So crazy that it cost me eight dollars and some change as they charge by the pound.  I'm not mad, though.  After checking out all of the frozen yogurt options, I got half dark chocolate and half pure chocolate, I think.  I love, love, love chocolate and peanut butter together, so I went insane with my toppings:  Reese's peanut butter crumbles, chocolate sprinkles, chocolate chips and Reese's peanut butter sauce.  Oh my gosh, I ended up with so much.  My boyfriend and his parents didn't think I was going to finish it, especially since we'd just eaten at Skyline.  I surprised them all by destroying it.  No regrets.
Good staff with lots of energy.  Yummy soup, great pastry and good Sammie's .  Very consistent chain.  Best bet in this area for sure.
Like another reviewer said, hit or miss. Second time and I'm not coming back. Or maybe I'll chance it??? Let ya know...
Have eat here several times when in town. Great consistent burgers. Never crowded. A good cheap meal. Nice servers.
Simply put, this place sucks. It's the absentee management and the overwhelmed kitchen that brings this place down. Food is always good, but takes forever to arrive. Wait staff is always excellent.

These guys are great dentists. Their office is actually outside of my insurance's network, but I've been getting my dental care there anyway because Williamsburg Smile Design's dentists are so good, and the medical technology they use is state-of-the-art.  

And I figure, it's my teeth -- and I only get one pair.  So I'm going to the best dental office, instead of the one that my insurance company wants me want to visit.

I've been to several dental offices in recent years.  Williamsburg Smile Design is the best of the lot, no doubt about it.

I decided to try Plaza Nueva Mexican restaurant, even after being displeased with the previous 2 owners at this same spot.  So glad I did not let the last 2 Mexican restaurants influence my decision!  Plaza Nueva is EXCELLENT.  The food is far more gourmet than the previous restaurants.  The margaritas are awesome.  The staff is really friendly.  I will definitely go back and recommend this place to all of my friends and family.
I haven't stopped pooping since Monday. This place is brutal, dirty and gross. Do not go

Panera Bread has one of the best chicken noodle soups I have tasted since my Grandma's. It hits the spot when you are sick or just on a cold day. 

I also love the fruit salad and the tuna salad sandwich. It goes great with the soup!

My guy and I ate here on Jan 3, 2016 around 6pm. There weren't many open tables and we had to seat ourselves.  There were kids running around in the restaurant and almost bumped me to where I almost dropped my food.  There were rude people and kids without manners.  It was loud and some plates were dirty.

The staff and managers were busy cleaning around buffet food and keeping the buffets stocked with fresh food.  The ladies restroom was surprisingly clean.

There were many food choices, however, most of it wasn't very good tasting. The steaks were tasty. and we waited for Well-done  The french-fried onion green bean casserole was delicious.  Pleasant surprise you could have cotton candy in bags to take with you.  The meatloaf was a disappointment and tasted horrible.

Thankfully we bring our own plastic ware to eat our food with since the clientelle there were gross people.

We think we got sick with colds and bronchitis from eating here

I came here for the first time off a groupon for a cleaning and X-rays and I couldn't have been more pleased. The office was decorated very nicely and everyone from the receptionist to the hygienist to the dentist was super nice and welcoming. After the hygienist took my X-rays, the dentist himself actually did my cleaning, maybe because it was a slow day. But he did a thorough cleaning and exam but was still gentle. He was also very knowledgable from his recommendation for a nightguard and his responses when I asked him about everything from a bump in my mouth to cheap dental floss to oil pulling. At the end I got a nice goodie bag with a toothbrush, floss, toothpaste and mouthwash :-) I'd totally recommend this place. They actually made a morning of going to the dentist pleasant.

I have been to this location many times in the past, and it is usually pretty good. My son and I visited on a Friday night at 7pm on 11/30/2012. The line to get in was not too long, but it took almost 20 minutes to get through because everyone had to wait to be seated. Eventually we were shown to a seat by the manager. 

First off, the place was absolutely filthy! Food, silverware and napkins littered the floor everywhere.  As I looked around, every table is my section had tons of plates stacked all over them. It was obvious that there was no server taking care of them. 

A good majority of the food items were out every time I went up to the buffet. What was there had been picked over pretty good, with just small pieces or crumbs left behind. What I did manage to find was pretty good though, as the food here usually is decent.

We were there for nearly an hour, and never once did anyone come over to check on us or refill our drinks. Like every other table, ours had stacks of dirty plates that no one bothered to collect.

As we were leaving, I pulled the manager aside and told him of our experience. He simply stared blankly at me. I told him that perhaps he should be running the restaurant instead of seating people on such a busy night. Again, no response.

I may try them again in the future, but definitely not on a busy night, it seems that they can't handle being busy.

I use to love going here. there. about this last visit was sad. many food items were empty, workers didn't keep up, on re stocking. some items were warm, at best room temp. However the server was on top of her job. cleaned plates quickly, and kept pops filled without having to ask.
Never on time. If you want a cold pizza that shows up 90 minutes after you order then go ahead and order from them and good luck

This place will take your money and the owner is the worst business owner because he doesn't deal with clients directly. Their policy is undisclosed and it is a fraud! Do not make any appointments for this awful dishonest practice or you will lose all of your money and they wont care!

This place is a cluster.  Grill needs cleaning everything tastes burnt.
Very dirty overall . 4 complaints about wrong orders in the 10 minutes I was there waiting.  Very disorganized

I'm very satisfied with the service I received here. The staff is friendly and professional and I didn't have to wait at all. Bianca cleaned my teeth and Dr. Mapes took the time to go over my exam results with me in a pleasant manner. Clean and modern office with Netflix! I would recommend.

I love buffets but this one is horrible. I received a page of coupons that made me go here. Tables are sticky. Plates are still dirty. The fruit & salad area had price stickers still on the food and nothing was cut up and prepared. The man working the grill section had no desire to help and was slicing the steaks in half to determine how cooked they were and then re-grilled them

Self service frozen yogurt with clean and friendly environment. The lines move pretty fast so there is no sugar crash problem :P 
A lot of outdoor seats. It's a nice place to hangout with friends and have some frozen yogurt. The location is awesome. There are so many other store in the plaza. It can be a rest place for an afternoon shopping !

Ordered in the drive thru. Girl on the mic took a long time in took a long time to respond after everytime I spoke. Then when there's order was complete I sat in silence waiting for my total. After about 4 or so min, I asked if I should pull around. Then in my bag my fries are upside down. And only half the amount there should be. Bun on the burger good and beat up too. The picture is before I eat anything. Apparently her feelings were hurt for me asking. They need to cut the petty stuff. No need to go back again.

Your manager Barb, IF THATS EVEN HER REAL NAME; informed me that I was not allowed to receive my entire meal in fountain form. SOME PEOPLE are trying to eat healthy and would love, say, an Italian dressing fountain or a veal parmigiana fountain or a broccoli fountain as opposed to have to drink what I estimate was about 80 ounces of chocolate for my dinner. (I'm not including the tomato juice I brought myself.) 

I didn't want to get personal but let me speak about my journey: I have not been allowed to use knives or forks or even spoons since I was a child. Mom said I would be written out of the will if I tried again.  

So there it is Golden Corral. This is just very insensitive to people like me that adhere to a fountain-only diet. I encourage you to be more inclusive of fountain eaters such as myself moving forward. Man cannot live on wheezing the juice alone.

My dad was in the dental industry, so I have always received the best of the best when it comes to dental care.  I do no have insurance right now, so I bought the Groupon for cleaning/xrays/consult.  Could not be happier.  Very nice office with pleasant and helpful administrative staff.  The hygienist who did the xrays and cleaning was thorough, gentle, answered all my questions and provided good advice.  The dentist was also very nice, explained everything with no pressure to purchase additional services/treatments.  I had two cavities (eek!), and will definitely make an appointment with Williamsburg Smile Design to have them filled once I return from my upcoming travels.

Rushed service from a terse waiter with initial A.   Was too busy to bring a straw, forgot to enter items in the system, grabbed dishes before everyone was finished. Never brought a check, just left the kitchen printout on the table.  We were all disappointed.   Food was ok.

For all of the negativity in the reviews here my expectations were quite low. We came in at peek time. The place was VERY busy. The Buffet was well stocked and the food met my expectations. Our server was a bit overwhelmed but she did refill our drinks.
So tell me wtf is the point of putting a cinder block sized piece of cold ass tomato on a hot (barely) burger?!? To absolutely confuse my mouth??? Also, the service is slooooooooow and remedial.

How much frozen yogurt do you want?  You pay by the weight so you can get as little or as much as you want.  With their rotating selection of frozen yogurt flavors (I counted 16 when I was there) and every topping under the sun you'll have no difficulty finding something you like and accidentally filling your bowl.  The toppings are fresh, the yogurt was great, and the store is well maintained.  This Menchies is very small inside and has only a few tables to sit at.  They do have additional seating on their outdoor patio - So if it's one of the eight nice days we have in Cleveland - That's an option!

Sign up for their 'Smileage' card and earn one 'Smile' for every $1 spent.  fifty 'Smiles' equals $5 off your next treat.  You'll also get a special treat on your birthday.

Racist against white people. Wouldn't give us another piece of steak and just shook their heads. When the guys behind us got their second round, it wasn't a problem. Them being the same race couldn't be a coincidence. We were polite and everything. I will never give them another cent.

Alert: Food poisoning central! We walked in placed a pretty simple order. I asked for whipped cream and it was like asking for an organ. After taking a sip of the milkshake, it was clear the milk was bad or left out overnight. After bringing it to the staff's attention, they had us stand for 10 minutes to get a refund. I wouldn't go back for free ice cream!!!

The list of reasons to not go here: 
The up-sell is insane, they wanted to replace all my existing fillings, tried to sell me invisilign, and said they don't accept my insurance so I paid for my exam and cleaning out of pocket, something like $800 but it was for 2 visit cleanings. What they don't tell you is it's a "gentle cleaning" and they then up-sell on a deep cleaning. I've never heard that one before. They also have a $100 cancellation fee. 
There was no one in the place when I went, what dentist have you gone to and the entire lobby is empty? I wish I read the reviews on this place first, i see so many people had the same bad experience and now i have to find a new dentist. Don't go here.

Where's the Marble Slabs in Cleveland?  Usually there's one right across the street from a Cold Stone.  No matter - there are plenty of homemade joints in Cleveland that blow both of those places out the water.  I mean seriously... why do you need this place.  Plus come on ... it tastes like wax.  Do yourself a favor and go to Honey Hut - it's not far away.

So I can't give a fast food place a 5 star, but I wanted to make note of how impressed I was with the gal behind the counter.  There was a couple in front of me for whom English was probably not their primary language.  They were using a phone to help decipher the menu and I have to say she was very patient and helpful.  She made sure they knew exactly what they were getting, helped them make the selections that would get them the right food and helped them put in a to go order along with their eat in. The restaurant should be very proud of her.  I did not catch her name, but in case the management reads this it was Monday the 25th around 445 in the afternoon and the employee was an African American gal with a very long braid in the back of her hair.  Job well done!

Can't say enough good things about this place. 
I was a fellow physician at Metrohealth in Cleveland and needed a place for my family while training. 
There is no particular order to what I list, just as they come - 
- First impresson : so clean! never did I see such a well cleaned apartment prior to move in.
- great layout of the house : we were on the second floor ( which is the top ) and has a high ceiling that resembles  a nice condo. rooms and closet is spacious compared to many others in the area. we had good sunlight, if thats what you like. loved that the front door has direct access outside. 
- sound proof ! : never could any neighbor bother us due to noise. there is a railroad nearby by could never hear it horning with the windows and door closed. my dog did hear the occasional bark outside, i guess but he has better hearing. Couldn't even hear the rainfall :)
- dog friendly : you just need to get a dog if you plan to live hear. 
- great for walks : the closed apartment area is secure with minimal traffic so you can see lots of people doing there walking. 
- maintanence is excellent : doesn't matter what kind of repair it is, the guys are so on top of it and quick to get the job done!
- location: love that its right off 480 and walking distance to Ridgepark square. many a times did we walk over to AMC to get some popcorn and a late night movie, after buying some stuff at TJmaxx. 5 mins walk gets you to Texas Roadhouse, if you like steak. 

I'm sure there are more things to mention, but I think you get the picture, we LOVED this place. my wife of course wanted to stay longer but my job did not allow. 
Anyway, if you're looking for a place that's great for pets, small families, or singles, no need to look further.

last minute dinner  I was desperate on my home from Brunswick..  Fish hush puppies and shrimp... My husband was thrilled.. It took me 45 minutes to get home and the food was wonderful.. We could only say imagine how good it would have been at the restaurant. They have great onion rings and the beans were just the way my husband likes them  cooked.. Cod was excellent .. I now it is fried but I will try the baked cod next time..

Went to fill out an application and the written v part of the application was easy and understandable. I was approved with a $1280 security deposit required. The money was not the issue. The issue was that the "Property Manager" expressed how over worked she was and that someone had the day off. Within 10 minutes of my being in the office I learned so many personal things about the Property Manager it was ridiculous. The Property Manager also boasted about how she made all these changes and how residents just love her. The Property has a guard shack and gates at the entrance which are only down at night. They do allow big dogs which is a plus! The property itself was very clean. I however was just so put off by the lack of professionalism by the Property Manager. I could really care less about who is texting her and the self accolades. Tell me about security, events at the property, the residents satisfaction rate...etc!

I would give this zero stars if I could. I went here for an ear infection. I paid the bill using my HSA debit card after receiving the bill. It posted to my HSA account but they have been sending me bill after bill saying I didn't pay. I called them each time and they said it would be taken care of. It was not. My HSA company confirmed that they sent they money to Ridge Park Urgent Care. I think they are trying to get paid twice for the same service. If you want to pay your bill twice and receive threatening letters and endless headaches check this place out. If not save your self a world of hassle and find another urgent care. I will NEVER go near this place again!

I can't seriously complain. I mean...it's Long John Silvers. It's fast food seafood. They are trying to healthy up the menu but it's still like eating a stick of deep fried butter. Again...you know what your getting into when you walk in. The people are always nice and friendly. I wonder what those crunchy little balls of fried deliciousness that are at the bottom of the box are called?

The pizza really was not too enjoyable. Digiorno's may be better on some occassions. However, they have a special that they run all the time for $3.99 for a one topping medium! This is recession food! I brought a couple pizzas for my friends on Friday night and was the hero of the day.

First off, incredibly nice service.

Pizza burgers were great. Just the right amount of sauce and cheese. Wings with garlic buffalo  sauce were also very good. Verrrrrrrrrrrrrrrry garlicky. Loaded fries were meh. Needed seasoning. Italian sub was just ok. Bread was supposed to be toasted and wasn't. All food received was lukewarm. 

Note: if you plan on using the BeyondMenu app, save yourself the time and just call. Because they will call you if you plan on using a debit/credit card. Also the app has menu items that this location does not have.

I've eaten at Long John Silver's a few times over the years.  I am amazed that this place stays in business!  On my most recent visit to try a fish taco, I was the only person in the place!  When I walked in, the crew was sitting in the restaurant drinking soda and chatting.  When they saw me, they scurried back to their respective battle stations.

I ordered two fish tacos and it took a bit for them to make them.  The fish tacos were okay for a buck each, but nothing to write home about.  Then why the hell am I writing, you ask?  To impress upon you to not visit Long John Silvers unless they a) build a new corporate image b) offer decent food for a change! c) clean up their restaurants.

While I was waiting for what seemed to be an enormous order, I gazed about the dingy establishment.  What a dump.  It is clear that this company is hanging on by a thread.  Why don't they just throw in the towel already?  ...and I don't mean in the deep fryer.

I realize Long John Silver's has opened a few new locations, however, if you're attempting to revitalize your company, you must revitalize all your locations, not just one or two.  This particular location on Brookpark Rd is the worst...bad enough for me to write an e-mail to their corporate office.

We ordered from this location twice, and will never order from them again.  First time, food came as ordered, hot and in a shorter time frame than quoted.  Today (May 4, 2015) I placed an order for a 10-slice pizza with pepperoni, sausage, green peppers, and pineapple, as well as 15 boneless bar-b-que wings.  I had to repeat my pizza order at least twice, correcting him several times (because he confused the size of the wing order with the size pizza order, did not get all four of the toppings as given to him) and I gave him my address of 4364 (four-three-six-four).  I was quoted 45 minutes for delivery.  About 50 minutes later, the driver calls and says she is at 3364 because that is what her boss wrote down.  Needless to say, the food arrived warm (not hot), and when I called to complain, I was put on the phone with the same call-taker who wanted to argue with me about the address, stating he was give 3364.  I said, "No, I spoke with you and I know I gave you 4364, because I had to make sure you got all four toppings on my pizza."  He replied, "Did you get all four toppings?"  "Yes, but the food is not hot."  "But you got all four toppings?"  By this time, I just said, "I will never order from you again."  I do NOT recommend this location, as they do not care about their customers.  If you are going to hire someone to speak to the public, make sure they speak and understand English correctly.
Make sure you have your whole day clear before you walk into this place.  The doctors take great care of you but you will wait forever for care.

My girlfriend and i waited for 20 minutes for our small order (chicken and fries meal and a fish and fries meal). They were serving people who came after us first, there was no order to way people were being served. When i asked the girl if our number was called she ignored me and ran off while another girl was apologizing and offering bribes of free drinks for the wait. They filled our boxes with a ton of fryer crumbs and forgot to give my brother his shrimp (he placed his own order and even got it before my girlfriend and i). I doubt i'll go back again, i'll hit the one in parma with the drive thru as they actually make fast food fast.

We highly recommend this company. They refaced our existing cabinets and we couldn't be happier with the results. Excellent craftsmanship! Nate, Andy, and Nicci are extremely friendly and will go out of their way to make sure everything is done just right. They were also very kind to our dogs, which says a lot about them.

Dirty, dirty and clueless. The only reason I am giving it one star is because the food was fine. Slow service, new people left on their own yelling for help. The floor looks like it hasn't been cleaned in a month. I will never return.
Nasty nasty nasty!!! So salty I could literally not eat any of it! Not even the beans!

For what it's worth I give the place 5 stars not bad at all for a fast food fish place fast friendly service and the quality of the food is pretty good . I've been to some sit down restaurants that had horrible food and service . The staff is helpful and patient with the customers too Tks for the great lunch during this Lent season Long John Silvers!!

Prob one of my most guilty pleasures out there. I mean...it's Long John Silvers. I can't tell the chicken pieces from the fish pieces. Shrimp is pretty easy to spot but you never know. I would most like to review those amazing little pieces of crumbly things at the bottom of your cardboard container. Let's forget it's prob like eating deep fried butter and just savor the taste. Don't judge

Not the best, nor the worst.

Ordered through BeyondMenu app after reading other reviews about how poor the website/phone order has been.

Pizza is ok. Decades ago it was much better, or my memory was. Baked chicken is seasoned nicely. Ribs are just ok, being a bit on the tough side. BBQ sauce is quite good though. Prices are completely random. Some appetizers are in the $8 range, which is more expensive than their $5 medium pizza special.

Delivery time is atrocious, averaging over an hour at non-peak hours.

Like watching paint dry in a humid environment. Receptionist was exceptionally rude. I haven't been obnoxious enough, so people filling in later than me have been allowed to cut. Would rather sustain a life threatening injury than to come here again.

Second time I've been here on my lunch and both times the team has failed miserably on this occasion I've tried to give this location a second chance man boy was I wrong not only am I left hungry still I paid for a meal that only came with two piece of fish an 2 hush puppies I don't even eat coleslaw at that so now I have to sit hungry at work and these fast food people want 15 dollars an hour you gotta be kidding me can't even put the right box in the right bag I am highly upset because I had an issue here before and now I feel that it's personal I will be writing corporate about this issue as far as whoever the manager is has poor management skills and it shows with there work ethic just make sure you double check your food before leaving this place!

. What happened?  I'm confused.  About a couple things.

Beginning to eat our take-out, something just wasn't quite right.  The receipt---sure enough---said Long John Silver's.  Then how was it possible that it tasted as delectable as $$$ Halibut dinners from Delmonico's in Independence?   Got me.

Ignore the negative reviews.  Done.  Boom.  Whatever.

A delightful surprise.  I had re-discovered Long John Silver's.

Once upon an afternoon drive down Brookpark on my way home, and knowing it was nearing time for sustenance, I spotted Long John's up ahead.   Some FISH---a favorite food stuff in our household---would be a perfect choice.  It had been many years since we ate at a LJS (one time...North Olmsted) because I was The Official Home Kitchen Fish Frier in town.  (Seven Seas...Lake Erie Perch)  While watching those prices going up, up, and UP---now at $15.99 per pound---and our *other* favorite Lake Erie Perch destination, the Red Lantern at Kamm's Corners, now closed---but hopefully, only temporarily---I fignured it was worth the gamble.  Other last minute fried fish pick-ups at the usual Big Name Fast Food suspects, always seemed to disappoint.   This one likely would, too, but it was right THERE...on my way HOME...so at the last moment I pulled in.   

The Stars, the Planets, and my SUV, were indeed, fortuitously aligned. 

~  EXCELLENT lightly-battered fried moist Cod (or might have been Pollock or other mild whitefish)
~  EXCELLENT hushpuppies.  Never thought I'd ever write THOSE two words together.  Ultimate oxymoron.  The few I've had over the years were all positively nasty dry floury balls of horrid.  Until now.
~  Fries and Tartar also far better than most others serving same.
~  One of the nicest ever employees.  So naturally comfortably friendly with me.  Maybe I knew her...or met her somewhere else.  Could be, but probably not.  Just a nice person.

Pulled up reviews for the first time---just before writing mine.  Wow.  If I had read them beforehand---with the exception of Craig L.'s fairly recent 4 star---I would have probably sailed right past this fish food find.   Hope you have a remarkable visit like I did, and if you have, give LJS a break and help boost their star power by adding your reviews.  They deserve more positives. 
  
I'm all for buying "local", but my definition also includes "local humans" who work in Chains and Big Boxes.   We can't forget about THEM---they have bills to pay and families to feed, TOO.
.
The 4.99 pizza is worth the 4.99. Each time I've eaten here I haven't been blown away but wasn't disappointed either. Will most likely order here again.

The place is fantastic and the people make it even better.  This place is clean, safe, and it's the people that go out of their way to make this complex a home.

I cannot say enough about how they intereact with people and are always there to help.
I absolutely love the service that I receive every time I order from this location and their food is fantastic

wow.... I do not understand how Geppetto's is in Business...We Ordered a Hamburger medium rare with cheese and Mushrooms..the Burger was so bad that when i gave it to my Dog..he sniffed it and LITERALLY yelped as she ran away..mind you, this dog feels cat turds are gourmet tootsie rolls... the Burger was so well done and they made sure to get ALL the juices out of it...seriously i feel it was harder to make such a tasteless burger then one with taste..it came with a side of pre cut frozen "fries"...you could taste the freezer burn....well, we also shared a small order of cheesy bread..well, it was ok..nothing special...there web site you can order from...plus a place to put your visa in..well, you STILL had to call as they could not process it... The Owner has a thick accent and gets frustrated when you ask him to repeat the order...The Delivery gal was very nice and on time promised .... plus, they charge a 3 dollar delivery charge the driver does not get so you still must tip...I will never order from here again..the wonderful hamburger..the awesome fries... bread sticks 
(sarcasm folks..lol)  all together cost 18 bucks..way over priced...Frozen burgers from SPEEDWAY are Gourmet next to these folks...
We had a great experience here. From check in to check out. The staff was efficient and competent. Very glad we went there today.

There isn't a proper category for caliber cabinets on here.  Andy (the owner) will make your kitchen look like new - he even makes custom furniture!!  He built a bar for us.  It's stunning - way out paced my expectations!

Mediocre pizza. They refused to sell a side of anchovies. I won't order from them again. The manager said that it was state law that would not allow them to sell anchovies unless they're cooked onto the pizza.

What a ridiculously average time I had at Long John Silvers today.  The outside was averagely upkept. The inside was maintained in an average manner. The food was average. And the prices? You guessed it... Average!  I do need to point out the employees were overly average.

There is a 100% chance that I may or may not return.

I purchased their square deal pizza last Friday night for a party I was having and I have to say the pizza was LOUSY. It was just like eating bread. No sauce. No cheese. One pepperoni per slice. Even the pizza dough had no flavor. I would have been better off making my own pizza from the chef boy r d box. Called to complain and I even took back most of the pizza the next day because nobody was eating it and the owner had the nerve to argue with me. He kept the pizza and refused to refund my money. If you want good pizza, do NOT go here. They may save you a few dollars but in the end you will regret it.

This place not only gave me a dry, burnt pizza, but then they lied to me  and put me through hell in order to get my money back. 
What a joke. I pick up a pizza, get home and tried to eat even though the crust on the top was burnt, thinking it's only the top of the crust, so no big deal; well the pizza was burnt on the bottom as well, and the cheese was all dried up. So I call the business and ask to speak to the owner, well the guy on the phone tells me SHE is busy so I'll have to wait. After sitting on hold for a few minutes I hand up and call back, thinking they were busy. I get a woman on the phone and when I ask to speak to the owner, she informs me that she is the owner; so I go into what happened with my pizza and that I would like a new pizza delivered to me or my money back, at which points she asks me to hold, which I do for another couple of minutes until yet another woman gets on the phone and tells me shes the owner and asks me if I could help her. I'm a little upset now since the last lady lied to me and tell the owner about whom simply blows it off as well that was my daughter, so how can I help you. Well I tell her I don't know if she can since the last two people I've talked to haven't been much help and one even lied to me, again, she wants to get me off the phone and tells me if I'm not happy with the pizza to come back up to the store and get my money back.
Then when I show up to the store some guy acting as the manager looks at my pizza and tells me there's nothing wrong with it and that I can't have my money back. At this point I feel like getting into an argument with them but really aren't in the mood, so I ask to speak with the owner, and when she comes over to me, she looks at the pizza and tells me she'll give me my money back, but there was nothing wrong with it.
So, my conclusion to this is that Geppetto's idea of a pizza is one that is dried out, and burnt both around the upper crust and the bottom of the pizza; so if you're looking for dried up burnt pizza, I would suggestion you go to Geppetto's at this location, AND if you're looking for attitude from the owner as well as everyone else who works there, this definitely is the place for you to go. AND of yea, if you want someone to lie to you about being the owner, and it's acceptable behavior on the actual owners behalf, then go here as well.

Back in the "a while ago before new cabinets" time, I wrote a review of CALIBER as their business coach and I promised that someday we'd buy our cabinets from no one but Andy & Nicci...

And this past summer, WE BOUGHT OUR DREAM KITCHEN From ANDY & NICCI as promised!  

So other than the fact that 1) our new cabinets are awesomely beautiful (Cherry!), And 2) the countertops are spectacular (sequential 5/4" granite slabs from Granite City), and 3) the new lighting makes the kitchen brighter and warmer and cozier than ever...  I have to say it was all so very EEZY-PEEZY and WORRY FREE!

Seriously... EEZY-PEEZY and WORRY FREE!

Planning was fun because Andy listened with great care and brought us ideas on how to achieve the feel we dreamed of.

The demolition was fast, and well managed... Floor and carpet protection, and a speedy organized team (thanks Nate, Jake, & Kyle!), And cleaned up every night.

The installation was speedy with great attention to detail! With most of the cabinets built in their shop before hand, the guys were able to move through the Indian l install really efficiently.

And through the whole process, every step that we took, was well guided in ways that allowed is never too worry even a bit

Nicci and Andy are the bedrock of Caliber... They truly value people off all backgrounds and they are so very very incredible at seeing, and listening, and hearing, and collaboration with their clients. All this made us feel like everything was right and undercontrol!

Great Job Andy, Nicci, Nate, Jake, and Z Kyle!  WE LOVE OUR BEAUTIFUL KITCHEN!

Andy and Nicci know quality...and commitment...and partnership! I have been working with them on their business for the past several years as their business coach and I have seen them bring a little more love and warmth into the homes of customer after customer. My wife and I haven't bought our cabinets yet, but when we do, I am sure it will be from Andy and Nicci because they really understand how to make great heirloom quality cabinets that fit the needs of real families. If you need cabinets check out Caliber Custom Cabinetry...you will be happy you did!

What happened to the days when pizza had a nice crunch to the crust??? I live close by (walking distance)... So I decided to get pizza and wings. Ill start with the good! The wings are awesome perfectly cooked and good sauces... I had the garlic Parmesan and barb q. The pizza I had to put back in the oven and cook some more, it was very doughy. Outside of that, it was good!!!

I have eaten here 3 times in the last 2 months and each experience has been about the same. I went about 6;30 pm so they usually have 2 or 3 people in line when I get there but each time has been quick and the food was hot. I would recommend it for what it is.

Visiting from Charlotte, NC and needed to find a Gold's close to my hotel. Great equipment, very clean, and the ladies at the welcome desk were more than welcoming. I also enjoyed a cardio class that I walked into as well. I'll be back during my stay here in Cleveland!

Came here with family, dad really enjoys this place especially when they have lychees. I tend to have calamari and strawberries, a good selection but Watami is my preference since the sushi selection is better. Not bad at all, if you love Chinese food, you will like this place during lunch hours on weekdays, which is $7 a person. They also have cold mussels and cocktail shrimp you can peel, sort of a seafood tapas, and also warm battered white fish and seasoned clams. If you sit in the front during winter, the side by the t.v., you will need a jacket or thermal shirt from the draft.

They run the place like a PayDayLender. When I didn't qualify for their loans cash up front. And they wouldn't give me a copy of how much they were charging per procedure. Their are plenty of dentists out there stay away from this one!
Me and my family found a roach in the ice cream machine after my 2 year old brother ate some then the manager said they would take off 10-20% of the bill that's it terrible experience stay away

Save your tummy and your money. Don't even attempt to eat here. The food here is disgusting. I tried to eat but couldn't. And then when I told them the food was awfully they took $8 off my $65 bill for just my self my husband and our two young children. But that was only after they watched the video to see if in fact I had not eaten. Are you kidding me? Absolute ridiculously awful experience.

I had my wisdom teeth pulled and I was very, very, disappointed with the staff and services provided. The ladies that worked in front were very disrespectful, especially when I had to come in for my dry socket,  talking about me and how I always had someone with me. Excuse me, I just had surgery and was prescribed 3 different pain meds, I couldn't drive. They were overall rude. Kept offering me services I didn't need, even after I explained I was only there for my wisdom teeth.

questionable business/billing practices
went their to have my sons wisdom teeth extracted. not once... but, twice to get everything in order before the procedure. Paid in full! the balance before hand. 2 months later i get a bill for $250.00.... call my insurance company resubmitted the insurance forms. knocks the bill down to $50.00... today i get a bill from them for $425.00... WTF! after doing some recon... aspen is known for this type of billing practices. go somewhere else!

I've been a member of various gyms in the area and this gym is the best IMO. The staff is very friendly. The facility is always clean. It's rarely overly crowded. A good amount machines and free weights. The classes are bomb. And there's free Wi-Fi (don't underestimate the availability of free Wi-Fi). Only one amenity that would make this place perfecto. I'd love a steam room or sauna. The bathrooms have room for one. Otherwise, this is my workout spot.

The gym overall is nice with new-ish equipment. This would probably be a 4 star review based on the facility but sadly my initial interaction at this gym was not the best.
I signed up for a three day VIP pass online planning on using it today. I arrived there, ready to work out, pre-work out already doing its job, ready to get in a good lifting session. BUUUUT, no. I was told that my 3 day VIP pass could not be used because I don't print it out on PAPER. Who still owns a printer anyways? No one. Dude says, well you can go to a library. Wow. So basically I got the option of either taking my happy self back home or pay $15 bucks for a day pass - which I ended up paying since I was already dressed to workout and drove all the way here at 7am. The kid at the counter was nice to be fair and stated that he can't do anything about managements rules but that didn't change the fact that I felt bait and switched. So obviously I am not going to ever get a membership here. Have fun with your fake 3 day VIP passes.

This was my first experience. The workers were polite when seating us and we received our drinks quickly. The buffet had a few different kinds of pork and chicken along with some sushi, fruit, soups and more. The flavor of the food was nice, however, some of the items I chose were not fresh. The pot stickers were cold and the shrimp tempura was quite stale. When it came to dessert I was excited for the tapioca pudding along with some macaroons. The banana cream pie would of been better if the bananas were not brown. Overall this place could be nice if the food was freshly prepared. As far as employees, two of my friends had to ask for a water refill and the girl at one point stood at a table booth with her head down. Also I noticed while grabbing desert, a chef behind the sushi counter was staring at me uncomfortably...
Best place to workout very clean, and friendly staff . The place to have a great fitness experience classes are free with membership.

It's mostly what you'd expect from a buffet. The food is greasy and lacking in flavor. But there's a lot of it. Too bad there aren't more vegetarian options. I was mostly just able to have string beans, rice and noodles, plus dessert. Not worth $13.99.

So-so, it seemed to have a good selection, but we ended up only eating the soup and 1 or 2 other things.  ... there are SO many better places to go in Parma...just Yelp.. Hey, go to Gus's.  (I visited last Aug, 2013, just cleaning up my draft reviews, I reckon I had hoped to ad photos).

I've only eaten here once, so I'm no Hong Kong King Buffet aficianado.  However, the food was very good.  Since I'm a huge fan of Double Dragon Buffet, which is just down Pearl Rd in Parma Heights, I must draw a comparison between these two fine Asian establishments.

First, I want to say thank you to the owners who offer me choice and variety in my dining routines in what used to be the most boring area to live in terms of food - good old Parma, Ohio.  You want Polish?  Parma's got it!  Granted, both of these buffets are just across the border - Double Dragon being in Parma Heights and Hong Kong being in Brooklyn next to Lowe's.

The food is traditional American-Chinese and very solid at Hong Kong Buffet, but the seating arrangements are like a typical restaurant and not that of a 'get the hell out of my way, I want food now' buffet.  Hong Kong got this wrong, they're sort of limited on space.  Double Dragon got this right, there is tons of room and you don't feel crowded.  Plus, Double Dragon's food is a trifle better, imo.  

Anyway, I do recommend this place.  Eat up.

No website.

This place is VERY unfriendly and VERY unclean! Before you even enter the restaurant there is an old dirty wishing well that is really gross looking. It makes my stomach turn just thinking about it. 
No one there must understand English at all. I told them my Pepsi tasted funky,possibly because their machine mixed it with too much water (but the soft drinks always tasted a bit 'off' there anyways) so I asked if I could just have a water instead. The waitress never returned! EVER! 
The food tasted horrible everything is mushy and cold. I told my wife last time I'd never go there again since everytime I go there it's disgusting. I thought one more try,why not? Nope...I'm done FOREVER!!!
To top it all off,our bill was $33!!!! WTF!!!
All we had was two buffet and two rotten pepsi we didn't even drink. I guess if you eat at the specified lunch hours on certain days it's half price of that. But it's still a total rip-off if you ask me. No one there will ask you how is your meal or ask if you need anything else. Even when paying, the guy at the cash register just took my money and didn't ask any questions. I wish he did cause I had quite a few complaints. But either way,I AM NEVER GOING THERE EVER AGAIN!!! EVER!!!
I guess the people who say this place is good must have never ate any place better than this. Do yourself a big favor and save your money and take you and your family to a nice restaurant. This place is super gross!!!!!!!
A smaller food selection than other Chinese buffets, but everything I desired was there and tasted good. Friendly service. $13.99 for dinner (excluding drink).

Still the wonderful gym it has always been clean and the nice staff and convenient location is a plus ! They have the boot camp class now you can try it for free . All classes remain free of charge except boot camp . If you have kids they have child care too. Kudos Golds!
Very convenient to 480. Excellent equipment. Wide open floor. Did not see anyone laying on the machine. Get on. Get off. Very clean. Nice lockeroom.

We used to eat their every week till the service went south.

Really bad service, slow and not polite.

Wings became smaller, price went up, it sucks.

I still love their nachos, but with the bad service, I will rather not eat their anymore.

It's a great restaurant. Servers there can be friendly when they want to. The food is sometimes great, and who doesn't like all you can eat chinese all you can eat orange chicken. Low price as well I believe last time it was 13.99, a person.
Join now! Don't waste time on any other gym. If you are serious about fitness,  especially weight training,  this is the place.

7106 Biddulph Road
Cleveland, OH 44144-3339

To whom it may concern:

This was the worst experience I have had at a restaurant in over a decade! We ordered food to go on mother's day. Excited that we could provide my wife's parents with Rooster, we order from the Biddulph Rd. location. 

First, the food was the worst Roosters I have ever had, tasted, or even looked at! The wings were bone dry, looked extremely strange, and tasted nothing like Roosters wings. Being from Columbus, Ohio we eat at Roosters at least once a week, and know what good wings taste like. 

Excited about Roosters wings the in-laws were so happy. Much to their and our dismay the food was as mentioned above awful. We contacted the location to discuss the complete disaster we paid $37 for. Upon asking for a manager we were told they were busy and they would call us back. After the food had sat uneaten on the table for hours we never received a call. Finally we called back and spoke to another girl on the phone, again the manager was "busy" and the girl was authorized to issue us a gift card. 

Although the gift card was a good gesture, the food and services had already left an extremely bad taste in our mouths. Now they are going to mail us a gift card the next day Monday. One week goes by, no card. The next week goes by, no card. We call and ask, guess what, the manager is "busy". Finally after several attempts a women informed us that our gift card was on the back desk and had not been mailed; weeks after the promised Monday mailing. Oh and guess what that was not the manager we spoke to, that manager was again "busy".

If you would like Roosters stick to the Columbus Locations!

Filthy, Dirty, Rotten is all I can say. This place is disgusting. The food is greasy and the staff was annoying. I would take two sips of my drink and the server would come up and say " You wan refill?" Please they could at least teach the staff to speak english properly. The sushi is very bad and fishy, I wouldn't even think about touching the raw oysters they put out. I pass the place on the way to work every day and every morning you see a large van pull up and drop a load of Chinese people off to work, very shady.

New equipment,  nice amenities including a variety of classes, and cardio theater that planet fitness, anytime fitness, ballys and fitness 19 lacked. Staff is very polite except for the small personal trainer with the blonde hair who sits at her desk all day judging and talking down to patrons of the gym in a very unprofessional manner. I've been to many gyms in my day and have never  witnessed such behavior from a staff member and for that I give 3 stars

Good food. I don't like how it's kinda dark in there for a buffet place , and they need to change out all the ripped up booths , it makes the place dirty and nasty . Today, while I was getting lo mien, I was shocked to find a piece of hair sticking up in the lo mien as I was putting it on my plate, but that's ok, I didn't complain about it , just asked the waitress nicely to take the plate from me that's all . I'll be back again for the great food

First time here. This place was recommended by friends and family. It was my birthday so we came here with the kids. Kids love buffets! We all agreed that it was one of the best buffets we have been to. Very large selection. The buffet was out of crab legs when we were there though. I wish they offered the crab legs separately. I've been to buffets were the crab legs were sold by the pound separately from the buffet. Everything else was really good.

I must preface this review with a simple statement: I'm not a fan of buffets. There's just something about them that tends to turn my stomach. The dried out food, all those people rifling through the chafing dishes, dirty kids, it just doesn't normally translate into a good dining experience.  But this place, this unassuming place, it managed to play fast and loose with (some of) the rules. Here's the $13.99 rundown.

Hong Kong King Buffet. Where to begin. It was Christmas and we knew our options were limited. Chinese just felt right. The bright red letters, still managing to glow brightly amidst the washed out parking lot lights, looked imposing. The "G" was burnt out. Hon Kong King Buffet. The concrete lions guarding the entrance. The empty fountain in the foyer with dirt-encrusted coins lining the bottom. Empty probably because the fish that typically inhabit it wouldn't appreciate the Cleveland winter. Enter here but don't walk straight in - that's the exit. Turn left then right. That's it. No smiley forced greeting. It's a heavily accented "Merry Christmas" a grab of the menus and a short trip to the booth.

The large, open dining room is filled with tables, chairs, booths and efficiency of space is the key. There's not a wasted inch. A massive chandelier hangs as the centerpiece guiding you toward the dizzying array of culinary stereotypes that await you. There's not a single Chinese take-out menu item that hasn't been represented here. Row upon row, protected by sneeze guards, brightly lit. It's a Chinese food greatest hits album. Here's a sampling:

General Tso's chicken
Sweet and sour chicken
Chicken and broccoli
Pot stickers
Crab Rangoon
Sesame chicken
Fried chicken wings
Spare ribs
Beef and broccoli
Chinese donuts
Pork egg rolls
Chicken on a stick
White rice
Vegetable fried rice

The list goes on from there. If you like to play fast and loose with your gastrointestinal tract there's also a mélange of seafood options with everything from clams to lobster claws and, dare I even mention it, sushi. Brightly colored cubes of white and pink fish, tightly packed rice enrobed in salmon and cod basking in the light of their display like raw fish jewelry. I didn't take a chance on them.

The beer options are like the freedoms afforded the Chinese people in their homeland - limited. Don't worry, there is the ubiquitous Tsing Tao (pronounce it ching-dow if you want to impress your waitress) and the usual light, fizzy yellow macros. They even have wine if you want to kick your buffet experience up a notch.

Finish your dinner (two plate limit on seafood, please) there's a dessert bar, too. It starts, strangely enough, with multi-colored shrimp chips and then hits its stride. Cream puffs, chocolate chip cookies, finger food versions of chocolate, carrot and angel food cake, and sticky coconut macaroons. They are dry, of course, but worth a nibble if for nothing else but to round out your experience.

The food was predictable and, for the most part, tasty. It's exactly what you'd get from most of the Chinese take-out places around the city so there are no surprises. The service is quick, professional and curt. Your empty plates will be cleared nearly as fast as you can say won ton and your waters will never be empty. The meal finishes with fortune cookies and the check. As you're leaving be sure to say hello to the koi swimming around in the big tank next to the claw machine. They'll appreciate the attention.

Hong Kong King Buffet, for what it's worth, you will be forever part of one of our Christmas memories.
Just Horrible People, they act like they're better than everyone, and have horrible customer service it took them 10 minutes to give a simple refill.

Received a call/voice mail from aspen dental front office management. They informed me that they reviewed our account. And my balanced owed is $0.00 dollars....
Way to go aspen management! You the man! 
"Or women - lol "

Great price for Chinese buffet food! All the people working there are super nice. Especially the cute Asian boy who works at the front desk. He does not only do his daily chores, but also take care of his customers. Such as chit chat with some elder citizens. 
The lunch is only $6.99! I was so regret that I didn't know about this place sooner, I have ate tons of burgers for lunch. However, Hong kong king buffet has vegetables, meat and seafood for the same price. I heard from friends that dinner has baby lobster and  crab legs, I will definitely go and try it out soon!

Valarie Jacobs shared an albu
m with you https://photos.app.goo.gl/kwqhArgUQln5ZZkE2 on Google P
hoto's
The food is always good and fresh.  My husband loves the sushi and variety of seafood available.  I get a little disappointed that all the meat dishes are deep fried and covered in syrup.
This place was decent while it was opened. Closed it's doors for good a few months back. Same owner tried to open it as a sports bar but that lasted a month. Gone for good

I can say I was very disappointed with the service here. I had to come in due to a crown coming out. They charged me $75.00 and gave me a tube of fixodent. They told me when they put the crowns in they wouldn't come out and less then a year the whole post fell out. So very disappointed. After I paid over $2000 for crowns they wanted me to take out another loan for them to do dentures...Not a great place.

The best time to hit up Roosters for wings is during the day. If you go during an event like a Cavs or Browns game, the service may be kind of slow. Otherwise, the service is great. 

I have only had one bad experience at Roosters with bad service and the manager corrected the situation and made it better for my family. 

I like my wings hot, but try the garlic wings too. They're great.
I had worst experience as a beginner in this gym.Trainers are standing around most of the time, must be nice to have that job.
Horrible tasting food...vest thing there was was the white rice....the only thing you can't mess up. Sushi that sucks and everything else was just disgusting!

Returned yesterday. Nibbled at everything, had a couple of pieces of mystery sausage as they have some this time. Happy they have a couple of mini cupcakes for me to try, lo mein is what I eat here and just tried to pick at what I could. I think the best bet is the calamari.  It's a lovely place for those who love chinese and fried food but I don't think Chinese food served this way is my thing. An occasional visit sure but too often nada. Super cool choice for winter though :)

Ive never been to a more disgusting place...
EVER!!!
I mean this place was soooooooo bad.
First off the dining areas looked like a homeless shelter. The food was worse then food in prison (just assuming, but without a doubt). Me and my friends couldn't even eat the food anymore because how nasty and dirty the place was. I don't eat mcdonalds anymore but if i was forced to pick between mcdonalds and hong kong king buffet, mcdonalds would win in a landslide. And on top of that the workers give you the worst vibes, i dont blame them though, the place is comparable to a zoo. Ive never been to a restaurant/buffet where i felt i needed to shower after and bleach my stomach. I think i would rather have sand stuck in my ass then ever step into this place again. Ive already had my family prepare a eulogy incase this food turns me into a mutant zombie. To all those who braved themselves on this helpless journey to Hong Kong King Buffet, I am sorry you didnt read this post sooner.

I recently went here for their Grand Opening.  It was AMAZING!! The value was fantastic and the pierogies were phenomenal. I am so happy to have a GREAT pierogie place around here. I you find yourself in the neighborhood, stop by, you will not regret it!

Everytime I come here to ask a question they just tell me to call corporate. They don't even give me a card. They tell me to look it up. I have a box here and considering just forgetting about it. All the "services" they offer they can't provide at this location and told me go to the fedex down the street. Won't even print anything except basic copies. They have no idea about shipping options and when I asked questions about the brochures near the door for small business shipping I was once again told to google the corporate number.

Wifey and I refer to this place as "Coma Barrel" because that is what it is: carby, salty, full on fatty foods. There's good reason why they have rocking chairs out front.

Wait time was about normal for this chain, which is in the 15-20 minutes at peak service time. I simply do not understand why they never build these places with more seating. More seating = faster turnover = less wait time = happier customers.

While the food is good, it is not hard to tell that a lot of it is mass produced and then held at temperature. Problem with that is food degrades quickly. It would be nice if they didn't shave their pork chops down to 3mm because they are quite good.

Service was very good, which is normal for this chain.

Overall, not the greatest, but probably the best option along 480/Tiedeman.

It's my gym and I can't complain. They offer great discounts through any corporate company home page. They offer buddy passes and referrals.  Often we base our gym experiences on the DB's that work out there. This is a very good facility but until you start policing gym memberships based on IQ's then this place has the fair share.  Some dudes are more worried about talking to women then working out. If you are reading this and this is you......stop it. Stop talking to women and just work out. Lift weight. Run. Correct yourself but leave others alone. 

They have full court basketball and supply balls. The stationary bikes have personal TVs and fans built in. Top of the line equipment. Again it's a very clean gym. Pools, locker rooms and steam rooms. Reaching for the stars as I just wish they were open 24 hours. Well worth the price of admission. Best part is right after you work out you can swing by BW3 for a few beers to celebrate a work out. Much better an option than planet fitness

Over all really good food eggs could have been better but everything was good other than that, the soup was amazing, salad was fresh, bacon was juicy, and pancakes were fluffy, syrup was a savory sweet flavor but not that sweet very good and are waiter came to our table often overall a great experience and I would come back again.

This a great place for home style food.  The
Meatloaf is always a go to because it really tastes just like moms (or grandmas).  The atmosphere is a southern farm kind of feeling.  My favorite part of stopping every time is the gift shop in front of the restaurant!  They have the cutest things in there..old fashioned candy, baby clothes, jewelry, home and garden decorations, etc.  however this place is a little more pricey than basically everything in the surrounding area, but worth it none the less!
Clean, spacious & well-maintained. Has basically everything one needs to keep fit. Large weight rooms;  3-lane pool; hot tub; sauna; huge bike room; hand ball courts. Friendly/competent staff.

Maybe because my families Southern, maybe l just like old timey but whatever it is, l just love any Cracker Barrel!  Wish they would open in CA!  Get breakfast no matter the hour and split the plate unless you want to be as big as some of their regulars!

It's as if this store is trying to chase away business.  The policy and procedures are counterintuitive and against corporate guidelines.   Since then, I've been to two other ups stores since and the experiences were easy and professional.

I've been a member for almost 5 months now and here are my takeaways...

PROS: not too crowded, friendly enough employees, pool, sauna, large locker rooms, bright, spacious

CONS: clientele can get pretty questionable (unless you don't mind working out with grunting meat heads), cleanliness has gone downhill... on the surface it looks ok, but when you really start looking at water fountains, sinks, trash cans, etc., it's pretty gross (especially in the women's locker rooms).  It seems like surfaces get wiped down quickly, but not a lot of time is spent on actually cleaning.  Makes me weary to go in the sauna or showers.  Finally, the spin classes leave much to be desired.  If you're used to going to a spin studio, don't even bother with the ones here.

OVERALL: affordable and acceptable.  not the most amazing gym experience but also not bad enough that I want to quit today.
Place is awesome! The food is delicious! Waiters/Waitresses are attentive and quick. By far my favorite resturant. They are seriously the best. Love them!

i never have an empty stomach or a bad time here. theres this one waiter there who is a teacher, he's super friendly (think maybe his name is mike) get him he's the best. just watch out on sunday mornings......long wait time to get a table 20min or so.
It's a Cracker Barrel: you've either not eaten at one, or you're bored with it.

A great gym for the price.  I wouldn't use it if it wasn't conveniently located on my way home from work, but they have all the equipment a cardio enthusiast like myself could ever want at a fantastic/unbeatable price.  It is always crowded, but I've never been unable to grab a treadmill when I wanted to.  The locker rooms don't offer a lot of privacy because there are lots of people coming in and out (and the cleaning lady, i swear, is always lingering nearby when I change) so you sort of need to get over any modesty when changing in there.  My other tip would be to wipe down your cardio equipment before you use it because this gym doesn't encourage patrons to do so when they are done, and most people (from what I've observed) don't.  Nevertheless, free classes, a lap pool, showers, and TONS of equipment make it all worth it in my opinion!!  Staff is always friendly, too (minus the weird cleaning lady... please somebody get her out of the locker room).

Out of the three LA Fitness centers around Cleveland, this one is not as good as the others. Rarely do you see anyone cleaning the equipment when done. When you do try to clean something, they are almost ALWAYS out of paper towels or cleaning solution. It is really unfortunate because you can see the frustration on the faces of people who try to clean something and they can't. Is it really that hard to refill this crap? 
Pretty disgusting bathrooms as well. No soap, no towels, etc. There is a water fountain on the first floor the reads "Scheduled for Service". This sign has been on here for over two months. I can call a plumber and expect him within 24 hours. This is just one example of how this entire operation is run. Go somewhere else!

A little gimmicky but overall I just love the wait staff. In every Cracker Barrel, I have never once had bad wait staff. Food is super inexpensive but I would REALLY love to see some healthy options involved.

I've been here several times and I love this place. They're always nice and friendly, and very helpful. Today I just had to drop off a return for something I cancelled. Technically, I wasn't even giving them any money of my own, but the staff took the time to explain everything about the return process and what I was looking at for the paperwork. Top notch customer service!

The employees here are really nice. I never really ship things from here unless it is a company pre-paid return because it is more expensive than USPS, but I go in here to buy supplies all the time. The UPS store has boxes and envelopes of all shapes and sizes and levels of protection to fit the various things I ship out. The prices on their non multi pack envelopes is pretty good compared to other stores. They also accept credit card for even purchases as small as under $2.

I can count on UPS to ship my items on time, every time. 

When I was a kid, I lived across the street from a large catholic church. Every morning, a brown UPS truck would stop directly in front of my driveyway and make deliveries to this church. The unique sound of the UPS truck engine, the squeak of the brakes, and the single honk of the horn signified the recurring event. At that time, I called it "ups" instead of "U-P-S". 

These days, as I ride the bus to work, I see a large UPS airplane flying into Cleveland Hopkins airport bringing the Cleveland area's UPS deliveries on a consistent schedule. A few minutes later, I usually see the FedEx airplane too! When I see these planes flying in the sky, I can't help but to think, "There's the real Santa!" These airplanes are not a far cry from the flying reindeer and sleigh bit either.

This UPS store is fast and efficient. I can count on the UPS truck making its daily pickup at 7:00 PM sharp. So I know I have to be there before that time to ensure my package goes out that day. And then my package will be taken to the UPS hub by the airport. From there, it gets loaded onto that plane and probably flown to the main Louisville, KY hub for distribution.

We take so much for granted with freight companies, but having worked for a global manufacturer, I learned more about shipping logistics. Having a brick and mortar presence close to home is very helpful for me. It helps me be a better ebay salesman. If I need to return an item via RMA to a manufacturer, this is where I go.

Now, don't even think about using UPS (or Fedex, for that matter) to ship something back to China. You definitely want to use the USPS for that because it will cost a fraction of what UPS would charge you, unless you've been provided with a UPS pre-paid shipping label to China, but that would most certainly not happen. If you're shipping anywhere North America, UPS is usually competitively priced.

They sell shipping supplies such as boxes, labels, and tape and the service has always been fast and friendly for me.

Decent gym. Horrible prices. Memberships are sold on commission for employees, many hidden fees, do not communicate anything well with you. I ended up paying $255 just over a 3 month period. They make everything more difficult than it needs to be. I am a fitness advocate and can honestly say the business side of things ruins such a nice facility.

Service was good. My meal was not complicated but was cooked poorly. I was offered to have it re-done. Was surprised by overlooked bacon 5 more seconds and they would have burned it and my undercooked and over cooked scrambled eggs that were obviously just cracked on the griddle. I am surprised as eat at Cracker Barrel a lot around the country. I have eaten at this one multiple times so I am writing this visit off as a one off. But hope they get to standard quickly.

We went there for a late breakfast. I had the Smokehouse breakfast. The sausage links were good, the scrambled eggs not so, VERY bland, I told my wife "even the scrambled eggs I 
make at home are better than this". The biscuits and gravy were good. Our granddaughter
only had yogurt parfait, we tasted the fruit, it had a more sour taste than usual. My wife had the old timers breakfast...the "over easy" eggs were runny. The service was slow, and the restaurant was only 50% full. We were disappointed.

I really like the breakfast here at Cracker Barrel. It has plenty of items and you can make changes if desired. The last couple of times though the service was somewhat slow. It took a while to get our food on both occasions. The last time the server never brought out the coffee and we waited for her to come back to the table. She brought out our food order and we asked again about coffee. She apologized that she had been waiting for our food to be ready and didn't hear us order the coffee. You know how it feels to really want that cup of coffee and you are waiting and waiting! Other than that the breakfast was great and just what we wanted. So there are some improvements that can be made but I will still go back.

When the facility is in working order, this is one of the better LA Fitnesses I've been to. The members here are like a community, and are always looking to welcome more. The trainers here are a lot like most franchise"personal trainers." Poorly trained, and mostly there to talk sports or pick up girls. 

The jacuzzi is one of the biggest selling points, if you're a LA Fitness member, to this gym. Unfortunately, it's down as much as it is up. 

All in all, this location he what you need to hit any goal you are trying to achieve. Give it a go.

The company does not stand behind their faulty work. They incorrectly attached my gutters and, when I contacted them about the issue, the owner claimed he did not install my gutters (his son did the work). Also one of the downspouts they installed has rusted. I gave them the opportunity to take care of this. Now I have to hire a more reputable company to correct this mess.

The service was AMAZING! She was sweet as can be. I got Mama's Pancakes and Ray got Mama's French Toast. Came with Eggs, Bacon and cute little warm bottles of maple syrup. You should definitely go here! Bonus is the RV parking spaces behind the restaurant. Fit our giant moving truck without a problem.

A great new facility that this area certainly needed. I'd love to see an LA Fitness somewhere downtown but this will do for now. The place is usually kept clean though no on wipes anything off, ever. Maybe in part because there are so few cleaning supply stations in the gym. Two times I have come here they were completely out of paper towel. Another time there was no soap at all in the locker room. The staff is pretty lax about everything, paying little attention to almost nothing besides chatting with other workers of eating their next meal. Also, might I recommend you place the membership tag scanners on the counter so the members can can their own phones. If the bimbo at the front desk drops my 1,100 dollar phone and breaks it, who's paying for it? Hmm...

Stopped in here while I was on a business trip in Cleveland. The main reason I was here (other than it being across the street from the hotel I was staying at) was that I was wanting to do something after work that night and after dinner. Their gift shop always has a little bit of everything - you can find a gift for yourself or someone else. With it being just before Christmas, I found a cute table top tree decoration for home.

I've been working out here for a little over a month. The staff - Jake, Allen, and Ariana are all very helpful. Ariana is my trainer and she works with me to give me a workout to suit my needs. She is available whenever I have questions. I wouldn't hesitate to sign up at this location.

I used to love going there.  Had chicken and dumpling, always get extra for the next day, never again.  Chicken was so over cooked it was like mush, dumplings were so under seasoned.  Hubby got a rib eye?  At least that is what it said on menu.  Not sure what kind of shoe it came off of.  Talked to manager but he said he tasted the chicken and dumplings and HE liked it.  I have been going there for over 30 years and I will NOT be returning,  So if you like the way it used to taste good luck.  Server and cashier were friendly and helpful until the manager saw one cashier helping me, told her to get back behind the counter (no one was waiting)

One of my favorite gyms in the area. Great atmosphere, friendly people (I have heard different though), cleaner than other gyms. Not the cleanest showers or locker rooms, but for the most part it is better than what I've experienced in other corporate gyms. People working at the front desk are not very friendly but they aren't the reason I'm going to the gym anyways :)
I wish there were more than 1 squat rack!!! At the very least, 2 are necessary with how busy the place gets at peak hours. I also would prefer some type of GHD as well, there are machines that can get the job done but it's not quite the same. 
Overall I'd recommend this gym. 100000x better than PF, and pretty solid for the price compared to the areas privately owned gyms.

I have been a member for a long time. I have only been to the Brooklyn one a handful of times. It gets very busy during peek times, the one in Westlake gets busy as well but it much bigger and seems to handle the traffic much better overall not a bad gym

If you're looking for a country cooking type of meal, Cracker Barrel is definitely the spot. The pancakes are really good, the sides are tasty, & the biscuits & corn muffins are plentiful. 

I love chicken & dumplings typically, but that was one of the dishes that I was disappointed in. It lacked flavor. The chopped steak was flavorless as well. The quality of the meat was pretty below average.

Surprisingly, my favorite dish here is their crispy chicken salad. The salad is fresh, loaded with chicken, & they give you more than enough!

Why pay a membership just wait for a few young guys to walk in and stroll in with them while one of you flash a membership and the rest of you walk in for free. Weak front desk staff let to many non paying members in with no confrontation.
