Just like any LA Fitness, this one is clean and has a variety of fitness gear.  The only difference with this LA Fitness is that there is a basketball court for members along with racquetball courts.  There is a separate room for classes such as Zumba and another room for spinning.

Some cons.... There isn't a full track for you runners out there... The pool can be visible to people outside the facility before and right when you walk in... Clock is not placed at the head of the pool like most places.. no towel racks in the pool area so just put it on the ground.. 

Some pros... Saunas located in each locker room.. lots of free weights available... Cardio machines are all upstairs or in the spinning room... Cleanliness of the gym.. classes available throughout the week.... Plenty of parking spaces around the gym when it gets busy..


Overall this is a great clean gym with lots of fitness gear available for members to use..  it is definitely nice seeing employees clean the machines during the day.. I'm not really sure if they are there to clean right after you hop off the machines because I've been seeing employees wipe down every machine after someone uses it... Which is definitely nice! The only thing I have a complaint about this gym is when I see employees walk around with gloves and touch everything.  I do not know what you have been cleaning or touching.  I saw the employees come out of the locker room and go around touching the walls and drinking fountain with their gloves.. the only thing that goes through my mind is that you may have cleaned the toilets and continued touching everything in site... Other then that... Great gym and highly recommended for those who are motivated to stay fit or jump on the road to good health!

LA Fitness is a great addition to the Parma/Brooklyn area!  It is conveniently located right on Teideman Rd. right off of I480.  When you first walk into the new facility there is an area with community style desks and computers, which is great to finish up last minute deadlines after your workout or even have young adults finish homework while while mom and dad work out.  
The lap pool and hot tub sit to the right of the information desk behind glass panels.  There are five lanes or so to do laps and a decently large hot tub that can hold up to about twenty people.  When we were there no one else came into the hot tub so it was nice and private, however the jets seemed to be broken.  Hopefully they are up and working next time.
The facility has a few private racquetball courts, cycling studio and a yoga/Pilates/zumba studio.  All seem to be included with price of membership.
There is also a gym (not full size) where pick up basketball was going on.
The multi level complex has new state of the art treadmills, bikes, cardio machines, step machines and weight machines.  Nearly all the cardio machines have tvs and places to plug in ipods. They have a large free weight area and mat area equipped with medicine balls, foam rollers, workout balls, etc.  This place really has all you could possibly want when wanting to complete a full workout.  The locker rooms each even have good sized saunas.
The only thing I wish they did have was a track to run around.  I'm not a huge fan of treadmills, so that would be nice.
Everything is super clean and new and the people at the front desk were very friendly! I would highly recommend if you are looking for very nice place to work out.

Probably the dirtiest LA I've ever been to.  Cardio machines are caked with dried sweat stains from what appears to be users from a month ago.  All the other LA fitness have been spot on clean. This one apparently doesn't get the clean memo from corporate. Other than that standard LA fitness with its equipment and weights

When I walk into Cracker Barrel, I love the smell of burning wood spewing from the chimney.  I think this is one of the only restaurants I have dined at that has a large, burning fireplace.  It's so cozy.

Well, on today's visit, I called ahead for some fish fry.  I ordered the cod with fries, cole slaw, biscuit, and cornbread.  It was really delicious.  Since I took it to go, the breading on the fish was a little mushy by the time I actually ate it, which was about 20 minutes later.  However, the taste of the fish and the batter was delicious.  The sides made this dish very filling.  Actually, I couldn't quite finish the cornbread muffin, even though it was yummy.

While I was here, I was thinking about my boss who is on FMLA and staying with her parents one street from my house.  Christmas is coming up, so I decided to buy her a couple gifts and a Christmas card to cheer her up.  I knew that once I got back to the office my co-workers would pitch in a couple bucks and sign their names on the card.  This worked out as expected.  Also, Cracker Barrel offers free gift wrapping!  That was an added bonus.

I've eaten here on several occasions and it's classic American fare that's always good.  If you want an expensive rocking chair, this is the place.  They have kids' rocking chairs for $79!

Overall, I really like this place, but I don't visit often enough.

Yes, I'll admit it I'm hooked! My fiance'and I like to think of Cracker Barrel as a good breakfast staple. We know we can go there, and get a good breakfast no matter what we order. Although, if you are looking for a hearty dinner, this can be your place too.

 Yes, they do have a bunch of knick-knacks when you walk in the door and on the way to get seated. But I love it! And they don't force you to go through each display and look at each place, so if you are not interested, just keep on walking , you nose will lead you to goodness.

The decor of the restaurant is all old Country Store ads, black and white pictures, and other historic pieces. Some of the tables even have the Chess game on them, so you can play Chess while you wait for you food. If you are one of the unlucky ones, that can't get this table, don't fret, every table has the golf tee triangle game, where you try to get down to 1 golf tee on the triangle piece of wood. It's fun! Unfortunately, according to the game I am just an ignoramous because I can't get under 4!

They have a great wait staff and the food comes out super quick!

The food is delicious and cheap!! You get a lot for your money here, unlike a lot of other places in today's world. 

My recommendation for breakfast- Pancakes with Apples on them and Whip Cream! The Pancakes are fluffy as can be topped with fried apples - no need for syrup!!

If you happened to go there for lunch or dinner get the Chicken and Dumplings...MMMM..GOOD!

Also, just a note they serve breakfast ALL DAY!

We visited On a Saturday morning before a day of shopping. Our server was awesome and attentive, but not in a nagging and annoying way. We did not have to wait long for our food and everything was hot and delicious. The hash brown casserole and turkey parties were my favorites. Two thumbs up!!
I don't understand the restaurant cum knickknack store combination.  It's just bizarre.  (Mimi's Cafe and Apple Farm in SLO, you are guilty of this, too!)

I don't know why people are so down on the Cracker Barrel (Other than for the homophobia and racism. "Allegedly.").

This place has got it all! Pancakes! Toys! Fried things! Rocking chairs! Gravy! Knick-knacks! Biscuits! Mason jars! Aprons! It's like the world's fattest nightclub, as described by Stefon on SNL.

Had a work lunch here today, which brought me back for the first time in maybe 5 years or so. I wouldn't mind coming back soon - I thought the food was delicious, inexpensive, and adequate healthful choices: I opted for the grilled rainbow trout and plain steamed veggies...but then ate an entire order of Coca Cola cake, which was OMG ridiculous. I want that every day forever from now on.

The lady who rang us out at the register was adorable, and so sweet!

This morning I had not had a chance to eat breakfeast before I dropped my girlfriend off at work.  Snow was pouring down, and that old country store evoked a relaxed calm emotion within me.

Kind of strange really, its only a chain food joint! (maybe it was the snow)

anyway, I walked in, was seated within moments, order taken, and served shortly thereafter.

I think when you go to place like this, you SHOULD know what to expect.  I recieved what I expected.....Good service, food, and on my way!

Not any more, not any less

I was here tonite, too!  Enjoyed the braised pork and tried turnip greens for the first time. My family was pleasantly surprised also by the food, service and value. We haven't been to a CB in quite awhile, but will be back soon.  The store was well stocked with fun items for Christmas.

I've had a membership for about 2 years , 32$ a month . You would think I could bring a friend for a day .. Nope . Soon I will be leaving this gym. It obvious that around 5-7 pm the gym gets crowded. At times I just leave because I'm tired of waiting for a machine. As for around 11 am - 3 pm it's great and I can finish my workout in an hour . During the day hours the gym is usually low/out of sanitizer which is gross to me. All in all its a nice gym ..

I bought a snowman with the bubbling light. I was supposed to get a free night bubbling night light free. I called the store and told one they didn't get any and also if I got the member discount I couldn't get one if they had them. Then the girl tells me to call a different Karen's Hallmark store and ask them.  I call there and told they only got the Christmas Tree small lights. What the heck!!!. I plan to call Hallmark!  It is now not only false advertising but just the principal of the thing!!!!

I am one of Cracker Barrel's biggest supporters. I visit at least 3 times a month. However, this means an extra hour of cardio on Monday. The pecan pancakes are absolutely divine. I've only eaten dinner there twice and it was pretty good and would have dinner there again. But if it's breakfast food you are in the mood for this is the place to go! The service has been consistently good. Ask for Mommas Pancake special. You won't be disappointed.
They did good service I would give them five stars but they need to allow choclete milk refills and that's all I gotta say

This Cracker Barrel is right off 480 on the Tiedeman exit. Very close to the interstate. It's your typical Cracker Barrel. Country store for shopping and dining area for eating. There's a fire place and little games on the table to play with as you await your country fried meal. I like to order the catfish here. Can't go wrong with southern fried catfish!

My waitress Stacey at Cracker Barrel Brooklyn, was excellent... But the food was adequate at best
Bacon came out under cooked and when I sent it back....it was returned like shoe leather.  It may have been placed in some kind of microwave device but it clearly did not go back on the grill. 
Maybe I will take a long break from this restaurant until things in the kitchen are managed a bit better

Let me start by saying for this to be a multi million dollar facility its filthy they have very nice cleaning people but not enough theres dirt in between the machines and whover designed this place did a horrible job . There is only one squat apparatus its not even a squat rack so if you like to squat good luck cause you can never get on the weight bar holder as I call it. The cross cable was down for 3 weeks when I was there . The garbage overflows into the floor on the week end and the workers just sit there on their computer or phone very dry staff they have horrible interaction with guests . Oh and the mildew smell in the locker room wear your sandles you might get gang green.

The service was great. The wait staff truly embodies the definition of southern hospitality. My idiot boyfriend broke a glass and the server was extremely kind and took full blame even though she had nothing to do with his lack of coordination. The food was good and they offered healthy options for people who are more conscious of their eating. Overall a great experience.

Receptionist at front desk was very rude I will be calling management she was very unhelpful... other than that I enjoyed the equipment, the environment, and the personal trainer Eric was very helpful!

Food is typical Cracker Barrel, everything else is low rent. Those bussing the dishes made noise and breakage into an art form. The food could have been warmer. Actually, it could have been warm, period. 

The highlight (here, anyway) was paying the check and getting out.

For future reference, there are several restaurant choices within walking distance.
Food wasn't good for me my chicken tenders were dry and hard. They only gave me 3 said it was 4. Brought me another it was burnt. I've eaten there before and it was much much better.

We LOVE the job they did on our landscaping! They took time to make sure every brick was level and solid. The Plant choices were beautiful! We couldn't be more pleased! We highly recommend. If in doubt, ask to drive by some of their customers houses!

It's not the best LA Fitness I've been to, but it's okay. There are plenty of cardio machines and, unlike other locations, I've never had to wait for one. Unfortunately, it isn't the cleanest, often smells, and the paper towel dispensers are empty. The front desk attendants couldn't care less who comes in; sometimes they don't even scan badges or aren't even at the desk. 

Like I said...it's okay.

Ah the tour of the great Ohio airport wasteland continues. They get 3 stars because they are better than Bob Evans but that isn't saying much, the last time I went to Bob Evans I ordered the "Fruit and Yogurt crepes" which ended up being thin cold pancakes topped with yoplait and craisins. 

I do love all the tacky stuff in the gift shop and they have this weird sweet sourbread that we love for toast. The service is quick and friendly. The hashbrown casserole is shredded potatoes and cheese so it is obviously delicious. My mom loves the cinnamon apples and they do have good pancakes. Don't bother with the sausage gravy or grits, they are geared towards senior citizens. The sausage gravy is flavorless except for the taste of raw flour, I don't even think "sausage" is in the description anymore. The grits as far as I can tell do not have butter or salt in them which is just terrible. 

All that being said it is pretty much our best bet for finding something my parents and I can agree on that isn't terribly out of the way or Bob Evans on the way home from the airport. Also I may just be coming from a Seattle perspective but the prices are crazy cheap, just order the big breakfast and tell them not to bring out the gravy or grits and it is still a great deal.

I like it! I mean, it's a chain restaurant so it can only reach a certain level of deliciousness, hence no five stars. But the service and cleanliness really was superb. Actually our waitress was so nice and giving us menu help for the most food at the lowest cost. I wish I remembered her name, she was so kind!

There was a time that I liked Cracker Barrel. I was young and my taste buds weren't developed fully.  Originally the hominess of the décor sparked my interest in the place, but as I grew I realized that it was all a façade, like a child noticing that mall Santa's beard isn't real.  The store is an interesting place to mill around in if you're waiting for a table, but items are overpriced.  The dining area is kind of cool, if you like feeling like you're eating in a barn.  I have had the chicken pot pie once, and from what I can remember it was tasty, but every time I've been there and asked for it since, it's always been sold out.  As far as other dishes, I don't know what to say because I don't know how to feel about entrees that tastes like nothing.  All of the sides are bizarre, shellacked under a layer of margarine or oil they exhibit that fresh-from-the-can taste.  Everything seems artificial -Should I be eating this? Is this play food?- are questions that might cross your mind.  Yes, the breakfast is fine, but really, how hard is it to screw up eggs and pancakes?

One of my favorite gyms in the area. Great atmosphere, friendly people (I have heard different though), cleaner than other gyms. Not the cleanest showers or locker rooms, but for the most part it is better than what I've experienced in other corporate gyms. People working at the front desk are not very friendly but they aren't the reason I'm going to the gym anyways :)
I wish there were more than 1 squat rack!!! At the very least, 2 are necessary with how busy the place gets at peak hours.
Overall I'd recommend this gym. Much better than PF, and pretty solid for the price compared to the areas privately owned gyms.

Update: staff is much friendlier at front desk (but they were never rude per say). Also now the employees walk around and clean more often and are making a conscious effort to maintain a clean gym.
I like it, defiantly better than other location on Cedar Rd. Very clean, new. People are nice

If you want classy, upscale food, don't go here.  If you want a well cooked steak, don't go here.  If you want hearty, basic traditional American food with a Country slant and low prices come here.  I really like that they now have health conscious menu selections.  Food is diner quality, portions are good, but not overwhelming.  Service was ok and timely.  The gift shop is great if you like country stuff.  Interesting that the clothing selections are mainly for women and children.  For what it advertises itself to be, it does a great job.

In the event anyone's actually looking for reviews of a Cracker Barrel, here is one.  Their pancakes are pretty special.  They're almost fried because they're cooked in so much butter.  The edges are crispy.  And buttery.  And the pancakes are served with maple syrup.  Actually, I noticed they finally succumbed to the "make money at all costs" impulse and it's now a maple syrup blend.  Whatever... it's not Aunt Jemima.

I think they're the best pancakes anywhere.  I would never come here for lunch or dinner.  I would come at lunch or dinner time to eat pancakes, but that's about it.  

I also enjoy picking up a pack or two of clove gum on my way out.  Maybe some squirrel nut zippers candy.

Pancakes, 5 stars.  Rest of breakfast, 4 stars.  Everything else, meh...

But really, the pancakes are different.  My wife hates them.  I could eat them all day every day.  If you love pancakes and haven't been to Cracker Barrel, give it a whirl.  Tell us what you think.

I had the ribeye dinner and my boyfriend had the Sunday fried chicken special...I can't remember if it was the green beans that he ordered that was awful or the fries...
The decor of the place is top notch...the food is so so...and the service is straight hillbilly...it was pure comedy...like a page out of a book...when people from Cali think of the Midwest...I kind of think that they had a Cracker Barrel in mind!!!...
They have all the homemade fixins...something you'd expect when you're going over to a neighbor's house for dinner...the store that it's connected to has all sorts of knick knacks, candles, novelty items, candy, toys, clothes even...especially lots of kids clothes...they have household items galore...it's pretty pricey though considering...
You definitely have to try it to get the full experience of the Midwest...but it's not necessarily something to write home about...

I recently joined and must say the staff is friendly and willing to help you meet your goals. They offer a very thorough evaluation when you join to get you on the right track. 

Everything is new and state of the art. Facilities are clean.  

They offer many classes which are free with membership.

Had a membership at this gym for a while. The equipment was never clean, the paper towel and cleaning solution were typically out of supply. The water fountain usually had a gross film on it. It's a very sales driven gym. I had quite a bit of difficulty canceling my membership. The location is very convenient right off of the 480 exit in Tiedeman Rd.

I came to workout at the Tiedeman location for a week when my usual LA Fitness location at Crocker Park was being remodeled, and it's quite different!  

This gym is two floors, with all of the  cardio equipment located upstairs and everything else on the ground floor.  They have a lap pool with 3 lanes, a hot tub, 4 racquetball/handball courts, a basketball court, a room for spin classes, and another room for instructor led classes like Zumba and Jazzercise. Lol 
I really wish they had a track to run on like Crocker does.

The weight equipment is really nice, with the dumbells and plates being vinyl costed and nearly brand new.  The dumbells go up in 2.5lb increments until they get up to 55lb, where to go up to 120lb in 5lb increments like every other gym has.  I like the machines they have here because the weight stacks are a pinless design where you just flip a switch over to the desired weight and you can flip the top most switch to add 5 lbs.  I've never seen this before! The free weights are nice, but the layout is a bit congested. The cable machines seem to be very popular as I always had to wait to use one and they have three of them!

The locker rooms are much bigger than Crocker's, but they were a bit on the dirty side. Also, old men walking around naked with no towel seemed to be a normal occurrence here, while it was rare to see at Crocker Park...ugh.

I'm not sure if this was due to the Crocker location being remodeled, but this gym was constant packed with people after work!  It was hard to finish all of my exercises since people were hogging all of thr equipment.  I never really had this issue at Crocker.

Overall, it's a nice gym.

This has become my husband's favorite breakfast place so I have now been twice. I ordered something off the whole fixings menu, which is their healthy menu. The problem is, they don't provide you with the actual nutritional value. However, I did enjoy my meal of egg beaters, tomato slices, fruit, turkey bacon and dry whole wheat toast, which I substituted out instead of grits. 

My husband ordered some large breakfast with eggs, grits, gravy, biscuits, hash brown casserole, and ham. He loved it, especially the biscuits and gravy. 

Prices are good too as each entree was about $8. Ambiance was also great with a big fire going. And their shop is fun to browse in and the table games are fun too. 

This is definitely a chain, but a scent more for the price and value.

I have been to this location on several occasions. My experiences have always been positive. They have everything I would expect from a Halmark. I am always greeted warmly and am not disappointed. I have never had an occasion to need to do a return.

I have been a member of La Fitness since January 2015. This gym has everything I will ever need and then some. The employees are friendly and the patrons are courteous. The machines are kept clean and in working order. I have taken several classes. Which are included in the membership. The basketball court is full size. Free weights and treadmills as well as all other types of machines. I am a regular at Racquetball. This is where the loss of a star comes in to play. There are four courts there. One of the courts has been damaged for the past four months.  A over head light has been removed from the ceiling.  Now there is a big hole in the ceiling. My group has lost five balls in the home.  Never to be seen again.  Why is it taking this long to repair. This repair should have taken no more than a day to fix.  The cost of the membership is enough to fix the light assembly.  La Fitness.  PLEASE PLEASE for the love of god. Fix the court. If this doesn't get fixed in the next 30 days.  I may edit this review to get three stars for the lack of courtesy to the players.  From the person who made the decision not to fix the court.

Installer showed up looking like he slept in the truck, non stop smoking, and was frankly, scary.  The quoted work to done was not all completed.  When I called in to inform them they said it was but would come back out to inspect and finish.  No one ever returned and  I was billed for the full amount.  When I tried calling back in I had to leave voice mails and never received a call back.  No contact until 6 months later when I received a threatening call that if I did not pay my bill I would have my gutters removed from my home by the end of the week.

Back in old Cracker Barrel had a great breakfast 
Just little syrup for the pancakes 
But very nice people 
Can't go wrong 
Always make me happy to be here

I canceled my membership due to a relocation.  I canceled at the front desk and the lady said I was all set.  The following month they took payment out of my account and caused an over draft.  I had to pay 76.00 (membership fee plus over draft fee) for a month that I couldn't even use.  I contacted the gym and asked to speak to manager.  They said they'd call me back.  I never heard from them.  I contacted corporate office and never heard back.

I have been a member for a long time. I have only been to the Brooklyn one a handful of times. It gets very busy during peek times, the one in Westlake gets busy as well but it much bigger and seems to handle the traffic much better overall not a bad gym

I've had a membership here for a few months now. Ive never had any issues with getting on machines or waiting. 
I do with they had longer evening hours however and have considered switching to a 24 hour gym just for the convenience when I would like to go around 10/11pm. 
The pool is very nice. I was pretty shocked the 1st time I used it and the deepest it goes is 4 feet. Everyone seems pretty respectful of order with having a guy aak me if I wanted the free lane that opened up (vs sharing the current one I was in with another woman) since I was in the pool first. The hot tub had a few people in it but still had plenty of space for others to join but again seemed everyone respected first come first serve order. 
The locker rooms were very spacious but were a little messy (nothing crazy though, few straggling pieces of toilet paper that was stuck to wet shoes) 
The sauna is a very nice touch in the locker room especially when it's cold outside. 
I also like that the cardio equipment is located upstairs and everything else below. Very organized and easy to find the equipment you're looking for.
Reasonable price too especially considering everything this gym includes. Staff is always friendly too

Horrible service! We were here for almost 2 hours. Server didn't wait on us for 20 minutes. Finally when we did get help, our order came to the table incomplete, and then got no refills etc. We talked to the manager who was apologetic but did nothing to "make it right". Worst Cracker Barrel experience ever. Skip this location if you can!

Still one of my favorite places to go when I am back home with the family for breakfast. I'll make this review quick. You can't go wrong with any of the big breakfast meal. The Old Timer is my favorite. You get your choice of eggs, hash-browns/Apples, biscuits and gravy, grits, and your choice of meat all for under $8. 

Went this morning and had great service especially for such a large group. The waitress was really nice and attentive. The food came at a great time. We didn't have to wait to long after we ordered to receive our food.
Everything and everyone is awesome.  Good vibes, great equipment and great people now.  Look forward to going everyday.

Isn't it nice when people write things about which they have zero knowledge whatsoever?  Oh, it's true there was a horrible and senseless (aren't they all?) killing there yesterday, but avoiding this place because of it would be like avoiding driving on 480 because (many more than 3) people have died on it. Now I expect he'll write, "can't you take a joke??" About murders that happened yesterday? No, I can't. 

If you're going to avoid it do it for a good reason: The food is mediocre at best. There are so many better breakfast places, but if you need to be by 480 in Brooklyn, I guess it will do.

I had hired Messner for snow removal in the past, and only stopped because of the really high cost (it would add up to as much as $1500 a year in spite of the fact that I didn't have them come for just a couple of inches of snow). However they were always reliable and on time. When I needed two large trees trimmed, because they had some very large branches hanging perilously over my house, a friend recommended Messner. I described what I needed, they sent someone out to see the trees and provide an estimate, and when I saw the job description of the written estimate ($900) I followed up by phone to make sure they knew everything I needed to do. I even made sure to schedule this for a day when I could be home to make sure they would be no misunderstandings. The guys who showed up were very nice and admittedly very hard working. However, they were sent out here without harnesses and just a handheld saw. That assured that they would be unable to do the job (if they had tried to climb the tall trees without a harness they would quite literally be risking their life). They even tried to reach a limb by climbing on the roof, but they couldn't reach it (in the attempt the saw fell off the roof slashing a window screen and bending the window's metal wrapping). In short, over roughly a 3 hour period I got some small branches removed at the cost of $300 an hour, and I still need to hire a real company to remove the dangerous tall limbs. For $900 you can lease a 2017 BMW 3 series for 3 months, buy 16 2017 Silver dollars from the US Mint, a round trip ticket to Paris and hotel for the weekend, or 128 pints of Haagen Dasz ice cream. Or, if you're not very bright (and I'm raising my hand with embarrassment), you can hire Messner for tree trimming and not get the job done.

If you're thinking about trying this place, do it. I promise you won't regret it. The prepared foods are amazing if you're looking for a quick meal, and the frozen Pierogies make a delicious quick side or main dish. The owners are super friendly. I can't recommend this place enough.

Worst cracker Barrel I have been to ever. I have a very bad habit of wiping off my silverware but this time it was a useful habit. The silverware was a filthy, as I was wiping there was dirt and grease coming off each piece and onto my napkin. When I tried to discuss it with the manager, he could've cared less. I would never eat in a place that has dirty silverware like this, who knows what their plates and glasses are like.

I was very disappointed with this shop. I recently received a Yankee jar candle as a gift and wanted to exchange the scent. I didn't know where it was purchased and I wasn't going to ask for a receipt, so I started with Hallmark. I explained this to them and asked if there was anything I could do. The lady on the phone (Kim?) said to stop in and they can exchange it. 
So I made a trip to this store and immediately was told they've never sold this scent and they couldn't help me.

I understand this policy, but that's why I called first. If they had told me that on the phone I would have provided the name and saved the trouble. They clearly do not value the time of their customers or customer service at all.

I ended up going into Bed Bath and Beyond who said the same thing... but offered me a gift receipt anyway. It's likely the candle didn't even come from them, but they still tried to retain the business. Because of that, I spent WELL more than the value of the 'return' that I hadn't planned on spending. Pretty simple lesson, Hallmark!

The staff at this LA Fitness is INCREDIBLY rude.  All they care about is making money. If you live on the west side take the extra minute drive and go to the LA fitness in Crocker park where the staff is actually friendly, knowledgeable, and make you feel welcome.

We had two projects set up. On one there was a misunderstanding of the work to be done  and there was an issue that wasn't brought up beforehand that made us change our mind and do something different. They did a nice job with the revised plan, but they charged us close to the full amount estimated for the original job (not cheap), which in my opinion was half the work. We questioned the charges, and they reduced it slightly but not enough for our satisfaction. The owner was a bit rude and condescending, but the workers themselves were nice and accommodating. 

The second part of the project was nicely done, but someone was home to direct the work and we believe it would not have been done according to our needs if left on their own. Providing a drawing/plan would help avoid any second-guessing. We probably would not use their services again based on our experience, but perhaps it was just an isolated incident.

I once went to Amish Country for a field trip and was not impressed.  Yea, they can make all their own foods and toys but I really enjoy electricity and a hot shower.  Whenever I step into Cracker Barrel I feel like I'm back in Amish Country.  Not to mention an entire family was murdered here.  I don't like it and probably will never step foot back inside unless I'm looking for a carved wooden horse!
I never started any review of this place. Now this post is to short. They won't post a short post.

I've been to many cracker barrels, and this one is probably one of the least of my favorite locations. The service is sometimes erratic, and they don't include some things during lunch or dinner like other Cracker Barrels. Other than that, the food is still on point.

I am very disappointed because I used to go to Cracker Barrel all the time and he always had good food good service I was surprised we were there Saturday about 4 in the afternoon and the food came out all mixed up wasn't right I had to send some of my food back the girl was very aggravated at me because I had to send it back and after all that the food really wasn't Cracker Barrel what I'm used to so I may try it again maybe it was just a bad day for the cook and the waitress to know I just feel like calling a manager they were busy so that's why I feel about it

Been coming here since this location has opened, almost​ always friendly and always busy. Food is brought to the table in a fairly timely manner. While you wait you play checkers or a puzzle game. I'm the cold weather they have the fireplace​ rearing its heat for the customers warmth. They also have a country store with old school gadgets.

Wait was 45 min.  I work in the industry so I know that can be as quick as 20 min.  It was.  Drink order was taken right away.  And then we didn't see our waitress for 25 min. When she did finally come around,  she blamed not ringing our food in on the kitchen. Saying they lost the check.  Wrong choice. Admit you made a mistake.  And more times than not people will understand.  Don't blame your kitchen,  when I can clearly see them pumping iron.  Poor service.  Shame on the manager for not taking better care of us.  1.Made us wait additionally to talk to him. You're on my time,  not the other way around.
2. Compt 10% for "inconvenience", which in itself is a inconvenience. 
You lost a table full of waitresses and ex-wait staff.  Poor visit.  None of us will be back.

Was initially excited to join LA Fitness. Not so much anymore. The equipment is great, most members are decent but the lockers in the locker rooms are filthy. The main reason I joined here instead of a cheaper gym is for the hot tub. For some reason, they can't seem to keep it working. I do not recommend this company until they get their crap together. Before you know it they will go away just like Bally's. A shame.

I have been here 3 times since it opened and I will fight anyone who wants to drag me to this location again.  I went the first time with my, at the time 3 year old nephew and 5 year old niece, about 2 weeks after it opened and dinner was a disaster.  The kids were fine, food was cold, the booster chair fell apart, and the bill was wrong.  (Another table was added to ours)..  Figuring this for just opened , I went back several months later.  It was still bad!  Table was not washed off, food was on the floor and my order was missing one of my sides that finally showed up at the end of the meal and was cold,  They were NOT busy that day either.  

Most recently, about a year or so ago, a friend of mine graduated with his masters degree and I and some other friends were treated along with the graduate, to dinner.  The graduate was served raw sausage and another friend, who does NOT salt her food, almost emptied the salt shaker trying to make her "famous chicken and dumplings" taste like anything resembling food.

This location repeatedly fails to meet the standard upheld by other locations.
Awesome to deal with and answered all my questions. The crew was very nice and very efficient my gutters look and work great!! I would recommend them to everyone.

I will Actively encourage people NOT to join this gym based on corporate billing. I thought I had cancelled my membership years ago and realized I have still been charged $10/month for the past couple years. When I called to cancel, there is no cancellation over the phone nor an online application. The only options are to come in in person (which is not convenient as I live out of state) or print out and MAIL  a form that is handled on a first come first serve basis (and from the sounds of the customer service rep this is a time consuming process). Again, no specific complaints to this exact location but rather the shady corporate practices.

Such great service at this Cracker Barrel. The hosts and servers are pleasant and quick on their feet. Coffee is served hot and the kitchen works quickly. As for the food, you can't really go wrong with southern, comfort food. Breakfast is, of course, served all day long. 

Provided the weather permits, I definitely recommend lounging on the rocking chairs outside if there's a wait for a table or browsing the store up front for knickknacks. There are great gems from greeting cards to candles to dutch ovens and everything in between. 

No complaints to report, just great food and awesome service!

I've been a member practically since they've opened though really actively coming for just the past year. Decent amount of machines. They are bent on selling their personal training for which I "won " a free assessment. When I tried to cancel Jacob whom I think is in management gave me attitude. The customer service is poor. They also flip flopped I was told at initial sign up such as ability to use membership nationally...even as recent as this summer but now told only can use in Ohio. They need to go back to school and learn customer service skills not just focus on sales. One positive thing is that they just opened a smoothie bar which is nice to have.

I like this store. It's in a convenient location for me and it has a great selection of everything. I enjoy getting my wrapping paper, cards, and cute gifts here. The people that work here are really nice and always helpful if I need a suggestion. Plus it's a really big Hallmark, they usually have things that are sold out in other places.
Greatselection of breakfast foods, southern style, and great service

Decemberists practice space? Paula Deen brainwashing center? The stop along the Oregon Trail where you got dysentary? All of the above. The southern writer William Faulkner said it best in his short story Shingles for the Lord.
 "The chicken fried steak was juicy like a pair of firm antebellum knockers. Breaded in a crust with more seasoning than Old Hickory himself. The gravy was smooth as a snake oil salesman's pomade drenched hair. I'll take a refill of that sweet tea, thank you kindly. Biscuits fluffier than Taylor Swift's songwriting. The south shall rise again, as I will most certainly have leftovers from this heaping helping of hospi-taste-ity! The war of snobby culinary aggression shall not be won by sabre nor by gunpowder, but by down home inbred deliciousizing. Sushi? Frankly my dear, I don't give a damn."

Cheap, comforting, filling despite any discernible nuance of taste...like a home school education. They also sell kazoos. A snake handling good time!

Haven't been eating much at national chains the past 10 years but I occasionally pop in when running errands. Portion sizes have been decreased the past few years but the quality and taste have remained. Carry out service is better than the wait and they even give you a loaf of bread with the EVOO and herbs.

As always Carrabba's was good last night.  I got my sirloin steak with the blue cheese sauce (it could have used more sauce but that's my personal preference).  When we first started we sat at the bar and the bartender was excellent. I sure wish I got his name because he certainly deserves a complement. The food was great, the service was great, one small problem I had was with the hostess.  I had asked her if I could purchase a gift card and I was told I needed to purchase it at the bar.  I explained to her that my father-in-law was sitting at the bar and I was purchasing it as a gift and I didn't want him to see it. She then told me, well wait until you get seated and then you can go to the bar purchase it.  She then proceeded to do nothing.  There was another hostess next to her so I don't think it would've been a big deal if she had left her station for only a few minutes to help me out.  What I didn't care for  was how she talked to me, teenage like but authoritative like I was a child.  That is why I deducted a star. I sure wish I got that bartenders name though he was friendly informative and you could tell he really loves his job! Oh and the steak was good!

Hands down best lasagne I've ever had at a chain restuarant. I also tried the fried calamari it's was very tasty although a little uncooked but again very tasty. The bread has an old world look and taste I especially loved the olive oil and cheese butter. Yummy. The drinks are a little expensive but other than that go for this place!

I believe Sam's Club is better than BJ's and cheaper than Costco.  They accept all major credit cards.  The gas is always the cheapest in the area and if you are a member you get and extra 5 cents off.  They also have a coupon book they send out periodically with instant savings on various items.  Overall it is my preferred warehouse store.

Sam's club is great!  For $40, you can save yourself hundreds each year.

If you're looking for a huge TV at a good price ever day, Sam's is the place for you.  Sam's and Wal-Mart don't do sales.  I like that.  They just offer the lowest prices everyday.  Coming from a former retail worker, pricing sales every week is a lot of wasted time and effort.

This location is VERY busy and was recently remodeled.  Sam's has a good selection of items, but I would like to see more of the 'everyday' items I need in quantities I can use.  Don't get me wrong, I stock up on bulk items like bottled water, toilet paper, paper towels, garbage bags, granola bars, etc, but I'd like to be able to buy one loaf of bread or one bag of chips.   Sam's requires you to always buy two loaves of bread and two bags of chips or none at all.

Sam's selection of goods seems to target businesses instead of every day consumers based on the quantities available.  Sam's has a good price on chicken breasts, meat, diapers, and formula.  You can get a fully cooked, hot rotisserie chicken for $4.99 or a hot dog + drink for $1.78.

The Member's Mark brand is terrific.  It offers comparable quality to some premium brands at a significantly lower price point.  You get the same quality and twice the quantity for the same or less than a similar brand.  You can't beat the value Sam's offers.

Solid 3.5 rating for the foodz! 

We all have our chain restaurant vices and Buffalo Wild Wings is (one of) mine. Why? Because their wings are damn delicious. Shut up. 

I love wings but I hate the way most local bars prepare them. They should be crunchy on the outside, tender inside and have adequate, delicious sauce. Simple? You'd think so. But too many times have I fallen for soggy wings all over CLE. There is only one exception to the crunchy outside/ tender inside rule, and that's Greenhouse Tavern. Because those wings are the best damn wings I've ever, ever, ever had. 

Leave it to the wing professionals at a chain restaurant to churn out consistently good wings. I specifically order all flats with medium sauce. And they're perfect every damn time. Oh--and holy crap, have you tried their fries with the salt and vinegar seasoning on them?! This. This, this, this, this. I dream of these wings with a basket of their "McDonald's-esque" fries sprinkled with that glorious seasoning. 

They also have free trivia that you can pop in on at anytime. And I enjoy that at least one screen always has trivia on so you can passively play while you eat your food. 

Other than the delicious items I order every time, there's really nothing too remarkable about anything else here. The service is so-so. Last time we got to listen to the bartender bitching to the other bartender about just BEING there, for like 10 minutes. That's always fun. And I hate all the sports on 98% of all TVs, but it is a sports bar. And this is Cleveland. I've gotten quite used to drowning in constant sports chatter, shows, games--lives revolving around activities with balls (haha.)
Call ahead expect good foodand service and have fun.  The martini a are the best as are most drinks.  We go to SAMs and eat there on way home.  It's a fun dining experience for couples and family

Great location they take care of you at times the wait is crazy but its Chipotle wait it out . Theres alot of so called Entitled customers that come in here and give these great people a hard time and leave bad reviews good quality food is a wait if you want it right . Ive never had a problem here and staff is nice restaurants clean.

I am never disappointed with this place. I think one of my guess and the past before, just need a little more services than usual. but we still left feeling satisfied. The food is always good and the wait is NEVER LONG.

I have never tried their wines,etc. the coffee is not the best and they should not charge $2.50 for a extremely small cup of off brand coffee.. more like 50 cent -1 dollar maybe...  You will get about 5 good sips and your done, no more coffee. outside of that. waitress at times will be seen standing around talking... It disturbs me for some reason. (dont matter the place) stand in the back or at least wait until the place quiet out (small crowd) then, stand around for a few minutes, but check and do your rounds.

You can make watch them make your food also. Their soup is my fav...  I think i will go and visit again just by writing this review... WORTH THE MONEY..

The food was okay. We ordered curbside to go and when we mentioned the 25 % off any pickup order to the worker she said it must have been fake if it was online and she never heard of it. We then called and spoke to a manager who said she would send a gift card for the difference. It has been 3 weeks and no.gift card yet. Felt like I was lied to.

From outside, Perkins at night looks like a shining oasis of enchantment. Cozy atmosphere the second you walk in. Seasonal decorations, kitch sculptures, and lovely waitresses add to the comfort. I enjoyed my slice of chocolate caramel silk pie in the quiet late night atmosphere while a sitting lawn deer statue looked dolefully on. Pie filling was delightful and decadent but too sweet to finish.

We went 3/14/2014 for dinner & was sorely disappointed in our meals..  The full portion chicken entrees we ordered (wood grilled chicken and pollo sorrento) were okay, nothing special, tender but very, very salty  & portion quite small, around 4-5 ounces, .  The house salad accompanying the meal was terrible for this pricey establishment that calls itself Italian....it consisted of mostly or all iceberg lettuce with ONLY a tbsp. of tiny cut shoestring carrots on top and two TEENY olives on the side of plate.  The house creamy parmesan dressing we went with included very fishy anchovies not explained by our waitress.  A very small loaf of plain Italian bread given for two was adequate but tasted ordinary.   For $14 and $17.50 respectively, we will not return to this establishment primarily due to the salad.  For those prices, a hearty house salad with romaine, onions,  tomatoes, cukes & a tad of Italian cheese on top would not be too much to ask for.

Second time reviewing this Chipotle and I have to admit, this location has really stepped its game up. They seem to be much more on the ball and keeping up with keeping the line fully stocked. Gone are the days of "oh you wanted fajita? Yeah that's gonna take 10 minutes". Portions are generous yet controlled, crew seems to be happy to be there most of the time (nothing like walking into a business where people are miserable to be there). I no longer place call ahead orders, mostly because I like seeing my burrito constructed in front of me so I can't necessarily comment on that. All-in-all a much, much better experience than before! Keep up the good work, don't make me regret writing this!
Our server Kelly was absolutely awesome the food came out good and hot and if you ever want to go I would really suggest this location

Business members have early shopping hours and it makes life so much easier. 7am to 10am. Customer service is decent,everyone is usually helpful and polite. Prices are cheaper then restraunt depot and costco for candy and LSS chips. Better variety then BJ's. Also, the online ordering is fantastic if your in a hurry. Your order is pulled and ready as soon as you get there.

Wife and i ordered two club sandwiches took over 30 minutes and we asked the bartender to check on our food and we noticed that no one in the kitchen was wearing gloves. So we asked the bartender to please have the person that makes makes sandwiches to wear gloves. So then the bartender comes back and tells us she through our sandwiches away and gave us our money back. Then when we left we noticed that the kitchen continued to work without gloves. DISGUSTING

THE WORST Chipotle I have ever been to.
Typically, if I arrive at a Chipotle and am the 8th or 10th person in line I don't worry much about it because I know the line moves fast enough that I'll be ordering my burrito bowl within a reasonable time frame. But at this location, if I am even the 3rd in line there is a guaranteed wait of at least 10 mins. How? I have no idea! The staff moves nonchalantly, taking the time to stop for conversation in between tasks. You'll be in the middle of ordering your food and the employee in front of you will turn around and whisper to someone at a different station, casually making conversation on between tasks. And then when they turn back around you repeat yourself because they forgot part of your order! Really, the worst service ever.

Second visit in 2 months. 2nd pizza order in 2 months. It'd nice because the crust is not dipped in grease here :) other places are. Grandma loves this place and getting all kinds of goodies/gifts to take home. This time a grocery haul for a nice BBQ and snacking. The last time was more of a clothing stock up. Things are decent bargains from time to time. Samples available in the grocery section most of the time. They have a machine that dispenses samples now with the scan or your barcode on the member card. Very hi-tech.

Could very well leave buying a lot of stuff.

Ate here with my family. The prices are a bit high in my opinion. For being a chain restaurant it's on the higher quality of restaurants. The dining area is very modern and cool looking. The waitress was friendly. I enjoyed my meal here.

It didn't start out so well. They lost our call ahead seating but it wasn't very busy and they seated us in about five minutes. Nobody came to serve us. After 7-10 minutes of waiting, a waiter finally stopped over to see if we had been greeted. This is where it gets better. 

Tony quickly took our drink orders, asked if wanted appetizers and offered to take our entree orders if we were ready. He said he would straighten everything out. The manager quickly came over and apologized. She offered to buy us two free appetizers. Before she could walk away, we were served complimentary meatballs. Free asparagus, chicken lettuce wraps, and two orders of mozzarella quickly followed. 

Although Tony was rushed by adding an extra table, he gave us all the attention we needed and never missed a thing. Both managers stopped by and made sure things were great. I've never been so well attended to in my life, and I've been to some incredibly nice steakhouses. Kudos to the staff and management for completely turning around a bad experience. 
The pollo Rosa Maria and Chicken Brian were both very good, as usual. Service saved the day. Mistakes happen, but it's how you respond that dictates how the evening goes.

Silverware was very nasty and dirty. Lady who brought out soup and salad never returned. I put my hands up for another server to get manager. ,she said she would and never came back.  Manager came over and apologized and gave me a gift card

Very disappointing. Great kiosk and made to order menu. I don't know how long I waited but it felt like 10 min after I paid for my food. No one else was in line so I don't know what took so long. The woman emptying the garbage cans out the rolling can in front of the dining area so I had to brush up against it to get napkins. I am now at work and there is no knife. I ordered a platter with a chicken patty. How do I eat it? The biscuit is so burned and dry it is more like a cracker. I will not be going back.

The manager was walking around stocking shelves. It would have been nice if he asked what I was waiting for or something. Maybe no one at this location cares about customer service. This was at 5:45am.

As far as Chipotle goes, the food is the standard Chipotle taste here.  The issue is the service.  There is always a line.  Always.  And it is always long.  It doesn't matter what time of day you go, or what day it is.  The line is ridiculous.  There could be a mostly empty parking lot, and there is still a line.  The staff at this location are consistently terrible.  They are slow, they mess up online orders, they do not have online orders ready for pick up on time, or even close to the pick up time.  Expect to wait at least 15 minutes after your pick up time.  The rest room is always less-than-clean, and the drink fountain area is often out of forks and napkins.
Worst service I have ever had. They turned down a veteran friend of mine becuase they said that they reserve the right to refuse service. They poured the drink and then dumped it.

Oooooh Sheetz! I'm not originally from Ohio, so Sheetz was a new thing for me when they built a location across from my old work. Their lines go faster than anything. They remember me and my food orders. The staff here is so friendly! This place redefines gas station.
It's Chipotle. Nothing else really needs to be said. Well...except the traffic here can be pretty bad around 5:00 PM.

What happened to this place? I used to come here several times a month for drinks and sports. Loved the bartenders. Food was as expected. During my last visit, there was all brand new staff. They were trying, but it was obvious that there was new management. Really no huge deal, but the food was just... bad. My boyfriend's flat bread was burned (waiter replaced it no problem) and the chicken strips in my wrap were super hard, dry... maybe old and then refried? It was legitimately difficult to chew. Buffalo Wild Wings has always been a bit over priced, but the inconsistency of the food the last go around makes me reluctant to return.

Dinner for three was a good evening. The food was ok, I had the seafood linguine dish and it tasted great but I feel there was less than half the seafood than the same dish my wife had been served. I die for the sausage lentil soup and it tasted great but darn it for being 80% broth. I would like give the rating if 3 stars for the poor portion control coming out of the kitchen, but our waitress was great and the good ones are hard to come by. So thank you to the front line. Did I complain? No  would I go to th s location again, maybe but it may be a while.

Sheetz is by far the best gasstation ever.. They have a whole restaurant in there with fresh made to order food... They also have premade food in a case... The people are so nice.. You never wait long for the food and they have low calorie food for people trying to eat healthy.. I really wish that they had more sheetz around..

I went to this location for lunch with my husband and 15 month old son. My son was extremely fussy waiting for food (which didn't take long to arrive) and even after we got the food. Our server encouraged me to go ahead and nurse him and got the check and to go boxes in case we needed to make a fast exit. Words can not describe how amazing this experience was. 

The food was delicious and service was wonderful!

I've also ordered take out from this location several times and have always been satisfied.
We love this place for wings .The garlic parmesan are the best ,beers are cold great waitress. It is very nice place.

Basically Giant Eagle is like a Kroger except for the customer service part. Same crappy layouts, same products carried. But Giant Eagle (and this is not just at this one) has horrid customer service. Lanes are rarely staffed, no baggers usually, and as far as the scant employees on the floor, they won't even make eye contact. Worse still those that do, immediately give off the impression that you the shopper are bothering them.

The store is clean and has a limited menu restaurant (copy Buehler's much?) that serves beer. Wine selection is very good. Liquor store selection below average. Meat department offerings are poor. Produce department is average.

Ice House food is really good...they have a special on something every day of the week.  They have great wings that actually seem to be made as ordered - not just spun in sauce when you order them.  So that means they aren't like chicken-jerky.  
The mussels are awesome, and try a bowl of their chili.....
Drink specials during Indians and Browns games, and even non-specials prices are very, very reasonable.  Beer is always cold too!

Sometimes it's hard to get attention of the bar staff, but I don't really blame them, for a few reasons:

1.  The bar curves around a wall that blocks their view, esp. if they're washing the glassware.
2.  There's a lot of regulars (which is a good thing) that, as you'd expect, do get a little more attention than the casual attendee.
3.  The bartenders are all very attractive, so they get chatted up by regulars and randoms alike.  :D

Only other complaint, but I can't fault them for this too much - PARKING is tough a lot of wing nights.

Honestly disappointed with our food and service. I  wrote to corporate about my thoughts and concerns and they never even acknowledged my email. So I figured I would save another family from wasting their money. The wait was extremely long the night we stopped in, the waitress was unfriendly, we had to ask her to bring us out the hot bread more than once, left us with no refills on our drinks. Once our food came out It was cold and had no sauce. I was looking at a plate of "naked noodles" at an Italian Restaurant. The waitress took my plate back and re-tossed it for me. But when we told her my son's was the same she decided to bring us out a bowl of cold sauce to put on our fettuccine. I guess to shut us up.  I don't know about you but Italians pride themselves on their sauce and making sure family and friends leave full. This was not the case in this restaurant. Left feeling hungry and cheated out of my money. $70.00 for 3 of us that night. No alcoholic drinks, No appetizers, just 1 Chicken Marsala and 2 fettuccine alfredo  with 2 soda's and one ice water. I have had better service, sauce, and fettuccine alfredo at a smaller family restaurant like George's Kitchen. Save your money and time and go someplace else.

Very disappointed with this place. I had never been so I was excited to try it out.  We made reservations for 6 at 6:30 by phone. Around 3:30 that same afternoon. We arrived by 6:20 to a very crowded place which I took as a good sign meaning people liked the food.  We gave our name and watched the hostess flip through her reservation list only to hear that we were not on their list.  What we were given was a 45 minute wait time.  So not happy that we went elsewhere.

Love this place! Some friends and I came here for some beer and late night food, all of our first times here. The inside is really nice, relaxing atmosphere. It wasn't too crowded, plenty of seating in booths (I think?) at the bar, high tops, and it appears they have a really nice patio for warmer days. The food was surprisingly really good! Servers were friendly and helpful. I can't wait to go back! The drink prices were also really great, and they had a nice selection. No complaints from anyone about this place. We all had a meal and two (tall) beers, nobody's bill was over 12 bucks. Perfect

Chipolte strives to get good products when they can. Always consistant product which is great! I love the simplicity of the order system. However the last 4 times I have been there the workers are confused. As soon as I get to the end , nobody kni=ows what is what or whos order is who and they mess up everyones order.It seems like they are under staffed and the management is terrible. I like the atmosphere overall and the hot sauce variety. My favorite is the Tabasco Chipolte hot sauce. It is weird because some employees skimp you hard on toppings and others put 3x as much as i possibly could have wanted.other locations get a 4 star from me, but this location needs a lot of work.You think a corporate entity would be able to run a tight ship...

Carrabba's is our go to chain Italian restaurant.  Food and service is consistently good.   We like it much better than Olive Garden or Romano's.  Some of my favorites are the sirloin steak, pork chops and the Johnny Rocco salad.  I think it is the wood-fire grill that really makes the steak and chops so tasty.  The salad is loaded with shrimp and scallops and a tasty  Italian vinaigrette dressing.  The crusty warm bread served with entrees is very tasty with the olive oil and spices served with it.

We belong to the dine rewards program.  When you dine at either Carrabba's, Outback or Bonefish grill you get credited for a visit.  Every 4th visit you get 50% off your bill up to $20 maximum.  You even get credit for to go orders.  Great deal.

I ate here the other day the lobster ravioli is so goood!! The salad was on the wilted side unfortunately...got free ice cream in the end of it though when I mentioned just briefly that the salad was a little oxidized or whatever idk I didn't even really say much. So it was a pleasant surprise

I really like Carrabba's updated menu but the prices are a bit too steep. All in all a decent value but for the money, I'd rather go to a non-chain Italian spot in Little Italy.

Wine Wednesdays are a great deal, though! Try the Blackberry Sangria.

I had an impromtu dinner there late last night with a friend of mine. I have never dined there before so my feelings and opinions were neutral from the start. I am not too big of a fan on chain restaurants in general, as they all appear to be bland across the board. I was satisfied with the menu selections, but disappointed with the portion sizes and the price for what you are paying for. I ordered a pasta dish that looked more like a luncheon portion then a dinner portion. It was luke warm, which tells me it was either reheated, or it sat under a heat lamp for quite some time.  The service was a tad bit too slow, as it was a slow weeknight evening, i would have expected fast service. I would recommend this restaurant for maybe a light lunch option, but most certainly not for dinner, unless you want to walk away hungry. But, in my book, Carrabba's still beats out Olive Garden hands down for overall food quality and price.
Mother's day 2016 pork chop was tough, fatty, small and bloody. Chicken Bryan was perfect tho.

Carrabba's is a restaurant I love for a girls' night out or a family dinner. They have fun drinks and good food. My favorite is the Pollo Rosa Maria. The chicken is stuffed with fontina cheese and covered with mushrooms and a lemon butter sauce. During this visit we tried the small plate special where you had 3 appetizers for $12. The stuffed mushrooms were delicious but looked minuscule in comparison to the menu photograph. To finish off the meal we shared a piece of tiramisu which was huge but was sub par in comparison to competitors. The best part of the evening was our server, Reta. She was prompt, efficient and was kind to my father who talks too much. I had a great experience at Carrabbas!

Went out to dinner here with a few of my girlfriends and it was an overall positive experience. Our waitress was nice but she went MIA for a little while. My ice water was always full which is something I would expect when going out to somewhere like here. I had the baked ravioli which was delicious! I would recommend stopping here if you want a delicious meal but don't expect real authentic Italian food. Great service most of the time and nice atmosphere.

I was nervous about coming to this Chipotle because of the other reviews about their slowness...I'm on my lunch hour and don't have spare time to burn. I must have gotten lucky though...today is a Wednesday at 11:45am, and they have 6 people (I took a picture!) working the burrito counter!  I got through an 11 person line in 4 minutes. Wow. Food was good... Fresh, hot and filling. A little skimpy on the cheese... I had to ask for more cheese 2 times, but the girl added more when I asked. Wouldn't hesitate to come here again.

The food here has been very variable over the 10 times we have eaten here.  I think we keep coming back only because the rewards program let's us forgive some mediocre meals.  Some specifics: salad included with most meals has varied from excellent to pale, limp, and not fresh.  What was once my favorite, a double porkchop, is now something i cant stand because it has been overseasoned and overcooked.  Other dishes, like the chicken bryan, have seen portion size go way down.  Service has been slow, even when it's not busy.  We once sat 10 minutes after being seated and not see a wait staff.  To be fair, they did acknowledge this and offered us a free app from the manager.  on the plus side, bread is always good although is now served later with the explanation that it's in the oven.  In summary, definitely a step down for the past year and a half.
The calamari here is everything! Service was good! Server was nice... overall I was very satisfied

Not so sure why it takes 20-25 minutes to fry chicken. Every place I've cooked at had them done in under 10. I've ordered 3 times and always over 20 minutes. Employees just wandering around with no urgency. You're new but come on. If I want to wait that long for wings I'd like to enjoy a beer with it.

We went on a Saturday night, there was no wait which was great. The food was good but nothing special and the waitress efficient. We were seated by the front door which kept slamming shut throughout our meal. I would say it's worth giving this place a try!

Well, it would appear that this location has officially closed it's doors. Drove by the other day to find that the big blue sign has been removed and the showroom emptied of its furniture goodies. Elvis has left the building.

Hot wings are HOTT! It took about 10 minutes for my lips to stop burning, but they were good. I am more sensitive to heat when it comes to food than maybe the average person, however. I love the variety of sauce flavors, but I do think they are pricy. 

The first batch of hot wings were crispy, but the next 2 were not; and I do not like soft chicken wing skin! Yuck.
So I recommend making sure to order extra crispy if you are like me!

The beer is cold, and they have the Sunday Ticket, so it is a great place to watch football ( while I watch the Indians). But, food is average.
The food was great! The Service was awsome... I really enjoyed the blackberry sangria and the calmari is seasoned perfectly!! This was my 1st time here but I will be going back !!!

This restaurant was bad from the start. There was a distinct stench as soon as we walked in the door and got worse as we entered the dining room. It really made it tough to even eat my meal.

The silverware was not very clean and my glass of water was sticky on the outside.

Our waitress was super nice, that was about the only bright spot.

The food was not very good in my opinion, but the rest of my family said they enjoyed their meals. 

I would not choose to eat here given almost any alternative.

I had thee BEST waitress EVER here!!! I mean she did everything to keep our kids happy!! You sometimes need a person who is naturally friendly and warming to appreciate your meal. The food was good and inexpensive I will be back. Especially, since I know kids eat free on Wednesdays and Saturday after 3pm that's just a double bonus lol.

Date night!
Not big on chains but everything from the apps( Calamari and risotto poppers) to entrees(seafood fett marinara and seared pork tenderloin and asparagus) was REALLY quite good!
Doesn't hurt that they feature Peroni on tap!!!
Left quite full and satisfied so maybe you might consider a short trek over to Tiedeman and see if I am spot on or clueless...
Cheers!!!

This store is large. There is dry cleaning and day care service (for while you shop only) in the front and a pretty decent sized florist that accepts orders as well as sells from a stocked area. There is also a good sized bakery and deli and alcohol department mostly along the perimeter of the first part of the store. There is a small rack of gift cards when you walk in but a much larger selection in the front of the store by the registers. There are a lot of self-check out machines at this location which I always like using. The only thing that annoys me about this store is the tile floor - why they made the produce section ceramic tile when carts must noisily roll over it I do not know.

Asked for a little bit of Guacamole and charged me $2 extra. (They should've mention that will cost extra) plus the menu didn't list that initial guacamole will charge additionally. I thought it was a free topping :/ 
Deceptive point of sale :(

Carrabba's is a chain, which makes me like it less, but my sister and I went here recently and it was a great experience.

We are both the grazing type who eat all day so when we go out we often split a meal.  We split the lemon chicken and each had caesar salad.  The chicken was fabulous, and it was just the right amount of food.

Our waiter was prompt and friendly.  I will come back here.
Service was so-so and the food came out slow. Mixed drink was very expensive. Get the wine instead. Husband had Steak Skewers and the meat was tough. Ot was okay for dinner on a week night.

I stopped in here with friends after work one evening. We got a spot out on the covered patio and it was really nice! Warm sunny day but we could still enjoy being outside with shade and a slight breeze coming through. I will say that were a lot of men here and it was slightly uncomfortable that all eyes are on you as you walk through the restaurant to get to the patio. Maybe it's more of a local's hang out or maybe it's been a long time since they last saw a woman. 

For food I tried a side of pierogies. You get two in an order for $4 and they are deep fried and covered in what seems like that liquid butter you put on your popcorn at the movie theater. Inside you'll see some American? Velveeta? cheese. Comes with onions and sour cream as well. I also tried one of their tacos for $2, they only have ground beef but you can choose mild or hot sauce and deep fried shell or regular shell. Add a $2.50 Modelo and it was a nice cheap greasy bar food dinner. 

It was pretty steady with patrons while we were there but the bartender was still friendly and did a good job, just had to be patient. All in all a good spot for a drink on the patio and for eating fried pierogies.

It takes a really poor experience for me to write a poor review. But this sams club succeeds in providing a bad experience. 

First, don't bother calling. The phone continuously rings. 

The selection, products and prices are all good. But the staff is horrible. It's difficult to locate someone to help so I am forced to walk to the front customer service section,  wait in a ridiculous line and then be told someone will assist me in the back of the store. The store is never clean. There is always trash around the food court counters and in the restrooms. 

I have a Costco membership and Sams. Sams is much more convenient for me but after the membership expires I won't be renewing. It's worth the extra distance for better customer service.
This Sheetz is amazing. This is one of the locations that has an indoor dining area. Also many good drink options in the coolers. Stok iced coffee and Steaz organic teas. Excellent.

Awesome bar, with great drink prices. The decor consists of a series of blow molds along with local high school and sports memorabilia. The best part of this place though are their wings! The wings are very large, and flavorful. Not to mention you get a ton of them for pennies. Staff is very nice and attentive as well.

I've been here twice. The first time was about 9 years ago and I was about 6 months pregnant with my son. I ordered some type of pasta with shrimp. It was a large portion of naked pasta with maybe 6-8 shrimp and had NO FLAVOR AT ALL.  I sent it back and ordered the chicken Alfredo which had the same issue. I ended up sending that back and not eating at all. The customer service was great. The waitress was very polite, apologetic and offered free dessert. So the food was  not great but it had a nice atmosphere, it was clean and had great customer service.....  My second time here was last night. My family decided to have dinner here for my aunts 55th birthday. I remembered going there years ago and not liking the food. But I was a VERY picky eater when I was pregnant with my son so I figured if they've been around this long, my prior experience had to be due to my own issues and it was a clean and the costumer was awesome so I agree to go. The first thing I noticed was the prices were way higher then they where 9 years ago, doubled if not tripled. Service was pretty good. We had a group of about 20 people and had 2 servers. Some of our group was late (me being one) and they were very patient with us. A bit unorganized but still very polite and attentive to us. The food on the other hand, not so great and definitely not worth the price. I ordered the lobster ravioli which came with a choice of soup or salad. The soup was amazing the ravioli, not so much. I received a plate with about 8 quarter sized ravioli and a drizzle of of Alfredo sauce. So my first thought is wow this is the portion for $18.99. So I eat one and again  there is no flavor at all. Then I eat a second one and realize I didn't even taste any lobster in them, no meat chunks of lister flavor. My son ordered shrimp and scallop with mashed potatoes and hated it! And this is a kid who loves seafood how ever it's prepared. The only he ate was the mashed potatoes. I taste his food and scallops were over done but seasoned pretty good and the same for the shrimp. Around the table, my family is asking for more sauce for their pasta, asking if their food can be reheated and even if they could try something else. Our servers were still awesome considering we were a large group full of complaints. Never did they seem annoyed of frustrated. They took care of us in a timely manner and we didn't have to asked for anything more then once. But for a $70.00 bill for food that I didn't eat and a pitcher of sangria punch that just tasted like juice (I mean really there was no alcohol in it al all) I wont be going back. The only reason I'll give it two stars is because the customer service is really good but not $70 good.

As with all other BW3s that we've been recently, the bone in wings are small, overcooked and under sauced. Boneless wings are mostly breading, hard from being overcooked and under sauced. Chips with cheese don't have enough cheese. Tonight we tried a buffalo mac and cheese.  It tasted like mac in a watery milk sauce, with no cheesy flavor.  There were cut up boneless wings on top, overcooked, hard and not easy to eat in the mac.  Garlic bread made with a sandwich bun toasted on one side and buttered with a little garlic flavor.  Not a winning meal.  My hub tried the limited time only maple butter wing sauce which he loved.  I had my usual mild buffalo that I love,  which is the only reason we keep going back.  The service has always been good here in my experience.

An italian chain restaurant that doesn't deluge you with pasta.  Nice selection of pizzas, pastas and chicken and beef entrees.  Good selection of salads.  Food is ok, not as fresh tasting as some.  Portion size is appropriate for price.  Service is good.  Ok place to stop for some Italian food.
If the wait is  going to be an hour do not tell customers it's going to be 15 minutes. The cashier was super rude was acting strange like he was high

You get what you pay for, simply put.  This place is excellent with the service, food, cleanliness & timing.  We ordered a lot of different items (steak, pasta etc) but the best thing we had was the steamed mussels in garlic sauce - it was to die for!  They were so tender they practically melted in my mouth - next time I think I will order 2 bowls of mussels and nothing else!

Update May 7, 2017.  
First, let me preface these comments by stating I am not a compensated spokesperson.  Still, I can't say enough about the repeated satisfaction with every vist to this Carraba's.  I think what is truly exceptional here in addition to the superbly prepared selections and the welcoming service, must originate from the top.  The enthusiasm and responsiveness of the owner Mark exists at a level very seldom witnesssed in the food industry.  Mark is always willing to receive commentary and opinions on his establishment with the utmost interest and aplomb.  One often finds the opposite with other restaurants, with programmed responses to the extent of "that's the way we do it, period."   You come to find yourself actually wanting to become a "regular."   Creating this experience may be part of the corporate philosophy, but I also believe that Individuals such as Mark elevate it to a truly authentic and personal mission.  My dining experiences extend to a global level and include many memorable stops.  I can say, however, that it is a continued JOYFUL event to dine at Mark's Carrabba's grill.  


Updated March 6, 2017.  Upgraded rating to 5.  Perfect experience from level of service to taste and value.  Server Amanda was a pro and had everything done right.  Get there early because after 5 the place fills up.  Wood fired grill makes the difference.   We've joined the frequent diner club and will be making this a regular event.
