Sometimes there is a perception that a corporate restaurant chain cannot adequately produce ethnic food that is authentic and good. Readily, I can subscribe to that opinion but I am not extremely disappointed if a white haired grandmother is not stirring the pot or if there isn't actually anyone of that certain ethnic background actually cooking. The true measure is in how well you are satisfied with what is served. I am actually more apt to accept a corporate entity because, as a former military member, I appreciate standards of performance and situational analysis. This visit to Carrabba's, while not a perfect 5.0 this time, was very, very good. The bread is crusty and warm; served with a dipping oil. The salads, though most likely, formulaic and not "endless" as another chain, were well presented, composed and served on a chilled plate; a superior extra element. Our choice of appetizers included aranchini (fried rice balls) and stuffed mushrooms. Good for the price point of around $6 each. The main entrees were a chicken and pasta dish titled Linguine Positano. Whether it is actually a dish that originates from Italy's Amalfi coast, I am unsure. The chicken had good grilled taste, but the pasta was horribly overcooked (which for the American taste is too acceptable.) The seasoning of the dish also lacked. (think I might order the sauce on the side next time so I can give a better analysis) My Cioppino (Seafood stew), on the other hand, was superb. The fish including shrimp, mussels, swordfish, and scallops, was prepared to order and not overcooked in any way. The broth was well seasoned and tasty. The only minus might be that there should be a bit more served (I liked it!!!) Pricing for the food appeared in line with most comparable sites though wines and other drinks might be slightly higher. Our server, Brittany, was bright and well informed and knew the company and its products well. Service seemed fairly well timed though the house was crowded. Would have liked to have had the wine a bit sooner so it was there with the first course. The process was admininstered well enough with multiple servers delivering courses and managers nearby. Spoke with the owner Mark for several minutes as he had learned of our displeasure with the pasta. I am always pleased to see that kind of attentiveness to customer opinion. He was very receptive to our thoughts and gave a very comprehensive insight into the preparation of their cuisine. On my file it or forget it rating, I give it a "file it" and worthy of another visit.

Excellent food and superb service.  It was our first time here, and we were celebrating purchasing our new home.  They brought us champagne, a congratulations card, and a $25 gift card.  Just so kind.  We then had exceptional food.  Chicken park, shrimp and scallop vodka pasta, and sausage campiniola. Soooo good! We will be back.
They were completely out of forks, they had no hot sauce.... a wing joint... The wings seemed a little undercooked as well

I had the Lamb.  It was excellent.  It was not a petite cut it was three carnivore man cuts.  My wife had the lasagna and my three year old daughter had the spaghetti and meatballs.  Both their entrees we're excellent as well.
Every time I'm here there is at least 20 people in line!!! 20!!! They need more workers and better service!! Would NOT recommend ! Rude employees.

Worst staff ever in the history of fast food. Everyone cops an attitude with you and they skimp you on all items.. when u ask nicely if you could get more they grunt at you and also ask you in a smart toned voice "What Else". This was my 3rd time goin here being from California here on Business im stuck to whats local to my hotel and chipotle being right next door its kinda a must. If you have a car and a brain Stay far from this chipotle Service sucks and the Staff are all Asinine.

Chipotle is so yummy.  The burritos are huge and you can get whatever you want on them.  They offer chicken, steak and pork as meat options or you can go vegetarian.  They have refried beans, rice, black beans, lettuce, tomato, onions, you name it.

The atmosphere of this Chipotle is very industrial, but it is nice.  I love that you can have a beer with your food, that's a bonus!

My favorite menu item here is the three tacos.  I usually order chicken or steak and they are yummy.  There is a flavor in the meat at Chipotle that I don't care for, however.  I find it to be some kind of metallica flavor, but it's very faint.  I haven't tasted this at Moe's or Qdoba, so I usually visit these restaurants instead. 

Overall, Chipotle is very tasty.

http://www.chipotle.com

I have only been to carrabba's once in the past. My boyfriend and I wanted Italian but not the same old. He had spaghetti and meatballs and I had mezzaluna. My bf said he's was pretty good and I enjoyed mine. It had a tomato cream sauce, which I really liked, but wish there was more of it. There is no carrabba's super close to us, but we will make the trip again.
Lasagna tasted like it was purchased from a grocery store freezer section....soup however was great. ..I will come back as I have had better meals here. ..

I'm not a huge wing eater, but every once and awhile my wife gets a craving, so you know the saying..,compromise is key!  Anyways, the wings here are pretty good.  Try the Louisiana Rub, they are the best of the bunch and always come crispy with a nicely seasoned rub.  My only complaint is that the wings with sauce always seem like they should of been left to crisp up for a couple more minutes.  Sometimes they seem a little too mushy for my taste, but each his own.  This chain is new to the area, offering solid wings and service.

Ate here while I was in town for a business trip. The waitress was very tentative and took my order immediately. Food was excellent as always. Good location - close to other restaurants and hotels in the area.

Typically a great meal, tonight was great but stale chips!

This is the second time at this location that some part of meal is off, I hope they get it together.

Fresh air on the BW3 patio. Friendly service thanks to Missy. And one heckuva great pulled pork sandwich with sweet tea to wash it down. This was a 5 star experience and I'm happy to share it. 

The entree and side for lunch is a great value. I dined with a work colleague and we ate, chatted, and relaxed...and did it all in under an hour.

#iwillbeback #bw3 #cascadecrossing #missyrocks #jordanwascooltoo

LOVE this place!! Always so friendly to my kids an actually cater to them, they don't have cherry Pepsi but they make it happen for the kids. They have hand held game consoles that are like iPads that they give the kids. Dinner is always so quite. LOVE love love  this place!

Tonight, we took the in-laws to Carrabba's for dinner.  My mother-in-law loves this place!  There were 10 of us, but we were seated quickly because it was Monday night and the place was next to empty.  

I ordered the Chicken Trio and a Caesar Salad.  The lemon chicken was just so-so, the goat cheese chicken was just okay, but the Chicken Marsala was outstanding, yet again.  While I appreciate that they use organic chicken breasts, I miss the large breasts that I am used to at other venues.  No, not strip clubs!  Get your mind back on the menu!

My daughter ordered Lasagna and she ate it slowly, which means she didn't like it very much.  Her slow eating came to a grinding halt, so I tasted her Lasagna.  It really wasn't that good.  Actually, my wife bakes better Lasagna than this.

I noticed several of those at the table did not eat their garlic mashed potatoes and I wondered why.  How can you screw mashed potatoes up?  Or was it that my in-laws just aren't used to eating them in their native Puerto Rico.  So I grabbed a fork full from an abandoned plate and tasted them.  They were overpoweringly seasoned with black pepper and way too much raw garlic.  Wow.  They were bad.  No wonder there were heaps remaining.

Then I looked at my sister-in-law and niece's plates...they too were half full of uneaten alfredo pasta.  By this time, I was so full that I didn't have room to taste their pasta.  But I was tempted nonetheless.  I asked them how their pasta was, thinking they were simply overcome by a large portion.  Nope!  They both said it tasted bad.

Finally, my mother-in-law said her Beef Brasato dish (you know, the one they're advertising on TV right now) was too heavily seasoned and she didn't finish it.  Since she is getting on a plane to San Juan in the morning, she said I could have her leftovers for lunch.  Not sure if that is a good thing considering the not-so-great-tasting-meal that we just ate.

This is my first disappointing visit to Carrabba's and I must remove one star for the overbearing taste.  Gah!  I also must remove it from my favorite restaurants list too!  This is getting to be a lot of work!  Maybe they were training a new chef?  Nope!  I watched them cook the meal and they all seemed perfectly at ease.

Maybe because it was Monday it was an off night.  I don't know.  My water didn't get refilled until I begged a second time either.

Whatever.  I'll reconsider visiting Carrabba's at this location on a Monday, to be sure.

The food is pretty good, but lately every time I come and try to order off the beer menu, they're out of everything. Some of the bartenders don't even have a clue what they have on tap. If your beer menu is incorrect, at least educate yourself on what you're serving.

I normally love Buffalo wild wings. Tonight I switched up my usual order and decided on a salad. The food was very disappointing. There were only 4 slices on chicken on the salad. I do not think it was cooked fresh... It was rubbery, difficult to cut and hard to chew. Very unhappy. I will not return to this location.

Bright side is the service was great!!!

The Showboat opened quietly in my neck of the woods, so I thought I'd try it.  I took the wife and kids to the Showboat on Friday night for some dinner and it was a weird experience.

When we walked in, it was quiet, too quiet, except for the Oldies music playing.  There were four patrons at the bar and the restaurant was empty.  Not one soul was in the restaurant area!

We were promptly seated and our server was very friendly.  She played with my son and made him laugh, so she got bonus points.

Based on the name of this place, I expected more Cajun dishes.  The only dishes remotely close to what I perceive Cajun to be were the Jumbalaya and catfish.  Remember the Oldies music?  Yeah, that's not Cajun either.  

The decor consisted of dark green walls and large Mardis Gras masks everywhere.  It seemed overly simple or gimicky.  Also, there was a large stage, which was also empty.  Apparently, they had hopes and dreams of enough patrons visiting one fine day to justify hiring a jazz band.  Things that make you go, "Hmmm."

I ordered the perch with fries and a side of Jumbalaya (which wasn't on the menu), my wife ordered the catfish with fries, my daughter ordered a hamburger with fries, and my 18-month old son seemed like he was in the mood for Mac n Cheese.

We received bread rolls, which appeared to be store-bought, and soft butter, which was good.  The server brought the kids' food out first, which was nice of her, followed by our entrees a few minutes later.

My Perch was breaded and it tasted okay.  It was served with tartar sauce and cole slaw.  The fries were big and tasty, which I really liked.  The Jumbalaya was really tasty and my favorite dish of the evening.

My son ate all of his creamy Mac n Cheese and I tasted it too.  It was really good.  My daughter ate like two bites of her burger and a few fries.  She eats like a bird, anyway.  My wife ate most of her fish, but she didn't say anything about it, so I assume it was so-so.

Since none of us had any extremely positive things to say, I assume we'll not be visiting this restaurant again.  With tip, the bill came to $47.

Another weird thing that happened was, a few groups of people walked in the restaurant only to turn around and walk right back out once they saw the emptiness.

I didn't even know they were open and I work in this viscinity.  They should have given our HR department some coupons or some type of discount to drum-up business.

Overall, the food was very average.  It wasn't great or anything.  It reminded me of cheap diner food, except for the Jumbalaya.  My main reason for giving this place two stars is the fact that it's a full-on restaurant and being the only guests on a Friday night soon after opening is just creepy.  You can't blame the lack of patronage on the economy...somebody just does not know how to run a business.

I wonder how long this place will last.

Run away.

I just had some wings from here and awesome some great cuts of chicken and the cooked the chicken right crunchy and flavorful. My order was 10 minutes late but that's fine because the place just opened a week ago and all new businesses have hick ups . The reason I say this is the food quality was great blows those other two competitors out the sky . The inside very nice for dine in and clean . I will definitely be back finally a place that don't mess up chicken. Kudos wing stop welcome to the neighborhood. Well it's 9 months later and I have still had a great experience here , I've heard the complaints about the boneless wings I don't like em myself but the bone in are great . Ordered a 40 pack last night with fries and no problems wings were excellent! Kudos

We've never had a bad meal here and it's always fun.  Food was better on opening but it's still good.  The place could use professional or interested management to solve long weight time long food times and improve food quality but those improvement wold make it better,

It's what you would expect from a Sam's Club.  The service desk was really nice as I needed to handle a billing issue.

Also the gas there was like 40c less a gallon that day.

Plenty of free samples inside (saved me from buying a $2 snack! :-), and the lines are long as usual.

Ok so there have been some times that the food, service, and for whatever reason the music here were really great--a nearly four star Chipotle experience.

But for the most part this place is a disaster, much like their women's bathroom. Hard to hate on their staff, as it's so ever revolving that it makes you wonder what goes on here with the management. Someone is usually slow because they're being trained, which is really no biggie, just noticeable when it occurs on numerous visits. There have been times when employees are cleaning up invisible messes or chatting in the back during the lunch rush with a line out the door. Sometimes they will be out of items in the middle of the day after you've waited 30 minutes. Online orders are a NO; I can only assume that the people who have made my orders barely read the order before preparing it. I've been served raw chicken, salt with a side of chicken, and chicken bones. 

Obviously I'm the real idiot for still giving this place a chance after so many problems. I started submitting anonymous complaints after having my free meals be worse than the meal I complained about. I really truly think the issue here is management; the employees seem so miserable and the food is miserable. I guess when you're one of the closest places to an office with hundreds of employees that are even more miserable, the sales still reflect something different than the truth.
Wings are great !! Staff is great !! Nice place to throw back a few cold ones and catch the game.

It was a Friday October 15th at approx. 6pm-ish.  My lady and I had seen this place for quite some time and wanted to check it out.  We were hopefully of a new dining delight in the old Don Pablo's building.

We pulled up into the driveway and at first it seemed like there many cars, but soon we realized it was for the other near by places such as TGIFs, Steak'N"Shake and the hotel.

Upon entering the building it was interesting to see the change from Don Pablos to this....it was "neat"...loooked very fancy and I expected high prices...however they were not.

Being a New Oleans restaraunt, I expected to see some Crawfish....sadly No Crawfish on the menu! and No Boudin either.

The host polietly asked me if I preferred a booth or table and my reply was booth.  Nearly seconds later, he asked again, did you say booth or table? My reply was booth please (they place was nearly empty, and this was not a problem to find a booth)  Upon approaching the far side of the restaraunt, he asked me a 3rd time, Would you like a booth or table? I laughed and said a booth and joked with my girlfriend he must be high.

Our server then came out, she was a bubbly girl who said she had been working there about 2 months.  She took our drink orders then came back and asked if we needed more time....I said yes and asked her for her suggestions and she suggested something (sorry I forget what it was) that didnt appeal to me as I kinda had my eye on the seafood paella.

I asked her how it was and she said didnt like that kind stuff and that the texture was gross.  

At this point I didn not expect anything delightful from the rather uniquely atmosphered restaraunt.  

We were directed to the dumpling soup and a salad to accompany the seafood paella which we were to share......

The waitress....a friendly, bubbly young lady was quite enthusiastic and entertaining to speak to about the restaraunt and the "show".  She explained that the show gets pretty busy on the weekends and the bands are pretty good.  Truth being told the Band that was playing some kind of jazz blend was not too bad, and put me in a good mood.

The soup came out and was tasty.  Bread Rolls and salad did nothing to impress me.  While I love King hawaiin rolls from my grocer, this was a cheap immatation at best and the salad was pretty much just white iceberg.  We ate it and said nothing....

Minutes later the Paella.

I took one bite of a scallop and it was Raw.  I asked my date to confirm and she did.  I was poking around for a piece of andoullie....didnt seem to find one.....didnt get a chance too look much further...DIDNT CARE TO LOOK FURTHER when the waitress came back and asked how it was I said I was not pleased and i didnt want it fixed, just wanted it removed from the bill and id pay for salad and soup.

She kindly obliged and we recieved the bill and left the magical place with not very good food :)

2 stars for ambiance, and good server

negatives
-food not very good quality *but hey cheap prices sorta*
-host forgetful of seating request

Never been disappointed!  Love this place!  A couple service things they will improve on over time but all in all a good place to catch dinner.  Brooklyn needed a place like this.

I would like it more if they supplied hard alcohol.

We used to love Carrabba's.  We used to come to this location once a week.  Last time we were here, we were served raw chicken.  After waiting a year we decided to try again. Horrible.  We were sat in a pretty empty restaurant at 2:00 on a Sunday.  They sat a table beside us and took their order before us after waiting for at least 10 minutes.  Finally they took our order.  The people beside us got their food and left before we even were served our food.  When our food was served, it was cold. My husband ordered his without mushrooms and they said would he be able to just pick them out!  We sent back our food to get new hot food.  The food was just reheated. The plate was to hot to touch. I asked about them reheating it, they said they don't have microwaves.  Obviously it was heated with the plate IN something.  Manager came over to deliver the sauce and she was so fake and did not even apologize.  The service was way below par.  She acted like we were an inconvenience to be sitting in her section. Not one apology from anyone in this restaurant.  We were offered a dessert for our troubles, still with no apology.  We stated that we were full and didn't want dessert and could they just please take some money off the bill.  The took $6 off our bill.  The desserts range $6-$9.  What a freaking insult.   The server Mallory was rude and not friendly at all.  I do not recommend this restaurant to anyone.  I hope upper management sees this and sees what is becoming of their restaurant.

This Sheetz is amazing. This is one of the locations that has indoor seating for eating their delicious burgers and fries. Also many good drink options in the coolers. Sheetz iced coffee and Steaz organic teas. Excellent. Great car wash as well.

I have been here at least 20 times or so and I have to say this is one of my favorite "townie" bars! I absolutely love the food here! Two of my favorite are the tacos and the pierogies. In my opinion they have some of the best pierogies in Cleveland (and I have had my fair share)! The drinks are cheap and you can always get a good meal at an affordable price.

I just had literally the best service I have received from any restaurant I have been to, my servers name was Rodney he greated us fast, made excellent suggestions, knew the menu like the back of his hand, made sure the food came out fast, the presentations of food looked amazing, food was of course delicious but I think what overall made my experience the best was out server Rodney for sure, I will definitely be returning more often to sit in his section. Thanks again Rodney if your seeing this your truly amazing! Keep up the great service!

Met some relatives here for dinner on a Friday evening.  This was my first visit to a Carrabba's, and the food was cheaper than I had expected.  The food was acceptable, but nothing memorable.  The restaurant had an overall dirty feeling - bad smells, sticky floor, etc.  The worst part of our visit was the service - so chaotic.  I swear we had repeat every request to two different people.  I hope to never go back.

Having been to many Buffalo wild wings, I tried this one. Not only did I feel uncomfortable going in there alone, the bartender whose name is Tabitha, decided to even more so make me feel like that by constantly looking at me and choosing not to wait on me; when a manager finally walked by me and then tried to get her to come over, she came over reluctantly. I'm sorry that I'm not some hot guy, and I was just a woman in there looking for lunch but she obviously did not want to wait on me. When I finally got in touch with the owner, he also could have cared less. I can see the profiling that Buffalo Wild Wings at this location is all about. They do do not want single women in there.  DISCRIMINATION at its finest!!!
Just like any chain restaurant. The food was good and our waitress was nice. The restaurant is probably the best part. Just a nicer looking Olive Garden.

Where to start? We drive 3 hours to get here to Cleveland several times a year due to lots of family in the area & we love this place... Hostess was friendly. Server was pleasant, polite & efficient. The food was excellent. The time from ordering until we received our food was short. Atmosphere was clean & pleasant. I was surprised to not see many photos of food here, so I took a lot to post...

I seriously love this place! We go to Carrabba's Italian Grill at least twice a month, and that's on the low end. I highly recommend any of the Marsala dishes: steak, chicken or pork. We have searched high and low for another Marsala dish that comes somewhat close to Carrabba's and NO ONE can touch it! 

They also have other delicious dishes like the Tag Pic Pac (what I normally get), and their house salad dressing is very good too. The staff is very friendly and willing to accommodate any order. 

The only reason that I gave this four stars instead of five is because they don't take reservations.

Love it!

I went here for the first time the Saturday of Memorial Day weekend. I get it, it's going to be a busy day. When I entered, nobody greeted me. I asked after about 20 min of waiting how long it would be for an acrylic fill. One woman responded- she told me to sit in a nail chair. I did, and waited nearly two more hours. I asked about three times how much longer it would be and nobody answered me. They even took two people before me. So I left. I went back the Tuesday after Memorial Day, thinking I would give them another chance. Again, nobody greeted me. Again, I had to ask how long of a wait it would be. They were somewhat honest and said 20 minutes, but that's typical of any salon. I waited an hour and a half. The only reason I haven't given this place a 1 star is because of three reasons: 1. they have a great selection of gel polish. 2. they did a superb job on my nails. 3. the nail technician Lynn is AWESOME! She totally put me at east even after I had waited an hour and a half. She was so, so sweet, kind, and genuine. I recommend this place solely for her.

My daughter called before going into this place and inquired about having her dark coloring stripped and re-dyed to dishwater blonde with blonder highlights. They said they can do it, have the supplies, come on in. She went... The lady had no clue what she was doing. Had to ask the employees where things were located. and they DID NOT have the stripping chemical. She told my daughter she'd be right back. (my daughter thought she went to the bathroom).. but she actually slipped out the back door and went to a store to buy stripping product leaving my daughter sitting there for over a half hour wondering what was going on... then she came back, put it haphazardly all in her hair... was very unprofessional, seemed confused...and my daughter was so scared, she LITERALLY stood up, walked out of the place without paying and the store-bought product still in her hair and went immediately to another salon which then charged her 250 dollars to fix what this other place had done to her hair color. (different shades ranging from white-blonde.. to orange... to dark red) RIDICULOUS. DO NOT GO HERE. THEY HAVE NO CLUE WHAT THEY'RE DOING WHEN IT COMES TO DYE JOBS

This location is good but can get busy at times. The night shift/overnight shift could use some work. Sometimes on the weekends the meal prep staff can get overwhelmed. There was an hour wait at one point. I start work between 2-3am and I usually stop in to grab a coffee or something quick to eat on the way to work. I went in last night and ordered a bagel with cream cheese which took about 15min to make. Seemed like they were more concerned with talking with eachother. There were only two orders ahead of mine, one which was ready as soon as i paid for mine. The guy at the checkout counter could give a statue a run for its money. He barely said a word and had a look as if he didnt want to be there. My bill should have come to around 7-8 bucks since I had handed him a coupon for 2 cans of grizly, my bagel and a drink. I gave him a 20 and he gave me back 10. I know I had gotten overcharged but at that point, I really didnt feel like arguing with someone who doesnt care about their job.

went there this past weekend...  I dont know what it is but every time we have gone to this one there are flies.. lol.. its just an annoying distraction while trying to eat.. I dunno.. not sure if anyone else has noticed it... we shower regularly so its not us :)   We had a great waiter and absolutely no complaints about the .. He was very good .. even removed a drink from our bill because we didn't like it... very cool.....  Bread is always good.. salad was fresh...   daughter loved her pasta and meatballs...  other daughter..kinda meh on the chicken fingers....  anyhow the wife and I both got the Penne Vodka seafood dish...  for me it was nothing all that special.. noodles seemed a bit mushy and overcooked... Wife really like it though.. so maybe I was just not feeling it... we ate the leftovers the next day for dinner and I enjoyed it more.. maybe because there were no flies .. who knows.....  dont think we will be back for a while.. unless the wife can talk me into it again ..  overall just a meh on the dinner.. superb service though

Typical towny bar, pretty friendly crowd. They have great wings (among other things) and we usually order take out for a lot of the browns games. The bar inside is fairly small and there isn't a whole lot of seating, even though there seems to be a lot of space that's not taken advantage of.

If your looking for a salad option to diet in place of rice and beans loaded with carbs do not go to this Chipotle. When I asked for a salad they said burrito so I repeated then they said bowl. Okay well this is what i got barely any lettuce on my along with my wife's order. It was a pitiful salad bowl or non tortilla burrito since they do not know what a salad is. It looked nothing like the salads they advertise on there website not even close. When I committed to staff then they gave me a bowl of lettuce so I can reassemble my along with my wife's salad at home. If I was going to go home and reassemble a salad I would have made it myself. If I could give less then 1 star I would.
Cara is the home furnishing guru. She is the person who inspired me to check out this place. I did not find too many great deals in here. Maybe I came on a few off days.

The service here is insanely slow. With as many people as they have working behind the counter you'd think it'd be fast. Guess again. Also one time we ordered 2 burrito bowls and they put the lid on half ass which in turn lead to it spilling everywhere on the ride home. We called to notify the manager of the issue and he gave us 48 hours to come back and get a replacement. Unfortunately we were not able to make it back.

I'm not a huge wing eater, but every once and awhile my wife gets a craving, so you know the saying..,compromise is key!  Anyways, the wings here are pretty good.  Try the Louisiana Rub, they are the best of the bunch and always come crispy with a nicely seasoned rub.  My only complaint is that the wings with sauce always seem like they should of been left to crisp up for a couple more minutes.  Sometimes they seem a little too mushy for my taste, but each his own.  This chain is new to the area, offering solid wings and service.

Been here a couple times- the bread with dipping oil is good enough. The Mezzaluna ravioli is super yummy! Both times the service was sooo slow which usually drives me up a wall but it was driving my mom up a wall so I actually found it entertaining.  Good enough to return for sure.

Some preliminary notes:
Sam's accepts Visa/MasterCard/Discover. BJ's and Costco do not.
Sam's has a pharmacy. Non-members can use it but get charged for the privilege.
This Sam's has a gas station. Members get a $0.05/gallon discount.
Bring your own bags/boxes. They don't have 'em.
Just because it's in bulk doesn't mean it's cheaper.

You can't help but be both amazed and disgusted with warehouse stores like Sam's. Nowhere on Earth can one witness the exorbitant excesses we as Americans are blessed with every day. Sam's is an Indiana Jones warehouse packed with everything. I'm pretty sure I saw the Ark of the Covenant crammed into a shopper's cart next to a 50-pack of Fruit Roll-Ups and 20 count Otis Spunkmeyer chocolate muffins. So what should you expect when you come visit Sam's Club? Here's a sampling:

-Gallon jugs of something called "extra heavy mayonnaise". I'm both intrigued and a little sickened.

-A toilet. Yes, you can purchase toilets here.

-Tires for your car. Mmmm, that new tire smell.

-A 70" 240Hz 1080p LCD flat panel TV. I don't want to want it, but I do.

-80oz of ranch dressing and 10lbs of wings. Can you say obesity epidemic?

-Engagement rings. Because nothing says you care like jewelry from Sam's Club.

-LED fireplaces. So cozy.

-A food court with an actual crowd of people eating in it. I had no idea that soft pretzels, hot dogs and soda inside a warehouse club was destination dining.

-An optical center. Is anyone else a little wary of buying glasses at a Wal-Mart company?

I won't bother going over all of the features and benefits of Sam's Club. If you want that go visit their website. You pay for a membership so you can buy the things you normally buy in multiples that may or may not actually save you money. Will it help your wallet? Maybe, maybe not. Individual results may vary.

I think that Sam's is really more for business owners than families anyway. Who the hell can use bulk quantities of fruit, bread and produce? However, if you're buying Snickers bars, beef jerky and Fanta in bulk for your family, I want to personally thank you for doing your part to destroy the healthcare infrastructure of this country. Why did I bother? How about a 40% generic prescription savings (Plus membership). That alone was worth the price.

You pretty much know what you're getting with Sam's Club. The parking lot is huge, the store is clean and organized, the workers we encountered were pretty friendly, the aisles are wide enough for the ginormous carts. It's exactly what you'd expect.

Nothing is really different about this Sams club compared to any other location I've been to on the east coast.  They have awesome deals in bulk and great prices on tires!  I've never bought tires from here but I've heard nothing but good things from my friend that has purchased tires from here.  I honestly can say that every time I come here I have to take a rotisserie chicken home! They are so big, juicy, and tender, how can anyone just turn away from these beauties! Plus it gives me an excuse why I didn't cook tonight!  They also have awesome deals on leggings for you ladies that love staying comfortable!  I'd definitely recommend this place to anyone who loves grocery shopping in bulk and saving big!

Just before the Browns game this past Sunday, my wife had a craving for a hamburger.  She asked me to go to the supermarket and buy some fresh ground hamburgers.  I countered by suggesting we visit a nearby restaurant, which she agreed to do.  We thought of BW3 and off she went.

I ordered a grilled chicken sandwich, fries, and Asian spicy chicken wings.  The wings were very tasty and they had just a bit of heat.  I really liked them and would definitely order them again.  The fries were tasty, but I gave them to my daughter because I also had a chicken sandwich.  The chicken was good, as I asked for lettuce, tomato and southwest ranch sauce.  The bun to meat ratio was a little too high.  I was wanting more chicken and less bun, but the sandwich was perfectly palatable.  There was enough lettuce on the thing for a small salad!  I tasted my son's chicken tender and it was very good too.

I'm sure we'll be back.

I'm here visiting from out of town and must say this is the worst dining experience at a Buffalo Wild Wings in my entire life. My server was extremely nice but lacked the professionalism you would expect as a consumer from a server. I had to ask to have the table cleared and I  couldn't tell you her name because she never told us. She was never around and I had to go find her every time I wanted something. I really felt bad that I interrupted her cause she really seemed like she was into watching the game. 

The worst thing is she had the audacity to ask me if I wanted my check now so that we could leave as soon as the game was over... it's was the third quarter with 4 minutes left. 

Thanks Brandi!
The employees are very friendly.  Store was clean and organized    Their were samples of food at various stations.

I just had some wings from here and awesome some great cuts of chicken and they cooked the chicken right crunchy and flavorful. My order was 10 minutes late but that's fine because the place just opened a week ago and all new businesses have hick ups . The reason I say this is the food quality was great blows those other two competitors out the sky . The inside very nice for dine in and clean . I will definitely be back finally a place that don't mess up chicken. Kudos wing stop welcome to the neighborhood.

We have become regulars here and come at least once a week to play trivia. We always sit at the bar and love the bartender Missy who always remembers our drinks when we sit down. :) Shes the best. The garlic parm wings are a must as well as the potato skins with cheese.

I enjoy this bar because of its food and cheap drinks!!! Downfall... All of Parma's glory playing horrible music of the juke box. Sometimes ya just want to listen to the game and not "Big Green Tractor"

Food is great but the serving area is a disaster!!
The female making burritos seems to be angry with life. Don't think I will be visiting this location again.

The boneless wings were crispy and a good size. We ordered a split of lemon pepper and garlic Parmesan. Not as flavorful as I would have thought, And these are dry, guess I should have asked because I do not like dry rub. Service was fast and pleasant, prices reasonably.

Always great good and the shift manager i always see working is a class act. I come in about once per week and although always busy they do a great job of providing consistent quality in their food from one visit to the next. My last visit was a bout three weeks ago and I witnessed a rude ridiculous disrespectful customer verbally attacked multiple employees with no provocation. Shift manager calmly diplomatically asked her to step to the side with him so they can discuss the issue. for more than 20 minutes while I sat there and ate my lunch he professionally and patiently spoke with this raving lunatic genuinely trying to resolve whatever issues she thought she was having. Today was my first return trip since that visit, and it was that same shift manager who was working the cash register, I took the opportunity to give him props on his patience and professionalism he seems like a genuinely nice individual and chipotle should be happy to have him on their team!

Ordered from here last night. Not sure how difficult it should be to make the food from a chain restaurant but this store has severe difficulties. The rice had water and was soggy/clumped together. The chicken had no flavor. The carnitas has no flavor. The salsa has no flavor. Im not sure why they don't season the food here. It is the last time I will ever go here.

Was looking for a place, any place for a dive bar meal and place to watch the CWS. Glad I found this. After reading the other reviews this was my only real choice in the area. It was June 28, 2018 and I sat at the "outdoor bar" they have built into a breezeway between the main building and a storage building. It functions perfect as the slight breeze was perfect shelter from the heat and I never recalled any road noise. 

Started with a Yuengling draft from Jessica. The keg immediately ran out and rather than asking me to change my order or wait, she ran to the inside bar and got my pour without my expecting it. Menu and specials all looked great but I read about and asked Jessica if she would recommend the Wet 7 Pepper Wings and she let me know they were her fav. Ordered up and nobody was proven a liar. They were outstanding. Some of the best I've ever had.

My friendly neighbor had some great looking sliders and his wife had a "big salad". Every meal I saw plated looked great and the patron seemed to love it. I had a second beer (she ran inside again) before they changed the outdoor keg and finished with a mixed drink. 

It was popular inside and out. I couldn't recommend this place more highly if you are looking for the friendly neighborhood dive joint with nice staff and great food.

The wings are good and the staff is nice. It's just that there is always a long wait no matter what you order...including water. Some days it would be packed and I understand why there would be a wait but other days it's like I'm the only one in there but it still takes them a while. Don't get me wrong the food is good it's just not one of my top choices

I called and scheduled appointments for myself, my sister and 13 year old niece to have pedicures and then 1 gel fill manicure and 2 full set manicures.  I then explained the 2 adults would be getting our eyebrows done and one haircut shampoo and blow out style.   Jenny the manager said "sure come in we make sure we get it all done together" I wanted to make it a nice experience since they never had a pedicure.  I felt odd that the manager said just come in so when I got to my sisters house I called and spoke with Jenny again and told her we were on her way and would be there in 20 minutes.  The pedicures started out well only my poor sister's was half the time of mine and my nieces.  Then we were told to go ahead and get our eyebrows done since the 3 nail techs working just tool a client. We explained we would wait so we could stay together and talk and laugh but we were basically told if you want the waxing we had to do it then. While my sister was getting her brows waxed they told me i would get ny hair done.  So she started my hair and Jenny the manaher took  my niece and gave her a basic massage without the gel nail full set. The lady cut my har, then washed it and was going to send me out with wet hair. I reminded her I was paying for cut, blow out and style so with an attitude she used the blow dryer and my hai r was straight with no body or bump on the ends. By this time my sister was so angry they failed to do things the way we asked we left without getting our nails done.  I have had minor issues here before but this was the breaking point. When I confronted Jenny the manager she said it was my fault for wanting a hair cut.  Well your so called spa provides all these services. What a joke.  Waste of money. I had to take them to a better spa and I won't be back there again for sure.  Incompetent, arrogant, lazy and ridiculously rude workers.  Never again.

Well we decided to go to Sam's one day to check it out. Being a BJs Wholesale member we decided to go see what Sam's was about. 

We got a free membership for the day. They told us we could buy things there with the card. They neglected to tell us we had to pay a fee when we got to the register if we purchased anything. We ended up telling her to cancel the order because we were not told we would have to pay a fee in order to get the few things in our cart. Needless to say we won't be back.

I can no longer shop here. You are greatly understaffed. My grocery shopping experience takes twice as long compared to anywhere else. How long until I need to go behind the counter and slice my own Deli products? Your prices are no lower than anyone else. Secondly I am not saving anything by bagging and ringing up my own products at check out. I will be going to Whole foods from now on, I will save time and be relieved from the frustration of being my own clerk at check out. How about this for for incentive? Reduce my cost by 3%-5% for having to check out and bag my own goods?

This store is awful. Do whatever you can to avoid going here on Fridays between 3:00 and 8:00. First of all its their busiest time, but they never have enough people working the registers. There are 17 resister lanes and two people working them. The same goes for holidays and any major Cleveland sporting event. They are super high priced too. You are better of going to Marc's.

I dislike this store. Its small and cramped. The layout of the aisles and food are horrible compared to other GE's. I believe the last time I saw baby mixed in with trash bags in the aisle. Confusing! The parking lot is a pain also. Could be better.

I don't think I've ever had worse service. My girlfriend, roommate and I walked right in and were sat immediately. After sitting for almost 10+ minutes the manager came over to inform us that drinks were on the house and asked if we'd like some. 10+ minutes later our three coffees and one coke arrived minus the coke we ordered. 15+ minutes later food and aforementioned coke was delivered. Waitress (Latasha) forgot to ask what flavor muffin my girlfriend wanted and then did, delivered the muffin and latasha told us it was a,"fake muffin" because they didn't bake it properly. When all was said and done I think I can honestly say I'll never go to Perkins again. Ever.

Stink Stink Stink!!!! Smells like a portable outdoor park toilet!

Arrived at around 9:35pm and inside smelled like sewage.
My wife and I was turned off by the smell.
As I waited for another 15 minutes, now it's 9:50 and I'm still waiting with only 3 customers in line, in front of me.
About now I'm not smelling any food, just sewage smell. 
If we decided to dine in most of the dining room chairs were on top of a table.

We decided to just leave!!!

I'm getting kind of disappointed in this place.
I don't think they will ever be the same 10 years ago.

Never been a big fan of this Sam's.  It tends to have run-of-the mill choices (not nearly as nice as Mentor's nor Elyria's Sam's Club) and the patrons resemble homeless people.  

However, there is a redeeming factor.  The Pharmacy staff is the epitome of customer service.  Their genuine concern and speedy actions are to be commended.  Thank you, Sam's Club Pharmacy for being crazy awesome!!

Have previously had good meals here. Ben is a fine server (on my previous visit).  Friday seems to have a very abbreviated menu to the point I nearly left to find a more varied menu.. All pasta and pizza and fish...owing to it being Friday.  No non pasta entrees. Ordered wine to be brought a small carafe and told I could drink out of that because no wine glasses were clean. On the plus side the server gal did bring a clean wine glass out eventually when I made a big enough stink. No broiled fish but one entry that was baked...guess that will have to do. Clearly what I have learned is not to come here on Friday night as the abbreviated menu makes it not worth coming....maybe another njght? Well...One more try before I write this place off.

.....ok i just got done with the Baked Cod and it was quite tasty.  Just disappointed  that the menu was not what I was expecting. ..I was little harsh in the above paragraphs. ..food was good. Vote up from two to three stars....

First opportunity to blast a chain restaurant.  if Chipotle has ever established quality momentum they have scorched the carnitas masses.

I recall when Chipotle first busted with their carefully marketed circuits. nearly everyone garnered praise for their approach. The popular suburban and polished urban lunch break. The times I have been to Chipotle I believe I am marginalized in a goofy focus group pyramid marketing scheme. This review is not at all targeted as I believe an overstuffed burrito when prepared correctly is one of the most desirable meals on earth.

This location in Cleveland, Brooklyn draws venom. Saturday afternoon and polished new 'popular urban' music is far too loud. Songs with vaguely Spanish motifs spiked with some modern sterile recording punch together with new slinky pogo rock, far too loud. Chipotle seems to explicitly employ younger people so as to motivate you from any persuasion that their environment is anything but insufferably lame and contrived.

I dislike them. This location has broad window view of Plain Dealer industrial printing facility. The view combined with atmosphere of restaurant makes a strange kind of awkward. Plain Dealer is basically in the dumps as a news source and the view made experience feel goofy. Reliably the Tiedeman Keybank workforce and hotel visitors back up lines out the door. I do not understand how Chipotle at this stage of their business maturity can actually do so well. Their food at this location and many others   has become less and less quality and they have steadily shifted increases with their prices. I recall when vegetable burrito was $4.75 and now $6.25 (less than four years?)  

I could write more but why bother. Does anyone eat this food other than to feel bloated and fall asleep?

We ordered pizza a few weeks after they opened.  Really expensive for what you get, which reminded us of Pizza Hut, and that isn't a good thing.  Haven't gone back, we live in Brooklyn so we travel to Oregon which has a few better pizza options that are less expensive and more authentic.

So I've always driven past this tavern but never thought about stopping in and I honestly don't know why!

My husband had the idea of coming here on a weekday to grab some dinner and a beer.  They have plenty of specials every day so make sure you check the board behind the bar!  

Coincidentally, my friends were actually at the bar as well finishing up their mussels, which were on special that day.  They highly recommended it to my husband and me, but we were craving burgers and sandwiches.

The husband ordered the French onion sandwich and I ordered the Philly cheese steak!  When they both came out, it looked like heavens gates opening up! The bread was so soft and hugged the meat so lovingly!  We both had a handful of meat in our sandwiches which made every bite enjoyable!  They were not shy with the amount of cheese they put on there too!! The sandwiches do not come with a side so we just ordered one side, which I'm glad we did because we were already getting full from the sandwich alone!

The service was great and very attentive!  She made sure we quenched our thirst for some booze while helping us decide on what to try for being first timers.  Would definitely come back here to try something else on the menu!

Lunch time on a Friday at noon and this place has NO GUACAMOLE!!!!!  None prepared in the entire restaurant. 

Are you serious. Two customer in front of me in line as well as three behind me asked for guacamole.

This is very disappointing since we had to wait in line for 25 mins to place our order.

No rating yet as we are the very first customer! Woo!!! Service is fantastic so far. Huckleberry lemonade is delicious. Okay, my son and I happened to stop by for lunch. We were defiantly outnumbered by the staff. Quit a few people stopped by to ask how the food was, top off drinks and just to check how we were doing. 

I ordered the Mediterranean salad no meat, it was delicious! Fresh, lots of flavor and with pieces of warm pita and hummus it was what I needed to feel satisfied and full. 

My son ordered the boneless wings, jerked and Asian spice. He loved them, I had a taste, let me just say - I'm more of a traditional, bone in, buffalo wing type of girl. 

We will definitely be going back. Loved the large screen TVs. You won't miss the view of any game in this place. Try it out. It just opened and will most likely have a few bumps. They are off to a fabulous start!
Homemade delicious food. Chips , pierogis, wings and shrimp is delicious. The place is pretty cool and the patio is awesome.

Went there on a Tuesday.. My husband & I sat at the bar.  Tabatha, was tending bar.  She could not have been better !! Very sweet & knowledgeable about the menu!!! I ordered the chicken Picata & my husband ordered the chicken parm..the whole dinner experience was great!!! Can't wait to go back !!

I took my sister here for her 20th birthday and ordered spinach dip 40 wings and tacos. 

The spinach dip was GROSS !!!! It tasted like they re heat it in a microwave it was burnt at the bottom of the cup...  I asked for the dish to be removed and to be removed off the check. The server acted as if I was crazy. No manager ever stopped by to see how our table was doing after the complaint. Smh then she didn't even get the item took off the bill
Costumer service here sucks

My husband and I didn't have such a great experience here.  Maybe its because they are a newer location and they are still getting the kinks out.  We got there and didn't get to order drinks until we ordered our food, which was quite a while.  My husband had ordered a Pepsi and when it came, it was pure sugar (totally gross).  The waitress was nice enough to allow him to change drinks because it was so bad.

We ordered an appetizer, but the appetizer came with the food, not before.  I told my husband he should have sent it back, but he wanted to try the fried mushrooms so we kept them.  I got the grilled cheese sandwich with boneless buffalo chicken wings on it.  I am so sorry to say that I didn't really like it.  I really though it would taste good, but it was either the chicken or the cheese that just didn't mesh with the rest of the sandwich. 

 I had also ordered a side of onion rings in lieu of the fries.  When my food came it came with fries.  When I explained that I had ordered onion rings, the server pulled an order of onion rings off the tray and gave it to me.  Apparently, my waitress ordered my meal with fries and an extra order of onion rings on the side.  I can't complain too much about this though, because she didn't charge me for the fries (which was good because I didn't eat them anyway).  

So all in all, the food was sub par and the service was pretty bad.  Mind you the waitress was nice and I really think she had good intentions, but if I am truthful then I have to say that this place pretty much sucks.  I say if you want good food, good drinks, and good service, go to the Winking Lizard or Quaker Steak and Lube.

Carrabba's beats the Olive Garden hands down.

The first time I ate at Carrabba's was during a free luncheon sponsored by a local radio station.  I went with the chicken marsala, an old classic.  The flavor was nothing shy of spectacular.  I was really surprised by how much flavor it packed and the chicken was very tender.

The next time, my wife brought me home some carry-out.  She surprised me with a pork chop and some mashed potatoes.  But this wasn't just any pork chop, it was over an inch thick and it was SMOKED!  In case I wasn't clear, I found a delicious, SMOKED pork chop in Brooklyn, Ohio.  OMG, this the THE BEST pork chop I've ever eaten.  The amazing flavor actually reminded me of a steak.  The drawback is, it's only served seasonally...otherwise, I'd eat it like once a month.  The mashed potatoes were also excellent.

Since we were so impressed with the tastes, we took my in-laws to dinner at Carrabba's.  We normally take them to Olive Garden because it's my mother-in-law's favorite restaurant here in the states.  Needless to say, she now has a new favorite restaurant!

Wow, excellent food, good service and a full bar, what more could you want?  This place is great!

http://www.carrabbas.com/index.aspx
I had the fish tacos. There were extremely average for fish tacos. Which makes them slightly above average for a wings place's fish tacos. I would eat them again.

A perfectly worn brown, leather couch for $200? Yes, please!

Especially one that would have originally been anywhere from $2-3,000. 

The Cleveland Furniture Bank is a wonderful, secret weapon against spending tons of cash-money on brand new duds for your pad. We're talking about a full warehouse of gently used furniture, decor, appliances and even some clothes. It's thrifting at it's best--mostly because they don't realize it when they have something really nice. And let me tell you, the prices show it! 

Is there crap? Yes, lots of it. But when you find something awesome for a spectacular deal, it shines through like a damn firecracker. But I actually feel like there's a lot of in between stuff, too. You know, things you carry around with you the whole time and contemplate buying, but for some reason you talk yourself out of it? 

Anyways, folks from all over Northeast Ohio donate furniture here and CFB cultivates the usable stuff all in one place. There's a little divide between people who think you can negotiate the prices here and the employees denying you every time you ask. I say, it never hurts to ask--I'm sure they hear it all the time. 

A few things to keep in mind is that they DO accept credit/debit cards (yay!) and they'll even hold your purchase for up to three days until you can pick it up. I'm sure you've already realized that this isn't the kind of place that will deliver. They do have people there to help you get the item(s) out to whatever transport you have. On top of that, we needed some blankets to cover our couch and they gave us three!

If you like the hunt of finding incredible deals and furniture with a bit of history to it, then head out here. Take it from your thrifty-elf--It's worth a good look around!

Mmmm Chipotle.  Every chipotle has that "corporation standard" feel to it.  The stainless steel, burgundy red, modern aztecan artwork and all are set up with the same fashion.  This Chipotle's layout is super disorganized.

When you first walk in, you're immediately greeted with a line going perpendicular to you, and there's also this weird curvy section that pretty much serves no realistic purpose.  If you come here during a rush, you will be waiting in line in front of the door and standing right next to people eating.

The food was alright, just tastes like the Chipotle standard.  The steak was cooked a bit rarer than most Chipotles so if you like it that way you'll find it tasty here!

I used to go to the one in Strongsville with my Drama Class at Tri-C, but since I live closer to Brooklyn...I had their wings! They're actually tasty, but I will say this...I won't eat anything with habanero peppers again...ouch!

There's gas here for members - you get a 5 cent discount. You must first insert your membership card but you do not have to also pay with the credit card that your membership card is. There is an option to insert a second card as a payment method. While there is no separate store for the gas station there is always an attendant at this gas station should you need help and in warm weather he or she is usually out of his booth walking around. They also keep it pretty clean for a gas station - it's the only station in town where the trash cans aren't overflowing (and where they have lids). The store is nice as well. There is a covered area for cars to pull under so you can load your basket without getting it all wet. Currently there is some massive construction project going on but it affects Brookpark Rd more than Tiedeman Road and affects the adjacent Walmart more than the Sams.
Wine Dinners are the best!! Ask about it and attend! Great service, great food and awesome wine pairings!

I haven't written a review for Sam's Club in seven years, so it is time for an update. Yeah, so not much has changed, other than the store layout. Sam's is very consistent, I'll give em that. One of my favorite things to buy here is clothes. You can find a good deal on generic jeans, shorts, and shirts. 

Did you know that Member's Mark bottled water is only 7 cents per bottle?  That's not bad. I believe it is the cheapest bottled water that you'll find - anywhere.

I bought two Cleveland Cavaliers hoodies at a decent price and they made excellent Christmas gifts. In fact, both people who received them said they "love" the hoodie. One even said, "this is now my favorite hooodie!"  Go me!

You can't find cheaper gas prices at other gas stations. In fact, there are two gas stations next door to Sam's and nine out of ten times, Sam's is cheaper with their standard five cent per gallon discount. Oh, and Sam's just installed brand new gas pumps. The only issue I have with getting gas is the chatty people who patrol the gas pumps. I just want to get my gas and get out. I guess Wal-Mart is all about loss prevention.

Anyway, I have a plus membership that I share with my mom, which actually earns us money. It more than pays for the annual fee. In fact, we make hundreds of dollars each year just by shopping at Sam's. We can use the kickbacks toward our membership too! Oh, and I can get into the club hours earlier than regular members as a perk of the plus membership.

I wish Sam's offered a better selection of products like Costco. One thing that has changed for the better is I can buy one loaf of bread or one pack of tortillas or one bag of chips. They used to require you to buy two.

We come here for the wing special! They are consistently good and if you like greasy fried chick with awesome sauces this should be your weekday getaway. I always get the $2 electric lemonades and they recently added lime ritas, my other guilty pleasure. The ladies here are super friendly and have been here for years!

My boyfriend and I went here on a Monday, and we we chose to sit at the bar where we were served promptly. We're foodie types, but we're not food snobs by any means. We went to Carrabba's because we were craving an unhealthy chain or diner type style of food (and I had a giftcard!). The service was fine, despite being slightly irritated that the bartender suggested that my ID was fake, since I'm young-ish and I have a an out-of-state ID. The Chianti was the special, and I enjoyed it. His Margarita was too sour for him, but the bartender set the expectation that it was a mix, so that's on us. We ordered quite a few things, and we didn't like any of it. The salad was coated and dripping with dressing. The minestrone was flavorless, and I suspect it wasn't cooked for very long, because the vegetables were undercooked. Plus, I like pasta in my minestrone, and it lacked that. The calamari was breaded with a breading that would be comparable to chicken strip breading,  and the squid itself was "meh". My lobster mac-and-cheese had a thin cheese sauce that didn't coat the noodles, and the lobster was terrible: it tasted like it was from a can-- very fishy smelling and tasting. He had an Alfredo and shells dish with chicken. I thought it was better than my dish, but he barely touched it. The sauce was runny, and the chicken (and the entire dish, for that matter) tasted and smelt frozen, like a frozen dinner. The food we ordered is pretty simple to do right, so there is no excuse for how bad it was. I understand why a chain would use frozen food, and I'd accept that if the establishment wasn't charging me over $15 for it. There are fine dining Italian restaurants with comparable prices, so if you're looking for good Italian, you certainly should look elsewhere. If you're looking for some fried food and some unhealthy, home-style cheesy dishes, buy a box of mac-n-cheese and bag of frozen fried items from Giant Eagle--because that would be better than eating at Carrabba's. Oh yeah, I also woke up in the middle of the night with indigestion, and I puked the following morning.  If you don't dig food poisoning, I suggest dining elsewhere. :)

Don't bother calling Sam's for the photo department.  They don't ever answer.  I called and waited on line for 17 minutes by clock on computer screen.  The membership desk FINALLY answered and transferred the call to the photo department plus would page overhead to take call.  No answer for another 7 minutes.  I called back to the membership department and asked if there was a problem at the photo department.   The clerk said she could see the man standing next to the phone and would transfer the call but she would watch to see that it was picked up.  Not picked up.  I waited another 4 minutes and got a message that my call was very important and to hold on.  Waited another 4 minutes.  Hung up.  Terrible service, at least at this Sam's.
If you are going for lunch be prepared to wait. The servers are great but the kitchen is slow. So if your not in a hurry its fine. If you only have a hour for lunch avoid the place!
Excellent service and food! Bree at the bar was awesome!  Try the pomegranate martini! Magnifico.

They always have great prices for gas and their car wash is definitely my favorite!! I don't really come here to eat but I always take my car here for a wash.  They have 3 options for your wash and I always pick the ultimate because I want my car waxed.  This place is just like any sheets with gas station food but also give their costumers an option to order food either inside the gas station or through their drive-thru.

Made my debut here with my friends from grade school from back in the day. wasn't too loud for a sports bar, which is a good thing. I dont like to scream while trying to have a conversation. We split the nacho app with chicken amongst ourselves. wasnt too bad. Maybe a lil pricey at $9.50. Next were the wings. We got the large 20 piece. It was nice that we were able to divide it into 4 different flavors. I chose the original "Hot" buffalo flavor. They didnt disappoint in flavor or heat. My one complaint about them tho, is that they could be bigger. Ive had larger wings at a cheaper price at other places. Lastly, I had the fish tacos. ($9.50 also) Decent size portion as you get 2 of them. You also get to pick a wing sauce to have them drizzle on them. I picked the spicy garlic. Very good. Our server was named Aimee, I think. She did an excellent job running around for the 6 at our table. I would return here for more wings, but maybe only on a Tuesday or Thursday when they have wing specials.

I normally go to the bw3 by my house but being on the opposite side of town I figured I'd stop in. 

Food-nachos came out with raw chicken. It happens. 

Service--horrific. Female bartenders were too busy flirting with the male server who was running around like a mad man. When he told them he didn't have time to play around they snickered and said "dude you have four tables!"

Really? You had three people at your bar and I had to wait for refills each time. 

Overall not impressed. Won't be back
Just a good go-to bar. During the summer the outdoor bar is pretty great. Just wish they had more seating. Fills up pretty quick.
Really great service! You can reserve tables! Yummy food! Can't wait to return! Had the gyro burger!

Friends said too try this for breakfast and I'm glad I did! 730 on a Monday morning it was pretty empty, so we were confident we would get great service. We did.
Food was good portions were big and waitress was great.
More expensive than Denny's but worth it.
Nice place, good environment to watch games. Wing nights are Mon & Wed.  The wings are delicious but the service is pretty slow even when they aren't that busy.

It's my neighborhood Giant Eagle, very clean and the employees are very helpful!
Neat thing is my core items cost is on par of the discount places and the bonus I get for using my Giant Eagle card for gas savings is sweet!!!
But be forewarned!!!!!   Many items carried by GE can be much costlier...
Do your homework peoples!!!!!!!

The slowest and dirtiest chipotle I have ever been to.  Come here for work and every time (3 times). All different times of day... Soo slow.  The line is longer than walmart lines.  So many people working behind the counter and no one is happy or customer service oriented.

We decided on this place for sown thing quick to eat before we went out. Food was great. The Carnavale pizza and sausage and lentil soup were spot on. They have the classic bread with olive oil and spice.

Service was pretty good, atmosphere is okay for a chain restaurant. If you want a romantic ambiance might want to look elsewhere. Good food at a good price.

This is by far the worst Chipotle I have ever been to. Line is always 20 plus people long because the staff is so slow. My burrito bowl was thrown together with zero care. They were out of chips. I was going to eat in the restaurant but it was so dirty I left. 

I waited over 20 minutes in line. You can have your food at a regular restaurant in that time. 

This place sucks. I will be hitting Garfield or Rockside from now on.

There was a line past the door at 2015 on a Friday. But the order I placed and prepaid for via the iPhone app they had ready (correctly) for me when I walked in. I walked past the line, was greeted by the cashier with a 'are you Ben?', and was given my food. East. Fast. And I'll do it again.

I treated my parents to dinner at Carrabba's the other night for my mom's 56th birthday.  

The waiter was a little strange or whatever, but he was cool.  He had a really interesting Irish, New York accent.  

Anyway, I had the Chicken Marsala, my wife ordered Angel Hair Pasta (whole wheat), my daughter ordered the kids' Spaghetti and Meatballs, and my parents both ordered Chicken Parmesan.  I had the luxury of tasting everyone's dish and my Chicken Marsala was the best by far.  It was so delicious with fresh cooked mushrooms, perfectly cooked and seasoned chicken and delicious mashed potatoes.  This is comfort food to me.

My next favorite dish was my parents' Chicken Parmesan.   It was very good, but the portions seemed a bit small.  We're American, we want more than we can consume at one sitting!  My daughters spaghetti was average and my wife's pasta would've been good if it weren't for the grainy wheat pasta she ordered.

For dessert, we ordered a chocolate brownie with cream topping, which was freaking amazing.  It was super rich like the Godiva Chocolate Cheesecake from The Cheesecake Factory.  So delicious!

Overall, it was a great meal.  With tip, the bill came to $110.

We'll be back.

Don't bother with this Chipotle. This has to be one of the worst customer service experiences ever. My husband and I ordered online for pickup last week and we got there before the time we specified but there wasn't much of a line and several employees were just standing around. They knew a pick up order was waiting and continued to just ignore my husband. When he patiently asked again, the young lady was very rude back and said that our order wasn't available until the time specified(which was 5 minutes from then and we had picked the earliest time available). Why would you just stand around when you know the person picking up is there? I will not be returning and given the other reviews, it might be time for Chipotle to hire new employees.
Love shopping here....if your gonna be a member, get the plus membership and get extra privlages... go to Groupon and get it for 45.00 for the 100.00 membership.

The portions at this restaurant are a 1/3 of what other Chipotle's offer. They didn't give me beans because " you didn't say you wanted them" I was so frustrated by trying to get a decent serving of rice I wasn't thinking. I should have taken a video of the lack of food they were trying to give people. When I questioned the girl at the register I was told the managers didn't want to run out of food. Most chipotles are making food as there customer demand warrants. I will never go back to this chipotle.

I don't know what it is but this Chipotle is very consistent with their taste... It always tastes good!! I usually order the steak and out of all the Chipotles I have been to, it is very rare for me to get a steak burrito with a ton of fat pieces unlike the Chipotle in Parma where every bite was more of a bite of steak fat rather than any lean meat.. The only reason why I gave this place a 3 star rating is because their bathroom is never as consistent as their food... Sometimes it makes me think twice about eating here because their bathroom is constantly dirty.. But since the food is always good, I usually just ignore the dirty facility... I just hope and pray that their cooking utensils don't match it.. Anywho! I would highly recommend this Chipotle for great consistency of their taste! Ahh-mayyyy-zing!

Stopped by BW3 for dinner and a Cavs game the other night. The place was packed, but there were still a couple tables available and we were seated immediately. I ordered a chicken salad and some Honey BBQ chicken wings. My wife ordered a chicken quesadilla and we shared some fried Wisconsin cheese curds.

The cheese curds were hot and tasty with just a bit of crunch from the deep fried batter. They were very tasty and I couldn't stop eating them. The sauce they are served with was sweet and creamy. I liked it a lot.

My salad was very filling and tasty. I chose grilled chicken to top it, which was doused in medium Buffalo sauce with a side of ranch dressing. The ingredients in the salad were fresh and it was plenty for a meal. 

The chicken wings were excellent. No complaints there. The chicken is never frozen, which I believe helps give them such a good flavor. Of course, the Honey BBQ sauce was excellent too, but the quality of the chicken is the key to BW3's great wings.

My wife really like the cheese curds too. She didn't finish her quesadilla, so I polished it off the next day for breakfast and I think it was tasty, even the day after. 

The tall craft beers we had were on point. This was our first dine-in visit as a family to this location, even though it's right around the corner from our house. We'll probably be back, but we generally try to avoid bar food while dining out, which is why I ordered a salad.

We all ordered our food, service at this point was good. My chk Marsalauce looked as if the Sous Chef really screwed up, slightly burnt sauce n little to no mushrooms , terrible, sent back.. My wife had meatballs, served cold with no sauce and a roll torn open! This was not a good experience and would suggest the food for a Dog ! Dinners beware ,!!!!

Nice job on the fill for the acrylic nails and very quick.  But the tech left for 20 min in the middle of my appointment with no explanation. None of the other techs looked in on me to step in or finish up while she was gone.  I could have been finished by the time she got back. 

The nail art here is not good.  If you're looking for a fill and polish you'll be fine. But the nail art and service are seriously lacking.

Shoppers...I feel this is my HOME...heck, my Mortgage is Cheaper..lol...other than that The Manager ,, Tim...is OUTSTANDING!...he is visable actually working, greets all his Shoppers, seems he knows everybody by name.. I am disabeled and need a electric cart, well he saw me pull in and bam..curb side service!... and he has a great staff that most folks overlook... Billy, he is the Porter..he is in his 60s, 70s...and he keeps the place spotless..I have seen him in some places cleaning I would NEVER CLEAN!!///as in 1 day someone grafittied the mens room with poop...all over the walls, floors..etc..and he cleaned it with a smile, if he does not see his customers for more than 2 days he worries!...always asking about my legs getting better...how is my wife..etc...he is awesome!..then the next 3 are the employees who keep the carts clean and in the store...Joyce, Johnny and Suzzane...all 3 hard workers, friendly, caring...a true Joy...these 4 are the biggest reason i come...as , well...I wont say, but these 4 worth more than they are paid..i am sure!
Worst experience I ever had. It took 25 minutes to get a drink and our food was cold. Horrible service as well. They complained their manager was horrible.

1/31/16

I had an horrible experience at Carrabas On Tiedeman Rd! We had a party of 12. We waited for 30 minutes for a table despite the table at the bar being available the entire time. After we were seated it took 30 minutes just to put in a order for drinks. It took an hour before we were even able to put in our order for our meal. It took 2 hours before we received our meal. We were not given refills for our drinks. We had appetizers that were ordered and never arrived. After waiting 2 hours for the food, one of the kids orders never arrived. He had to wait an additional 20 minutes for his food. We were not offered fresh Parmesan for our pasta, when I requested it. It took Jared 10 minutes to bring some to the table. The pasta was luke warm and the sauce had started to congeal. I'm not sure if this was due to the kitchen being slow or our waiters inattentiveness! I'm leaning towards the latter

The waiter Jared was a complete jerk for the entire meal! When he finally brought bread to the table after the appetizers were out, he slammed it on the table. We saw him on several occasions refuse to bring items to the table after being requested for assistance by AJ. He refused to bring over our checks. And was completely rude! There were two waiters assigned to the table but Jared lack of cooperation made the job even more difficult for AJ. 

If you are having dinner with more than 2 people I do not recommend this location at all! And if you are seated in Jared's section, you should immediately request to move!

If your anything like me, you HATE ordering the same thing over & over again(even of it's your fav & you know it's delicious). 

I first went here with an ex-boyfriend, I had ordered one of the specials that day. Our server comes out with our food, everything was delicious..halfway through our meal the manager came over & said our server had given me the veal version of my meal instead of chicken. No biggie, It was still good. The manager then boxed up my right meal, a full salad, and desert to take home. They were sooooooooo apologetic, which makes me happy to know they have incredible customer service!

I brought in a coupon and they refused to accept it, they said it was fake.  I even showed the Manager I printed it off from their corporate website.  He still ignored me.  What a jerk.  The portion sizes for lunch are far too small and overpriced. This place needs work when it comes to the whole customer experience.  The decor is nice, but looks only go so far.

My grandson and I had lunch here on Mothers Day(he is very thoughtful and only 17) we started with Calamari as our app, which was prepared perfectly. Our server recommended the pasta weezie and was very pleased, have never had a bad meal and on this visit our server was the best and very attentive!

Friendly servers, great specials, clean, outdoor patio- what more can you ask for? We had the best hot dog in town ($3.50), meatball sub and beer. All perfectly done and beer was cold. Will definitely return.

Not one employee cares. There can be 5 people in front of you and the wait time will be 30 minutes. Once you reach the counter you soon realize they are out of at least 1 item. Sometimes there isn't a cashier for 15 minutes at a time while 8 other employees stand around in the back. I live 3 minutes away and save time by driving to the parmatown location. This place sucks

They used to be good... 20 years ago... first the food went downhill... then of course the awful service and awful attitudes from the employees followed suit.  not blaming the employees, they are just a victim of the owner's neglect.  Avoid this place at all cost, spend your money where it's appreciated.

So what they turned corporate?  So what they weigh their wings instead of traditional 6-12-24 wing combos?  It's B Dubs....and the food is always good. One of the really great things about this chain is the daily wing/food specials are available to go. Most places won't let you have wing night to go...not here. Boneless wing Thursday's to go thank you. I call it BW3's and I prob always will. The location is great and the TV's are even better. Staff always friendly and they don't play music during Cleveland sporting events.

Good place, good food. Sheetz always manages to be an exceptional gas station. The car wash is horrible and on busy days you could be waiting 40 to 58 minutes. How long is the wait for their slow barley capable car wash??? Consider the fact that I just wrote this entire review on my iPhone while waiting in line

Excellent pizza and pasta, plus great Friday Fish Fry..all in little Brooklyn. Try the White Pizza, so good I swear they have the best alfredo sauce I've ever had. The spinach and artichoke dip is to die for. Portions are average but you will never leave hungry at Angelo's. Service is good, keep in mind this is not fast food so be patient and enjoy a nice dinner.

LOVE THIS PLACE.....sure is a great localy "towny" bar
Price: Cheap
Parking: Ample free parking
Food: FANTASTIC....try the fried bologne sandwich.
Service: Fast and friendly

THE SKINNY:  Get your ass here and try it out.  You cant beat the food, prices, service and location.
